loans.name: Jose Vitelio

texts.es:
José, vive con su esposa y tienen un hijo de dos años, él se dedica a la agricultura, lo inicio cuando era joven y ayudaba a su padre, aprendió el proceso y hoy en día es el trabajo que le ayuda para darle a su familia la alimentación, los cultivos los realiza en terreno alquilado, no tiene un horario fijo.
El solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos agrícolas, preparara la tierra, e iniciar la siembra, comprara abono y fertilizantes, esta compra le permitirá trabajar adecuadamente y realizar el cultivo con la esperanza de obtener una buena cosecha.
Los sueños de José son crecer y obtener una buena cosecha, para poder comercializar una parte y otra para el consumo de la familia.
texts.en:
José is a farmer who lives with his wife and 2 year-old son.  He started farming when he was young and used to help his father.  He learned the process and now this is the work that helps him to feed his family.  He grows his crops on rented land and doesn't work fixed hours.

José is requesting a loan to buy agricultural supplies, prepare his land and start sowing his crops.  He will buy manure and fertilizers.  This purchase will allow him to work properly and grow his crops in the hope of obtaining a good harvest.

José's dreams are to grow and obtain a good harvest.  He will sell some of his crops and the rest will be eaten by his family.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase meat, milk and grocery items.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is married with 4 children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Rosie is 43 years old and has one child who is in school.

Rosie has a souvenir sales business in the Philippines. Rosie requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more materials for her souvenir-making business.

Rosie has been in this business for 11 years. In the future, Rosie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her child to college.

loans.use: to purchase more materials for souvenir-making business.

loans.name: Balvina

texts.es: Balvina tiene 33 años, es una madre de familia muy amorosa y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Néstor de 38 años y sus 3 queridos hijos, a quienes cuida con mucho amor y cariño en el caserío de Cumutay. La actividad económica de la familia es la agricultura. Desde que formó su familia, comenzó a poner en práctica todas las enseñanzas de sus padres. Su esposo siempre le apoyaba en el cuidado y las decisiones de los cultivos. Recuerda que hace 20 años, compró unos terrenos en los cuales pudiera sembrar papa, arveja y maíz. Actualmente esos terrenos los sigue trabajando, pero ahora son mucho más productivos, ya que sus sembríos son de muy buena calidad. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la relación tan cercana que tiene con la tierra, además disfruta mucho viendo sus sembríos crecer. Ahora ella tiene que dedicarse a tiempo completo, ya que gracias a la geografía del lugar; el estado esta erigiendo una hidroeléctrica, donde su esposo trabaja para obtener un dinero extra. Considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus campos de las inclemencias del clima, ya que cualquier descuido puede afectar la cosecha. En adelante, espera juntar el dinero necesario para comprar una movilidad. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Pioneros de cumutay” y este es el primer crédito con MFP; donde espera del apoyo de todos ustedes para continuar con sus planes. Balvina de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de una bolsa de semilla de arveja para su próxima siembra.
texts.en: Balvina is 33. She is a very loving and hard-working mother. She lives in her own home with her husband Nestor, age 38, and their 3 beloved daughters for whom they care with great love and tenderness in the hamlet of Cumutay. The family works in agriculture. From the beginning of their family life, she started putting all that her parents had taught her into practice. Her husband has always supported her in caring for their crops and making decisions. She says that they bought some land 20 years ago where they can sow potatoes, peas and corn. They are still working these lands, but they are now far more productive, and their crops are high quality. What Balvina most enjoys about her work is the close relationship that she has with the land. She greatly enjoys watching her crops grow. She now has to work the land full-time because, thanks to the geography of the area, the state is building a hydroelectric power station where her husband is working in order to obtain extra money. She finds her greatest challenge to be caring for her land in difficult weather, since everything can affect the harvest. In the future, she hopes to have the necessary funds to purchase a vehicle. She belongs to the "Pioneros de Cumutay" communal bank and this is her first loan with MFP. She hopes for the support of each one of you in order to continue with her plans. Balvina, with your support, will invest the requested loan in the purchase of a bag of pea seeds for her next crop.

loans.use: to purchase a bag of pea seeds.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es: Alberto es un joven muy creativo dese hace 5 años comenzó su propio negocio para la elaboración de cintos, carteras, porta celulares y mas. Que hace con piel de animal donde hace variedad de dibujos que el mismo diseña. En este momento el quiere comprar una maquinaria que le facilitaría el trabajo con agilidad y rapidez, para que sus clientes queden satisfechos del tiempo e que es la entrega. Alberto no cuenta con el capital necesario por eso solicita un préstamo para poder comprar la maquina y e esta manera seguirá generando ingresos para sostener los gastos.
texts.en: Alberto is very young and has been very creative since he was five years old.  He started his own business making belts, wallets, cell phone carriers, and more.  He makes them out of leather and makes several of his own designs.  He wants to buy a machine to make his work easier and faster so that his customers can be better satisfied with delivery times.  Alberto doesn’t have the necessary capital, so he is asking for a loan to be able to buy the machine.  In this way he will continue to generate income to cover his living expenses.

loans.use: Comprar maquinaria

loans.name: Domitila

texts.es:
La señora Domitila tiene la edad de 56 años, estudio hasta la preparatoria, es soltera y tiene un hijo de 19 años que estudia la preparatoria. 

ella nos platica que hace un poco mas de 6 años inicio a vender refrescos en su hogar para ganar un poco dinero extra para sacar a delante a su familia y poco a poco con el paso del tiempo su negocio fue cresindo e inicio tambien a vender abarrotes, ella realiza sus ventas desde su casa ha puest algunas mesas y anaqueles en los cuales exibe sus productos, tambien nos dice que la C. de una tienda de abarrotes es tenerla muy bien surtida ya que asi sus clientes siempre encontraran lo que buscan y volveran a su tienda a hacerle el gasto.

Doña domitila nesecita este credito para invertirlo en la copra de arroz, frijol, aceite, refrescos, galletas, dulces, jabon, papel higienico, productos en la tados, huevos, pasta dental, sal y azucar para resurtir su tienda.

ella espera que con esta inversion su negocio prospere y obtenga mas clientes para que sus ganancias aumenten y asi poder construir un pequeño local y continuar la construccion de su casa.
texts.en:
Domitila is 56 years old, studied through high school, is single, and has a 19 year old son in high school.

She tells us that more than six years ago, she started to sell soft drinks in her home to earn a little extra money to get her family ahead.  Little by little with the passing of time, her business grew and she started to also sell groceries.  She sells from her home, where she has set up tables and shelves to display her products.  She says that the key to a grocery store is to have it very well stocked so that customers can find what they are looking for and will return to her store to make purchases.

Domitila needs this loan to purchase rice, beans, oil, soft drinks, cookies, sweets, ham, toilet paper, canned goods, eggs, toothpaste, salt, and sugar to restock her store.  

She hopes that this investment in her business will help it prosper and she will get more customers, which will increase her earnings.  She wants to build a small store and continue to do construction on her house.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to restock her store.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buying & selling of fish business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 2 years. Rosemarie has requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell.

In the future, Rosemarie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is 27 years old, married and has two children who are in school.  She does tailoring to earn a living for her family.  She mainly makes bed covers and cushion covers. In addition, she sells hair braids and hair clips in the same business premise.

Through Faulu Kenya, Julia has been trained on business management skills. This has helped her to improve her business.  She has requested a loan of 60,000 Kenyan shillings to buy fabric and a sewing machine, and to install electricity in her business premise.

loans.use: To buy fabric,  sewing machine and install electricity

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en: Pacita is 56 and owns a sari-sari store (a small retail shop), from which she sells snack food, cooking staples such as vinegar and cooking oil, and soft drinks.  According to Pacita, she is practiced the hardships of life and that’s why she keeps on working. Aside from her sari-sari store, Pacita sells sandwiches door-to-door in her village.  Pacita plans to use this loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos to buy bread, sandwich spread, and soft drinks to sell. She hopes she will be able to buy enough merchandise for her sari-sari store to meet the needs of her customers.

loans.use: to buy bread, sandwich spread, and soft drinks

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es: Maria Cristina es casada y tiene 1 hijo de 4 años el cual está bajo su cargo. Desde hace 4 años que tiene este negocio que es una pulpería, fue por iniciativa propia que ha obtenido este medio de vida, la responsabilidad de brindarle a su familia los ingresos necesarios para su hogar hacen que Maria se esmere en el buen servicio para con sus clientes. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de granos básicos, pan, refrescos, detergentes, sopas, enlatados y  papel higiénico. Ella necesita comprar más insumos y productos para que su negocio tenga variedad para sus clientes y así pueda continuar creciendo.
texts.en: Maria Cristina is married and has a 4-year-old child in her care.  She has owned her general store business for four years.  She started out in this line of work through her own initiative.  The responsibility she has to provide her family with the income they need means that Maria takes care to provide her customers with good service.  She is requesting this loan to buy basic grains, bread, soft drinks, detergents, soups, canned goods and toilet paper.  She needs to buy more supplies and products so that her business has a good range of products available for her customers and can therefore continue to grow.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, bread, soft drinks, detergents, soups, canned goods and toilet paper

loans.name: Furkat

texts.ru: Фуркат проживает в городе Куляб. Ему 44 года. Он женат. У него шестеро детей. Он имеет средне - специальное образование. По специальности он шафер. Фуркат более пяти лет предоставляет услугу, такси. Кредит берет для ремонта автомашины, чтобы предоставить безопасную услугу.
texts.en: Furkat lives in the town of Kulob.  He is 44 years old, married and has six children.  He has a secondary-specialized education.  He is a driver.  Furkat has been providing a taxi service for five years.  He is requesting this loan to make repairs to his car and provide a safe service.

loans.use: to make repairs to his car

loans.name: Oyun-Erdene

texts.en:
Oyun-Erdene is 33 years old and lives with her 2 children and her husband in the slum district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She works as a bus conductor for a bus service company.  

Oyun-Erdene always tries to improve her living condition step by step. Therefore, she is planning to install a new electric heat furnace to replace the coal furnace which is being used currently.  She thinks this is a very economical and nature-oriented idea. Then, she will add insulation to the walls of her house because there is too much heat loss in her house.  The loan she is taking will be used to make adjustments to her old house. 

Oyun-Erdene needs MNT 3,500,000 to purchase and install an electric furnace and buy some building materials for insulation.

loans.use: buy and install an electric furnace and insulation

loans.name: Maria Estella

texts.es: María Estella se dedica al destace de carne de res, hace más de 10 años que tiene este medio de vida. Este negocio lo inicio por unas amigas de su Mama que le enseñaron esta actividad, con el paso del tiempo es que ella ha logrado mejorar cada día. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de vacas pues siempre está ofreciendo una buena calidad de sus productos.
texts.en:
Maria Estella has worked as a butcher of beef for over 10 years now. The business was launched by a group of her mother's friends who taught her this activity. With the passage of time, she has improved each day.

The loan Maria Estella requests is for buying cattle, since she always wants to offer the best quality of her products.

loans.use: to buy cattle to slaughter and sell.

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy is 32 years old and lives with three family members in a rented house in Hoima, Uganda. Her family goal is to build her own family house and stop renting.
Dorothy is a daring woman who ventured into the timber business, which is predominantly a business carried out by men. She has been in this business for the past ten years. She started as a sales lady for someone in the timber business, then later on, after learning the trade, she started up her own business. She faces a challenge of high fees levied on her by National Forestry officers. Her dream is to own a big timber shop. Dorothy is requesting a loan to buy more timber.

loans.use: to buy timber.

loans.name: María Magdalena

texts.es: María es socia del Banco Comunal Sarita, es viuda, se dedica a la venta de locerías, con los primeros préstamos que recibió compró mercaderías variada, ella distribuye sus productos en casas y vende también en las ferias, con la ayuda de Finca pudo ampliar su negocio, le gusta recibir charlas ya que le es fácil captar porque es bien dinámico, gracias a las capacitaciones aprendió a educar bien a sus hijos, le gusta su Bamconumal porque las socias son bien unidas y se apoyan entre ellas. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en su viaje a la ciudad de Lima para comprar mercaderías y poder surtir su negocio. Su meta es construir su casa de material noble para sus hijos.
texts.en: María is a member of the Sarita communal bank . She is a widow and she sells crockery. With the initial loans that she received, she bought different merchandise. She sells her products in homes and also at fairs. With FINCA's help she has managed to expand her business. She enjoys attending lectures and the dynamism makes them easy to understand. This training has helped her to learn how to raise her children well. She likes her communal bank because the members are very close and they support each other. The loan she is requesting will be invested in the trip she is making to Lima to purchase merchandise to stock her business. Her goal is to build a brick and mortar house for her children.

loans.use: to buy merchandise in Lima.

loans.name: Redentor

texts.en:
Redentor is an industrious father of four children. With his determination to send all his children to school, he is operating a farming business as a source of income. This business is risky and difficult but he persists in working for the betterment of his family’s living. He dreams of having a comfortable life with his loved ones and of helping to finish his children‘s education. 

For this reason, a 31 year-old is requesting a loan of PHP20,000 to buy corn seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides to use to improve his business. With his strong determination and hard work, he hopes that there will be abundant crops so that his family will experience a better life.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides to develop his business.

loans.name: Bandu

texts.en: Bandu is 31 years old and lives in Airport community. She is married and she has three children between the ages of 4 and 20 years old, all of which are currently in school and live at home. For the past nineteen years she has been selling palm oil and dried meat in the market. She enjoys the way customers respond to her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil and dried meat for her business. Her plan is to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase palm oil and dried meat for her business.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 38 years of age, a smart and simple businesswoman in the Municipality of Camalaniugan. She has been in the business of selling beauty products and dry goods for over one year and it is going as planned. She is friendly and trustworthy which is why she gets loyal customers. 

She is requesting a loan of P50,000 as additional capital to purchase inventory of brands like Natasha, MSE, Sundance, Avon and Boardwalk per her customers requests. Hopefully, this loan would make her business more competitive and more productive. This would cover the needs of her two children in school and the improvement of their living conditions as well.

loans.use: to purchase inventory of brands like Natasha, MSE, Sundance, Avon and Boardwalk per her customers requests

loans.name: Roger David

texts.es:
Roger de 24 años, comenzó aprender musicalmente a los 7 años. Como la familia es evangelica cristiana el comenzó a tener mucho conocimiento de música y practicar en la iglesia que sus padres asistían. 

Ahora el trabaja con uno de sus compañeros que también es músico enseñando todo tipo de instrumentos y teniendo su propio estudio de grabación. Tiene un niño de un año y medio que espera enseñarle todo lo que Roger sabe de música. 

Para seguir avanzando con la música el quiere un préstamo para comprar más instrumentos musicales y poder tener más alumnos en su clases como guitarras.
texts.en:
Roger is 24 years old, and he started studying music when he was 7. Coming from an Evangelical Christian family, it was in the church his parents went to that he learned a lot about music and started to practice it.

He now works with one of his friends, he himself a musician, teaching all kinds of instruments, and running their own recording studio. He has a child aged 18 months to whom he hopes to teach everything he knows about music.

In order to keep on progressing with his music he is requesting a loan to buy musical instruments such as guitars, in order to attract more students to his classes.

loans.use: To buy guitars for his music school.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes sells cereals in Makueni town. These include maize and beans. She has been in this business for 9 years and she makes a monthly income of Kshs. 9,000. She is 34 years old and married to Gideon with whom they have 2 children. 

This being her first loan term she plans to use the loan amount to buy more stock of maize and beans  for selling. She plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees for her children. 

In future, Agnes hopes and dreams of having a stable business, make more income and be able to provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: To buy more stock of cereals for selling.

loans.name: Mavjuda

texts.en: Mavjuda is only feed keeper of her child. She is divorced. Mavjuda grows her child alone. She is very hardworking and smart woman. Mavjuda is a higher educated woman. She works in a state organization. Her colleagues know her as smart and kind woman. She makes her job well. Mavjuda is always tries for well being of her child. Now, her child is a student. Mavjuda must to pay for her child education but she has not enough money. She is asking for a loan of 7500 Somoni to pay for her child’s tuition. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To pay for her child’s tuition

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en: Hasan is a 48 year old married man living with his wife and three young children, who are still attending school. He is the main source of income for the family. He works as a realtor in his town to fulfill his family needs. As for his wife she opened a room in the house to by homemade food. Due to the hard financial situation, Hasan is requesting for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to pay his children’s school fees. His only purpose is to help them attain high educational levels to help them to achieve their dreams.

loans.use: to pay his children’s school fees.

loans.name: Mary Nduta

texts.en:
This business is a member of the Melody Mothers group. Group lending, also known as solidarity lending, is a mechanism that allows a number of individuals to provide collateral or guarantee a loan through a group repayment pledge. The incentive to repay is based on peer pressure; if one person in the group defaults, the other group members make up the payment amount. - Kiva Staff

Mary Kunyua is married with 3 dependants. She is involved in community work and takes care of the orphans in her locality.

Mary sales fresh milk from her own cows and also buys from farmers in the same area. She distributes it to hotels in Nairobi. The income from her business is basically used in expansion of her business and feeding the orphans. Lack of a permanent stall for her business has been a major challenge since new customers canâ€™t locate her.

loans.use: She intends to open up a milk collecting centre after being given a loan of USD 1000. This will enable her buy a freezer for her milk to serve customers better.

loans.name: Joséphine

texts.en:
Mrs. Joséphine A. is a young woman married for 10 years to a farmer and mother of four children. Although illiterate, she keeps busy by producing cassava flour called ”gari,” which is a popular local food. She is a dynamic woman who actively participates in social and economic interest groups. Because she cannot affort a modern grater, she is unable to produce enough flour with only manual labor. Today she is asking for a $700 loan to buy a new grater and cassava in order to increase production to meet local market demand. The production and sale of gari is a profitable enterprise which can help her improve her family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame A. Joséphine est une jeune femme mariée depuis une dizaine d’année à un cultivateur et est mère de quatre (4) enfants. Analphabète, elle n’a aucun complexe à mener réellement son activité de production de la farine de manioc « gari ». C’est un aliment très apprécié par la population de sa localité. Elle est une femme très dynamique qui milite dans des groupes d’intérêt économique et social. N’ayant pas les moyens pour s’offrir une râpeuse moderne, elle n’arrive pas à produire suffisamment de farine car c’est une activité très pénible. Elle sollicite aujourd’hui un crédit de $700 pour acheter une râpeuse et disposer du fonds de commerce pour l’achat du manioc en vue de la production en quantité du gari afin d’être à la hauteur de la demande sur les marchés locaux. Très rentable, la production et la vente du gari pourront l’aider à améliorer les conditions de vie familiale.

loans.use: Purchase of grater for gari production

loans.name: Chab

texts.en: Chab K. is 54 years old and lives in Phnom Penh with her husband and their 5 children.  Her husband is a construction worker and earns $3 per day.  Two of her children are mechanics, and together they make $100 per month.  One of her daughters is a garment factory worker and earns $50 per month.  Chab K. grows and sells vegetables at the market, and she will use this loan to buy 1 hectare of land in order to grow more crops.  As her income grows, she plans on buying more land and eventually upgrade her home so that it will be comfortable for her family to live in.

loans.use: To buy 1 hectare of land to grow crops

loans.name: Andres

texts.es:
Andres has 5 dairy cows. He sells his dairy products to PIL Andina (which is a milk plant). Andres lives in the Achacahi-Tipampa Community (which is about 2 hours from the city of El Alto).

His wife and 2 children work with him. They help him by taking good care of the cows. This is the family’s main source of income to support themselves.

The loan will be used towards the purchase of a medium-grade dairy cow which will help increase milk production.

This is their first loan with IMPRO. Their background check shows that they are prime candidates for a loan that will help to improve their living conditions!

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Andrés, tiene 6 vacas productoras de leche, la que comercializa a la empresa PIL Andina (Planta Industrializadora de Leche); Andres vive en la Comunidad de Achacachi - Tipampa (A dos horas de la ciudad de El Alto) Para la crianza y cuidado de su ganado trabaja con sus dos hijos y esposa, por lo que la venta de leche es su fuente principal de ingreso para el mantenimiento de su familia. El préstamo lo destinara para comprar una vaca lechera que le permita incrementar la cantidad de leche a producir. Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo y mejorar la condición de vida de su familia.

loans.use: To buy a milking cow

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en: Mohamed Z T. is forty-two years old.  He is married with five children. Mohamed is responsible for the family of his late father.  He started his business before the war but the business was destroyed when Mohamed was abducted by the rebels.  His previous loan from SMT enabled him to restart his business three years ago and he used the income to cover the family expenses including those of his younger brothers and sisters.  Mohamed is the sole breadwinner for his big family.  He is requesting another loan of $200 to expand his business and involve and train his younger brothers in the business.  He thinks this way he can generate more income for the family.

loans.use: Increase his grocery business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To make improvements to her home and to buy more products

loans.name: Digna

texts.es:
Digna is a talented women who always works with an incredible and good sense of humour and looks to offer the best of herself in every artesanal work of every decoration of her engraved mate-gourds. Beginning ten years ago, she has made these beautiful art-works in the company of her oldest son, after having suffered the painful death of her husband which left her with serious economic difficulties, and her work embroidering skirts wasn’t sufficient to cover the household expenses that were presented to her. Her six children had to stop studying in order to help steady the household income. With the great effort and energy that each one has put in to working as a team, her great art-making talent in her beautiful works have been recognised in competitions at interprovincial: the family representative was her oldest son and now everyone is in search of new innovative designs for their engraved mates. As part of this innovation they intend to capture in the mates that which they previously used to in the skirt-embroideries that Digna abandoned for health reasons previously and thus with her unlimited creativity in design, a spring mate-gourd shows the various colours and diverse flowers of the lush valleys fields in which they live. Without doubt this new production will be one of the most values in the local market during this season, and in her interminable zeal to progress, she wishes to export her mates with the object to cover education expenses with the profits generated by this investment. For this reason, she is asking for a loan in order to purchase the materials that she will use in the elaboration of her new artesanal designs. Help this family who through their admirable mother appeal for your generous contribution.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Digna, es una mujer talentosa que siempre trabaja con un increíble y buen sentido del humor y busca ofrecer lo mejor de sí en cada trabajo manual en cada adorno de sus mates burilados.Hace diez años realiza estos bellos trabajos en compañía de su hijo mayor tras haber sufrido el penoso fallecimiento de su esposo que la dejó en serios problemas económicos y los bordados de fustanes no eran suficientes para cubrir los gastos económicos que se presentaban en aquel entonces. Sus seis hijos tuvieron que dejar de estudiar para ayudar a reflotar la economía en casa, con el gran esfuerzo y empeño que han puesto cada uno de ellos al trabajar en equipo, su gran talento hecho arte en sus bellos trabajos han sido reconocidos en concursos a nivel interprovincial y el representante familiar fue su hijo mayor y ahora se encuentran todos en búsqueda de nuevos diseños que innoven la elaboración de sus mates burilados.Como parte de esa innovación tiene en mente plasmar en estos mates lo que antes hacia en el bordado de fustanes que por razones de salud abandonó tiempo atrás y así con su ilimitada creatividad diseño un mate primaveral eligiendo variados colores y diversas flores de los frondosos campos del valle en el que habita.Sin duda esta nueva producción será una de las más cotizadas en el mercado local durante esta temporada y en su interminable afán de progreso desea exportar sus mates con el objetivo de cubrir los gastos de educación con las ganancias que genere su inversión. Por esta razón solicita un préstamo para la compra de los materiales e insumos que utilizará en la elaboración de sus nuevos diseños artesanales. Apoya a esta familia que a través de su admirable madre apela tu generosa contribución.

loans.use: Purchase of materials to continue capturing on mate-gourds the beautiful designs of Digna.

loans.name: Lida

texts.en:
Mrs. L. Lida, 32, is widow with three children—two sons and one daughter. Her two sons are studying in the local school and her daughter, the youngest, stays at home. Lida and her children are living  with her mother along National Road number five about twenty five kilometers from Phnom Penh. Lida is in the business of making Prohok (Cambodian cheese made from fish) and cucumber pickle, a food production business she started in 2002. Prohok isa  very famous food for Cambodians. They use Prohok to produce many kinds of other Cambodian foods.

Lida is requesting her fifth loan from MAXIMA in the amount of $500. She will use this loan to buy fish for making Prohok for reselling.

loans.use: To purchase fish for making and selling Prohok, a Cambodian cheese used in making many kinds of other Cambodian food

loans.name: Katooke Iii 2039(B) Group

texts.en: This group has been together for one year and six months. Aminah is married with two children and owns a retail shop that sells used clothes. She intends to save the extra profits for a poultry business. Madina owns a restaurant while Hadija sells charcoal.

loans.use: To add more stock in her business

loans.name: Mirzakhuseyn

texts.en: M. Mirzakhuseyn is a 52-year-old farmer who breeds horses the small village of Saatli. He is married and has four children. This family is vulnerable and it is very hard to cover family needs. Mirzakhuseyn has more than 10 years of experience in this field. He purchases small foasl, raise them  and then  sell them to the local farmers. He applied for 1200 USD and will purchase four foals for 250 USD each and fodder for the rest..

loans.use: To purchase four foals

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is Fatuma A.. She is 38 years old, married, and has five children between the ages of 10 and 20 years old. In 2005, Fatuma established her general store business. Working seven days a week, and 9 to12 hours a day, she earns about $430 each month from this business. She is assisted by her hursband, children, and one employee. Fatuma has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA, and now seeks a new loan in order to purchase additional stocks of soap, rice, sugar, biscuits, and cloth. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately $175. In the future, Fatuma plans to open a new business. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback micro-finance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are not considered to be credit-worthy by financial institutions because they lack tangible assets that can serve as collateral. As such, low income women in Tanzania typically receive poor financial support and in turn only limited access to basic needs and services.

Fortunately, SELFINA has been a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women in Tanzania. Simply put, SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women through an arrangement called a sale and leaseback transaction. More specifically, when a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extends a loan to her to facilitate the transaction, and then leases the equipment back to her.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks (e.g., soap, rice, sugar, biscuits, and cloth) in bulk.

loans.name: Laura

texts.es:
Laura belongs to the Las Shipibas Community Bank in Jr. Martir Olaya, in the Calleria District in Ucayali. She is 26 years old and the mother of 1 child. Her husband works with cars and motorcycles. With the first loan Laura received from Manuela Ramos, she decided to begin a second-hand clothing store.

She relies on her second-hand store and raising chickens, for which she rises at 7 a.m., in order to prepare breakfast for her son and husband. Afterwards, she does household chores and takes care of her son and chickens.

With this loan of $300, which she will pay back in 4 months, she will buy used clothing and chicken feed.

Laura is happy and thankful, now that she is working independently and managing her own income. She is pleased with the support that Manuela Ramos has brought to her business.

Translated from Spanish by Maggie Messerschmidt, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Laura pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Shipibas, ubicado en el Jr Martir Olaya No 130, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 26 años y es madre de 1 hijo, su esposo es motocarrista. Laura con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en un negocio de venta de ropas usadas.

En la actualidad ella cuenta con un negocio de venta ropas usadas y con la crianza de pollos en su galpón para lo cual se levanta a las 7am, para preparar el desayuno de su hijo, y de su esposo luego se dedica a los que haceres de su hogar y al cuidado de su hijo y de sus pollitos.

Con este préstamo de S/. 800.00 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará ropas usadas y alimento balanceado para sus pollitos.

Laura esta muy feliz y agradecida, ahora puede trabajar de manera independiente y manejar sus propias ganancias, esta muy contenta con el apoyo que le brinda Manuela Ramos a su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase more chickens, etc.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en:
Faustina A. is thirty two years old. She is married with three children, who are all in school. She is a petty trader selling gari, groundnuts, and maize in her neighborhood. Gari is produced from milled cassava, dried and fried and eaten with cooked beans and palm oil. It is one the local foods that is enjoyed by many Ghanaians.

From the profit of her business, she takes care of her three children. She wants to use this loan to buy more bags of gari, beans, groundnut, and maize to increase her stock of goods for sale. She hopes to raise her income in order to pay her children’s school fees.

She is a member of the trust group called Nso Nyame ye ("It is possible with God"). In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral and act as peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more bags of gari, beans, groundnut, and maize.

loans.name: Thon

texts.en: Thon V., 25, has one child and lives with her husband in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She works in a garment factory, where she earns $3 a day. Her husband, Chum Sinoeun, is a goldsmith. To help his business expand, she has applied for a loan from Kiva to buy additional tools. If there is money left over after this purchase, the family will use it to buy rice for resale when prices rise. (Mrs. Thon's husband is pictured here because she was not available when the photo was taken.)

loans.use: To buy tools to facilitate her husband's work as a goldsmith.

loans.name: Men

texts.en:
Mrs. Men T. is a 34-year-old widow, and she sells cooked rice with pork and chicken in her area market. On average, she earns approximately $5 per day. She has three children, and she and her children live in the Chrang Chamres Village of Phnom Penh City.

Fortunately, her business has been growing, and there has been an increase in demand from her customers. Accordingly, she is requesting a loan in the amount of $500 to purchase more grocery products to sell to her customers. In addition, any remaining loan proceeds will be used by Mrs. T. to decorate her store in order to attract even more customers. In this way, the loan will allow her to expand her business and to generate greater income for her family.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by increasing her inventory and by decorating her store

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki is 40 years old. She is married with 5 children between 21 and 4. She also takes care of 1 other person, aged 80. She has been a fruit, firewood, and spices seller since 2000. Every day, she works from 7am to 10pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Riziki now hopes for a loan to buy more firewood, fruit, and spices to increase her inventory.

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Doña Elena tiene 46 años de edad, estudió tercero de secundaria es casada, madre de cinco hijos, vive en la comunidad de Machacmarca.

Socia del Banco Comunal Ciudad Nueva – Machacmarca, Distrito de Pilcuyo, Provincia del Collao – Puno, ella empezó hacer negocio desde que tuvo su pareja, a un inicio vendía ropa de segunda mano en la ciudad de Ilave, posteriormente durante cinco años se dedicó a la compra y venta de ganado vacuno en las ferias de Pilcuyo, Ilave, acumulando poco a poco su capital; hace seis años su esposo migró a la selva, Putina Punco de la Provincia de Sandia, dedicándose a la agricultura, actualmente ella lleva papa, chuño, haba, tunta (papa procesada) y comercializa en la selva Putina Punco.

Con este crédito de S/. 1,400.00 Nuevos Soles, que pagará es 04 cuotas comprará: 03 quintales de papa, 02 quintales de chuño, 05 arrobas de tunta que serán comercializados en Putina Punco – Sandia.

Su visión es hacer negocio de compra y venta de ganado vacuno en mayor escala, apoyar a sus hijos  en su educación y sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Elena is 46 years old, she completed third year of secondary school, is married and mother of five children. She lives in Machacmarca. She is a member of the Communal Bank “Nueva Machacmarca” from the Pilcuyo district, Collaro Puno region. She began her business when she married. At first she sold second-hand clothing in Ilave city, then for five years she bought and sold cattle at the Pilcuyo and Ilave markets, saving her money little by little. Six years ago her husband moved to the jungle, to Puntina Punco in Sandia province, where he farms, and today she takes potatoes, potato flour, beans, “tunta” (processed potatoes) and sells them in the Putina Punco jungle. With this loan for S/. 1,400.00 Nuevos Soles, which will be repaid in 4 payments, she will buy: 3 quintales of potatoes, 3 quintales of potato flour, 5 arrobas of processed potatoes that will be sold in Putina Punco Sandia. (Note: a quintal is 46kg and an arroba is a regional weight of approximately 11.5 kg.) Her vision is to have a business buying and selling cattle on a larger scale and support her children and their education so that they may become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy potatoes, beans, potato flour and processed potatoes.

loans.name: Edina

texts.en: Edina S. is 36 years old, married, and the mother of one daughter. She comes from a town well known as a very enterprising area where almost everybody has his or her own little business. Edina does a lot of agriculture – she has cows and sells milk and milk products, and a garden where she produces vegetables, but her main job is in her green house. Edina has to do some reconstruction on the green house and she decided to take a loan in WWI in the amount of 800 KM. She must buy more nylon and do some changes on the water system in the green house. Edina hopes to extend her green house and provide producing abilities throughout the whole year.

loans.use: Edina would like to buy supplies for her green house.

loans.name: Gaoussou

texts.fr: Gaoussou est  informaticien  agé de 28 ans il est marié et pere de trois enfants.Apres une formation en maintenance informatique il a ouvert une  boutique où il vend du materiel informatique et des accessoires pour ordinateur et fait aussi  de la maintenance depuis au moins 3ans. Avec le pret sollicité il va renforcer son activité par l 'achat d' accessoires pour ordinateur.
texts.en:
Gaoussou, 28, is a computer tech. He is married and the father of three children. After training in computer maintenance, he opened a shop where he has been selling computer-related items and accessories and doing maintenance for at least three years now. With the requested loan he is going to boost his little business by buying computer accessories.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to add to his working capital

loans.name: Rufino

texts.es:
Justo Rufino Pérez,  es un hombre que se dedica al comercio de ropa (mujer y niño).
Lleva aproximadamente 15 años de experiencia en el negocio; donde actualmente es la fuente vital de ingresos para su familia y para él; él tiene un puesto de ropa en la banqueta de un mercado muy conocido a nivel nacional de Guatemala, es el mercado el Roosevelt, allí le llegan a comprar señoras, señoritas, madres para sus niños, niñas.
Rufino Pérez dice que él se ha propuesto atender bien a sus clientes para que puedan regresar de nuevo, además índica que les da un buen precio para que lo busquen en otra oportunidad.
Rufino compra en una bodega la ropa para mujer, como suéteres, blusas, trajes para dama, trajes para niño, y también playeras, pantalones, blusitas para niños.
Rufino comenta que en esta época él tiene la oportunidad de colocar un negocio mas, por la  temporada navideña; la municipalidad de Guatemala, en el mes de Diciembre le alquila un dos metros cuadrados de una banqueta para poder poner negocios navideños; esto ocurre en la famosa SEXTA AVENIDA DE GUATEMALA, un lugar donde hay mucho comercio.
Rufino necesita el dinero para poder adelantar la compra de mercadería y así poder tener lo necesario para poder comercializar; en esa temporada tiene una persona que le ayuda en el otro puesto, para no descuidar ninguno de los dos.
Además Rufino indica que en el mercado el Roosevelt allí ya es conocido, lo llegan buscar estudiantes de la universidad de San Calos, y menciona que llegan hasta doctoras que le llegan a comprar, esto a él lo ha motivado por seguir adelante con su familia.
El sueño de Rufino es ver a su familia prospera, brindándoles educación, salud, vivienda y sobre todo el amor en familia.
texts.en:
Justo Rufino Pérez is a man who dedicates himself to selling women’s and children’s clothing. He has approximately 15 years of experience in this business, which currently is the primary means of income for him and his family. He has a clothing stand in a well-known market in Guatemala, the Roosevelt Market, where women come to purchase his items as well as mothers for their children. Rufino Pérez states that he has undertaken to provide excellent service to his customers to ensure repeat business, and also indicates that he sells his products at good prices so that they will return to see him. Rufino buys items to sell such as sweaters, blouses, women and children’s suits, as well as onesies, pants and tops for children. Rufino comments that during this season he has the opportunity to add another business, given the nearness of the Christmas holidays. The Guatemala municipality, in the month of December, rents two square meters of space to sell holiday-related items. This occurs in the famous 6th Avenue of Guatemala Street, a location with a great deal of commerce. Rufino needs funding to purchase supplies, so he will have the necessary items to sell. During this season, he has one person to help him at his other stand so that he can make sure both locations are well tended to. In addition, Rufino indicates that he is well-known at the Roosevelt Market where students from San Carlos University seek him out. He mentions that even professional women visit him to buy his goods, which motivates him further to continue forging ahead along with his family. Rufino’s dream is to see his family prosper, providing education, good health, a home and, most of all, a loving family.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing at low prices to sell.

loans.name: Remy Angelica

texts.en:
Remy is a member of the Desarrollo (Development” Village Bank. She is 25 years old and lives with her common-law husband and their two young children. Remy sells bread from a tricycle cart outside of a local bus terminal. She buys the bread from bakers, and resells it each afternoon when the buses come in. She works by herself, and has worked in this business for so long she cannot remember how many years it has been. Her husband works as a driver. 

Remy is requesting a loan of 600 soles to buy more bread. She would like to switch businesses and open a store some day.

loans.use: Buy bread for resale

loans.name: Som

texts.en: Som S., 41, is married with two children and resides in the province of Kampong Cham. She runs a grocery store from her home and is able to make $8 in revenue every day. Her husband is a policeman and makes $5 per day. Mrs. Som S. would like to take out a loan to expand her grocery store by adding more products to meet her clients' demands.

loans.use: To expand her grocery store.

location.town: Tboung Kmum district, Kampong Cham province, Cambo

loans.name: Moeurn

texts.en: S. is 45 years old and a resident of Battambang Province, Cambodia. She currently sells different varieties of fruit in the local market, and she can make about US$ 3 each day to support her family. She is married and has given birth to two children, both of whom are married and live away from the family home. Her husband's name is Chomreun, 44, and he is an electronics repairman, who sometime helps her sell fruit. S. hopes to have a cart so as to sell her fruit outside the market. Therefore, she is requesting a loan of US$ 500 to buy a cart to connect with her existing motorcycle to transport fruit to sell.

loans.use: To buy a cart to transport her fruit

loans.name: Oumar

texts.fr: Agé de 41 ans oumar est un marchand de friperie .chaque matin il va au marche pour s'approvisionner en quelques pantalons chemises et autres objets de friperie qu'il va vendre à travers les rues et ruelles de la ville.Les revenus tirés de la vente de ces objets lui permet d 'entretnir sa famille.Avec le pret qu'il sollicite oumar veut renforcer les quantites de marchandises qu'il achette pour reduire des couts d' approvisionnement et accroitre se revenus.
texts.en:
Oumar, age 41, is a second-hand clothing reseller. Every morning, he goes to the market to get his supplies : a few trousers, shirts, and other used clothing items, that he then sells in the streets of the city. The profits of his business enables him to provide for his family. With the loan he's seeking, Oumar would like to increase the amount of items he buys, in order to reduce the supply cost and increase his profits.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital for his second-hand clothing business

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Touch P., 46, is married and lives with her husband in the Takeo province. She works in a grocery store in front of a garment factory, near her house to earn a living. She makes $20 in revenue every day. Her husband grows and sells trees, and he makes $3 a day.

This couple has three children and all of them are in school. Touch is asking for loan to expand her grocery store by adding more items to sell to meet her client’s demand. Touch P. (right) is pictured with her husband.

loans.use: Purchase items to expand her grocery store.

loans.name: Dora

texts.es: Dora tiene 41 años, vive con su esposo y sus hijos en su casa propia. Se dedica a la crianza de animales desde hace más de 30 años, proviene de una familia agrícola que le enseñó estas actividades. Cada día se levanta temprano para atender a sus animales y de esta manera mantenerlos saludables, después de un tiempo los vende a vender, o sino ella mismas los sacrifica para vender su carne, que es aun más rentable. Esta labor la realiza con ayuda de sus hijos, pues es muy agotadora. Dora desea continuar con este trabajo para seguir sosteniendo las necesidades de sus hijos. Es la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y ha notado logros positivos en su vida a lo largo de este periodo trabajando en su banco comunal. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de alimento balanceado para su ganando y el pago para desparasitar a sus animales.
texts.en:
Dora is 41 years old, and lives in her own house with her husband and children. She's been raising animals for more than 30 years, since she comes from a farming family that taught her the trade. Every day she gets up early to take care of her animals and keep them healthy. After a while she sells them, or slaughters them and sells their meat, which is even more profitable. Her children help her with the slaughtering, since it's quite exhausting. Dora hopes to continue this work in order to continue to provide for her children's needs. This is her second loan from MFP, and she's noticed positive developments in her life during the time she's been working with her community bank. She will use the requested loan to buy feed for her livestock and to treat her animals for parasites.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy feed and care for her animals

loans.name: Etudo Xonam

texts.fr: Ce monsieur est marié à une femme qui est couturière, il est père de 02 enfants et réside avec sa famille dans le quartier d’adidogomé, il exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de produits d’alimentation générale et c’est cette activité qui lui permet de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Il a commencé ce commerce depuis 2005 . Son stock actuel est épuisé et il sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit afin de s’acheter des produits d’alimentation générale.
texts.en:
This gentleman is married to a woman who is a seamstress. He is the father of two children and resides with his family in the Adidogomé district. His income-generating business involves commerce in grocery items. This business is what enables him to meet the needs of his family. He started this business in 2005. His current stock is exhausted, and he’s requesting his first loan from WAGES in order to buy grocery items.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grocery items

loans.name: Teresa De Jesús

texts.es: Teresa D. Jesús E. L. D. V. resiD. en Santa Tecla junto a su única hija D. 19 años D. edad, la cual se encarga D. todos los quehaceres del hogar. Teresa D. Jesús posee una venta D. cosméticos como champo, talcos, desodorantes, cremas para el cabello entre otros productos más. Su negocio está ubicado frente al parque San Martín D. Santa Tecla, un lugar muy transitado lo cual beneficia a Teresa. Ella solicita un préstamo con el fin D. poder comprar más cosméticos para su negocio, ya que este es muy importante para ella debido a que es la única fuente D. ingresos que posee.
texts.en:
Teresa D. Jesús E. L. D. V. lives in Santa Tecla together with her only daughter, who is 19 years old and is in charge of all of the household chores. Teresa D. Jesús has a business selling cosmetics such as shampoo, talcum powder, deodorant, hair cream and other such products. Her business is located opposite the San Martín D. Santa Tecla Park, a well-travelled location which is to Teresa's advantage. She is requesting a loan with the objective of being able to buy more cosmetics for her business, which is very important to her since it is the sole source of income that she has.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics.

location.town: Santa Tecla, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Jacquelyn

texts.en:
Jacquelyn B. is from the town of Sapang Dalaga. She is 27 years old, and is married with two school-aged children. To make a living, Jacquelyn owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Jacquelyn earns approximately 3000 PHP a month from these activities.

Jacquelyn joined Kiva partner, PMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jacquelyn is requesting a loan of 3000 PHP, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. This loan will be the first she has taken from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en: Sophia L. is from Oroquieta City, Misams Occidental. She is 60 years old, married, and has six adult children. Sophia owns and operates a vulcanizing shop providing vulcanizing (tire) repair services to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month. In 2000, Sophia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Sophia is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 12th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Phan

texts.en: Mrs. Phan P. is a villager in Pour Pras Sang village, in Takeo province. She owns a small grocery store in her house. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more grocery products to resell and earn a higher profit. Mrs. Phan P. is a 66-year-old widow with three children. One of her children is employed in a company while another is a beautician and the remaining stays at home to do housework.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia es una mujer de 34 años, sencilla y trabajadora, vive sola en la casa que le cedieron sus padres, puesto que nunca se casó y lo que más desea es vivir un futuro tranquilo. El negocio de la sastrería es una actividad que viene de familia, puesto que aprendió este arte de su padre, cuando todavía era muy joven, su negocio es muy concurrido y sus clientes hacen cola para que les realice la confección de una prenda. Aunque tiene muchos clientes ella trabaja sola, ya que sus ingresos económicos todavía no le permiten contratar a un ayudante, con el cual pueda acelerar la confección de los pedidos. Lo que más le gusta a Julia de su trabajo es realizar el acabado a sus prendas, lleva 20 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día en su sastrería. Julia anhela que su negocio crezca con el tiempo y que se convierta en uno de los talleres de confección más reconocidos de la ciudad de Juliaca. Este es su quinto préstamo con MFP y está dispuesta a pagarlo puntualmente, ya que no desea causarle problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, donde participa activamente. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará nuevos materiales para la confección de sus prendas.
texts.en:
Julia is 34 years old and is a simple, hard-working woman. She lives by herself in a house that her parents gave her, since she never married. What she wants most is to live a quiet life. The tailoring business runs in her family, as she learned this art from her father when she was still very young. Her shop is very busy, and her customers line up for her to make them a garment. Although she has many customers, she works alone because her income still does not allow her to hire an assistant, who would help her make the orders faster. What Julia likes most about her job is finishing a garment. She has been doing this for 20 years, and the most difficult part is staying in the tailor shop all day. Julia is eager for her business to grow over time and to become one of the most recognized tailor shops in the city of Juliaca. This is her fifth loan with MFP, and she is prepared to pay it on time. She does not want to cause problems with her partners at the communal bank, where she actively participates. With the requested $675 (2,000 PEN), she will buy new materials to make her garments.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel McRoberts, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy textile materials

loans.name: Esmirna

texts.es: Esmirna tiene 57 años de edad, es madre de 2 hijos que ya son independientes y trabajan, en la actualidad vive sola y en su casa propia. Desde hace 3 años es propietaria de 2 motocarros, los cuales son manejados por sus hijos, quienes se dedican a brindar el servicio de transporte de pasajeros desde hace 6 años. Estos motocarros los cuidan mucho, pues significan su sustento diario y Esmirna se encarga de la administración de las ganancias. Ella se considera una mujer muy activa por lo que no pierde el tiempo y cada vez que tiene momentos libres, generalmente por las tardes, viaja a los diferentes caseríos de su zona para comprar gallinas y pescado, los cuales posteriormente vende en el mercado de su localidad. Lo que le gusta de su negocio es que sus motocarros están dejando buenas ganancias y mucho mejor si son sus hijos los choferes. Este es su 8vo préstamos con MFP y lo que le gusta de trabajar con su grupo es que todos los  integrantes son muy laboriosos y hay bastante comprensión entre todos. Con el dinero que viene solicitando comprará llantas, repuestos y otras herramientas necesarias para reparar sus motocarros y puedan trabajar en óptimas condiciones.

loans.use: Reparación de sus motocarros

loans.name: Nahed

texts.en:
Nahed is a 38-year-old woman who lives in the Bekaa Valley with her husband and their two children. Nahed has been working as a seamstress since 2000. She works from her home, but she also visits her clients. Nahed has requested a loan of $1500 USD from Al Majmoua to purchase thread and pay for her car expenses. This is her fourth loan and she has always repaid on time. 

Nahed is special in her business because she knows how to treat her clients and does a good job. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. Nahed decided to her businesses because she wants to supplement her family’s income. In the future, she plans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase thread and pay for her car expenses.

loans.name: Kimleang

texts.en:
Mr. Kimleang K., age 23 and his wife, Mrs. Chantheang Srun, age 20, live along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penn City. They have been married since 2002 and just have a one-year-old daughter.
 
Kimleang and his wife sell bananas and flowers.  They buy banana and flower from their villager and other districts far a way from their house for resale in Phnom Penh market. The couple hopes to expand their business, so Kimleang is asking for a loan of $500 to purchase more bananas and flowers for resale. They will able to generate much income for supporting their family as well.

loans.use: To purchase expand his selling bananas and flowers business.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma P. is from the village of Seti, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 50 years old. Emma is married and has 2 children. To make a living, Emma owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting coconuts for sale. Emma has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Emma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emma is requesting a loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the first loan taken out by Emma from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia es una mujer de 69 años, muy optimista y trabajadora. Sus más ansiados deseos son de mejorar sus condiciones de vida, pues vive sola en la casa que heredó de sus padres, y trabaja pensando en tener una vejez tranquila.

Desde muy joven supo aprovechar el tiempo trabajando en diversas actividades que le dieron la posibilidad de invertir en la instalación de una tienda de comestibles en su casa, donde trabaja por más de 27 años, tiempo en que logró consolidar  su local como uno de los más concurridos de su localidad. 
Julia considera que su bodega es rentable por el tiempo que tiene de funcionamiento y por la calidad de productos que brinda, sumado a la buena atención que encuentran sus clientes al momento de realizar sus compras. 
Es por ello que sus deseos de mejorar son siempre continuos, pues la demanda va en aumento y es necesario instalar nuevos estantes de venta para facilitar los pedidos de sus clientes.

Este es su octavo préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA y al igual que sus compañeras de banco comunal trabaja con mucho esmero en busca de la prosperidad de su negocio. Con el dinero que ahora solicita espera comprar productos nuevos por la campaña navideña que esta próxima.
texts.en:
Julia is a 69-year-old woman who is very optimistic and hard working. Her greatest desire is to improve her standard of living, since she lives alone in the house that she inherited from her parents, and works so that she can have a peaceful old age. Ever since Julia was very young she has known how to make the most of her time by working in different activities, which gave her the opportunity to invest in setting up a grocery store in her home. She has worked in her store for more than 27 years, and during that time her store has grown to become one of the busiest in her town. Julia thinks that her store is profitable because of the amount of time that she has been in business and because of the quality of the products that she offers, in addition to the good customer service that she provides her customers when they are making their purchases. Julia is always wishing to improve her business, since the demand is increasing and she needs to install new shelves so she can facilitate her customers’ orders. This is Julia’s eighth loan with Kiva partner Microfinanzas PRISMA, and just like her colleagues at her communal bank, she works hard so that she can prosper in her business. She is hoping to use the money she is requesting to purchase new products for the Christmas holiday season, which is approaching.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing her merchandise for the Christmas holiday season

loans.name: Si

texts.en:
There are many Cambodians who make a living as rice cultivators. One of them is Mrs. Si M., who has been working in this sector since 1979. She grows her crop on her own farmland that she inherited from her grandparents. From this business she can generate an income of around US$ 3 per day.

Si M. was married, but divorced her husband when her three kids were very young. One of her sons works in a hotel. This coming crop season, Si M. hopes to plant an sugar cane crop and is asking for a loan to buy seeds to begin growing, as well as to buy a water pump for irrigating her crop.

loans.use: To buy seeds and a water pump for irrigating her crop

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es:
Jaime es un carismático agricultor de 31 años, vive feliz en compañía de sus padres y hermanos mayores en la casa que está cercana a sus tierras, lugar en el que toda su familia cultiva para vivir. 

Él se dedica a la agricultura de papa, además también cría ganado ovino de buena raza y como Jaime es un hombre emprendedor que estudió educación, son pocas las veces que ejerce su carrera. En la actualidad está trabajando como agricultor para sacar su título universitario, él comenta que sembrar y cosechar le es rentable, por lo que continua en esta labor. “Cuando alguien quiere algo y lucha por eso no descansa hasta conseguirlo”, y eso es lo que piensa este joven profesor que enseña a jóvenes adolescentes la rama de ciencias sociales.
Para el futuro piensa dedicarse íntegramente a su carrera, por ello tan sólo anhela tener su título universitario.

Este es el tercer préstamo que tiene con MFP, sabe que debe ser puntual, porque es el valor que tanto inculca a sus alumnos y siempre es responsable con sus deudas. Jaime tiene pensado invertir el dinero que solicita en la compra de abono así como comprar una mejor raza de ganado ovino para comercializarlo a un mejor precio.
texts.en:
Jaime is a charismatic 31 year old farmer. He lives happily with his parents and older siblings in the house that is close to their fields. This is where his whole family farms to live. He grows potatoes and also raises a good breed of sheep. Jaime is an enterprising man who studied education. He has exercised his education very few times. He is currently working as a farmer to get his university degree. He says that planting and harvesting are profitable. That’s why he continues this work. “When someone wants something and fights for it, he does not stop until he gets it.” That is what this young teacher, who teaches young adolescents the branch of social sciences, thinks. In the future he plans on devoting himself entirely to his career. Therefore, he only aspires to have his university degree. This is the third loan he has had with MFP. He knows that he needs to be punctual because it is the value that he instills in his students. He is always responsible with his debts. He plans to use the money he is asking for to buy fertilizer and to buy a better breed of sheep to sell at a better price.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer and a better breed of animals

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
Marjorie S. lives in the village of Paitan, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 35 years old, married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Marjorie sells a variety of different products from her community store. She has been engaged in this business for more than two years and earns approximately 3800 PHP a month from her work.

In 2006, Marjorie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid four previous loans from ASKI, and has applied for a new loan of 7,000 PHP which she will use to buy more inventory and expand her store. She plans to use the income generated by this loan to support her family. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell and expand her store

loans.name: Nyame Suro Group

texts.en:
Rose is 37 years old and is married with three children. All of her children are in school, which makes Rose so happy. She owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items like sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, skimmed powdered milk, and biscuits, etc. in her neighborhood. Rose has been selling grocery items for the last eighteen years to take care of the family. She has no regrets of what she has had to do, but her only challenge is funds to buy more raw materials. She takes delivery of stock from Kumasi central market and retails to her customers. She is therefore requesting loan support. With the loan, she wants to purchase more crates of assorted drinks, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of biscuits, etc., to increase her inventory. She hopes to improve her savings to support her children in school.

She is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Nyame Suro’ which literally means the fear of the Lord. She is the one sitting in the middle in the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are small traders, food vendors, and farmers respectively. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and peer pressure to repay the loan. They would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy more cartons of assorted drinks, bags of sugar, cartons of bottled mineral water, and boxes of biscuits.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Nuestra socia es la señora JUANA, ella pertenece al banco comunal “MUJERES UNIDAS”, la socia se desplaza entre Bolivia y Cusco, trayendo libros a bajo costo hacia la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 39 años de edad es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos, (13, 11, 5) años de edad, nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, ella tiene 4 años en este negocio y lo conoce muy bien, nuestra socia viaja al mes 2 veces a la paz-Bolivia y trae libros para venderlos en la ciudad del Cusco, ella tiene un stand en el mercado del baratillo, nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para poder reinvertir en su negocio de compra y venta de libros.
 
La socia agradece y expresa su satisfacción de poder seguir creciendo con su negocio propio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago  de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our member is Ms JUANA. She belongs to the communal bank “MUJERES UNIDAS” (Women United). She travels between Bolivia and Cusco, bringing low cost books to Cusco. Juana is 39, lives with her partner and has 3 children (13, 11, 5). She alternates her household chores with the retail business. She has been working in this business for 4 years and knows it very well. Juana travels twice a month to La Paz, Bolivia, and brings the books to sell them in the city of Cusco. She has a stand in the Baratillo Market. She is requesting a loan to invest in her business of buying and selling books. Our member appreciates and expresses her satisfaction in being able to continue growing her own business, and she promises to complete her payment of the loan by the established deadline.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The member requests a loan to invest in her book-selling business

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria V. is from the village of Parog Parog, Solana, Cagayan. She is 47 years old. Gloria is married and has 1 school-age child. To make a living, Gloria owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Gloria has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 50000 PHP every four months or during harvest season.

In 2009, Gloria joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gloria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 28,000 PHP from ASKI. Gloria is requesting a new loan of 30000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Gloria from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Adorma

texts.en:
Adorma P.’s previous businesses which were established using loans through ASHI, Kiva field partner in the Philippines, have been her great source of income to help her most needy children and grandchildren. At her present age of 57 years old, she still feels her inner capability to run a business and continue helping her children and grandchildren. Therefore she remains active in her membership to ASHI. She repays on time every week and she attends weekly center meetings. Adorma now is requesting another loan to try another kind of business which is tricycle (motorcycle with sidecar attached) for hire, to be managed by her husband who has been a driver for a long time now. 

Tricycle is a Filipino version of a rickshaw and this is the most common means of transportation anywhere in the Philippines, especially in provinces and in its villages. Therefore, with this kind of business, Adorma hopes that someday, she can afford to renovate their house and respond to the expenses incurred by her family. She also likes to save a certain amount for her family’s emergency needs such as hospitalization.

loans.use: To purchase sidecar to be attached to a motorcycle for a tricycle for hire business.

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en:
Rosana P. is from the village of Medina, Misamis Oriental.  She is 41 years old, married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Rosana owns a bake shop selling mostly bread in her local community. Rosana has been engaged in her business for over one years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Rosana joined HSPFI to access financial services to improve her living situation and to engage in business activities.  Rosana has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11000 PHP from HSPFI to purchase cooking ingredients.  Rosana is requesting a new loan of 13000 PHP to expand her business. This loan will be her 4th from HSPFI.
---------------------------
About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: Expanding the business.

loans.name: Marianita

texts.en:
Marianita is a 39-year-old married woman from Agusan Del Sur. She has six children; the oldest is aged 19. She sends them to school because she wants them to be given a proper education and have bright futures. 

She has been involved in rice farming for more than a few years. She wants to grow her farm because it is her family’s only source of income. One of the challenges in her life right now is her children’s education. She said that it’s hard to keep up with the increasing school fees so she works hard to earn more.

Marianita would like to request a loan of 14,000 Philippine pesos. She will use it to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. This loan will be truly helpful with Marianita’s goal to earn better.

loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: Rubelyn

texts.en:
Rubelyn, 30, sells fish in Talibon, Bohol. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 Php to have additional capital for her business. She buys fish directly from the fishermen and sells to the market with a mark up. She does this to earn a living and support her family.

Rubelyn has two children and wants them to be in school. She is thankful, as a member of Community Economic Ventures, Inc., to have an opportunity to help her business grow.
