 Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

Jeny es socia del Banco Comunal Universo. 
Jeny es casada, tiene 28 años y 1 hijo, Yeny se dedica a la distribución de CD, DVD, Discos y todo material discográfico, pilas, entre otros productos, Jeny tiene un almacén en la casa de su mama, cuenta con 2 personas quienes se encargan del reparto de los productos, sus productos los adquiere de la ciudad de Lima. 
Jeny necesita un préstamo de 800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de CD por mayor. 
Jeny sueña con ampliar su negocio, implementar otro negocio mas.

loans.use: Buy wholesale CDs

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Benkadi (composé de 4 femmes  mariées) ont une moyenne d’âge de 24 ans avec en moyenne 1 enfant. Elles resident dans le quartier  Mancourani I de la ville de sikasso.
Elles  exercent des activités commerciales différentes mais la plus dominante est la vente d’habits pour enfant menée par (2) clientes et à laquelle s’ajoute la vente de fruits et de chaussures.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe).Les prêts précédents ont été correctement  remboursés.
Elles comptent utiliser ce prêt pour acheter 4 douzaines d’habits  pour enfant, un chargement d’orange et de mandarine et une vingtaine de paire de chaussures. Elles s’approvisionnent soit à Bamako capitale du Mali,  ou sur place à Sikasso et environnants.
Les produits sont vendus en détail et au comptant dans les marchés de la ville de Sikasso (Médine et le grand marché de la ville) et dans les quartiers à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de 21.000 FCFA par mois qu’elles comptent utiliser, une partie dans les activités et l’autre partie aux besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
The members of the group Benkadi (composed of 4 married women) have an average age of 24 and on average one child. They live in the Mancourani I neighborhood of the town of Sikasso.

They each have different businesses, but the most common is selling children's clothing in which 2 clients are involved; ithe other two are in the businesses of selling fruit and vegetables and selling shoes.

They work together with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso so as to satisfy the needs of their clientele. They are on their 4th solidarity loan (group loan). The preceding loans were correctly reimbursed.

They intend to use this loan to buy 4 dozen outfits for children, a load of oranges and mandarines, and around 20 pairs of shoes. They do their buying either in Bamako, the capital of Mali, or right in Sikasso and the surrounding area.

The items are sold retail and on a cash basis in the markets of the town of Sikasso (Médine and the big open-air market) and in their own neighborhoods, to a clientele composed of men and women.

They each hope to make an average profit 21,000 FCFA a month that they plan to use partially for their businesses and partially for the needs of their families.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy outfits for children, fruit, and shoes for their businesses

loans.name: Thuy Thi's Group

texts.vi:
Nguyễn Thị Thuỷ sinh năm 1976,(Mã số: 010117140007). Chị bán hang giải khát ( nước ngọt, bánh kẹo,…). Chồng chị làm công nhân có thu nhập ône định. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị khoảng 2.000.000 vnđ /tháng. Chị tham gia vay vốn mức: 4.142.000 vnđ để đầu tư bán hàng. Chị là nhóm trưởng nhóm vay vốn gồm có:
 Lê Phương A. sinh năm 1977, (Mã số: 010117140008).  làm nghề thợ may, chồng chị làm tai công ty sữa có thu nhập ổn định. Chị vay mức vốn vay: 4.142.000 vnđ để mua vải mở rộng cửa hàng may mặc.
  Trần Thị Thuý Hà sinh năm 1980. (Mã số: 010117140009).  Chị là giáo viên, chồng là thợ sửa chữa ô tô, có thu nhập ổn định. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị khoảng: 3.000.000 vnđ/tháng. Chị vay mức vốn vay: 4.142.000 vnđ để mở xưởng sửa chữa xe.
Nguyễn Thị Năng sinh năm 1963, (Mã số: 010117140010). chị chủ yếu làm nông nghiệp, làm vườn, bán rau. Chồng chị làm bảo vệ trông trường học, hai con chị còn nhỏ đang độ tuổi đi học. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình khoảng 300.000 vnđ/tuần. Chị vay mức vốn: 4.142.000 vnđ để mua phân bón.
 Nguyễn Thị Thuận sinh năm 1958, (Mã số: 010117140011).  làm nông nghiệp , chăn nuôi. Chồng chị làm thuê và phụ giúp chị công bviệc đồng áng và đi đánh cá về bán. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị khoảng: 250.000 vnđ/tuần. Chị vay mức vốn: 4.142.000 vnđ để đi chợ.
texts.en:
Mrs. T. T. N. was born in 1976. She sells beverages such as sodas and candies. Her husband is a laborer with a stable income. The family's average income is about 2,000,000 VND per month. She joined the Fund with a loan of 4,142,000 VND to invest in her beverage sales business. She is the group leader for this group loan, which also includes: - Mrs. A. P. Le, born in 1977, is a tailor. Her husband works at a milk factory with a stable income. She is borrowing 4,142,000 VND to buy fabric to expand her tailoring business. - Mrs. T. T. Tran, born in 1980, is a teacher. Her husband is a car mechanic with a stable income. Her family's average income is around 3,000,000 VND per month. She is borrowing 4,142,000 VND to help her husband open an auto mechanic's shop. - Mrs. N. T. N., born 1963, works mainly agricultural jobs, including landscaping and selling vegetables. Her husband is a security guard at a school, and her two small children attend school. The family's average income is about 300,000 VND per week. She is borrowing 4,142,000 VND to buy fertilizer. - Mrs. T. T. N., born in 1958, works in agriculture and raising livestock. Her husband works as labor for hire, helps her in the field, and works as a fisherman as well. Their average income is around 250,000 VND per week. She is borrowing 4,142,000 VND to trade goods.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi N., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: various small businesses

loans.name: Khorn

texts.en: Mrs. Khorn Y. is a villager in Trapaing Knol village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Chor Phal, is a construction worker. Although they try to work hard, they still earn little income to support their household. Thus, Mrs. Khorn Y. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding to earn more income to support her family. She is 57 years old and the mother of six children, three of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others are enrolled in the local school. Her husband is shown on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Chhoem

texts.en:
M. is 38 years old and a resident of Pursat Province. She is a mother of two children who are students. She is married to Huot, 47, who sells charcoal across the commune. 

M. earns a living selling vegetables in the market and has done so since 1999. She needs to travel to some parts of the commune in order to buy the vegetables in bulk. She hires a motorbike for her transportation. She is applying for a loan of $600 to buy a motorbike for her business transportation. M. dreams that her children will earn their degrees.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her business transportation.

loans.name: Dao Thi

texts.en:
Khuê Đào, 57, lives in the town of Hưng yên. She is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Khuê owns and operates a business venture raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising cattle for sale. Khuê has been engaged in this business for over 20 years and earns approximately 2500000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2001, Khuê joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Khuê has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. Khuê is requesting a new loan of 10000000 VND which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future. The loan will be the ninth loan taken out by Khuê from TYM Fund. Khuê plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: Buy livestock.

loans.name: Thérèse

texts.fr: Agée de quarante sept (47) ans, Mme Thérèse M. est mariée avec quatre (04) enfants à charge. C’est une femme très dynamique qui se bat pour le devenir de ses enfants et de sa famille. Pour cela, elle mène comme activité la préparation et la vente de la bouillie à base de mais tous les matins dans son village. Cette activité lui permet de faire face aux besoins élémentaires de ses enfants. Pour accroître ses bénéfices, elle sollicite un crédit pour constituer un stock important de mais, matière de base entrant dans la préparation de la bouillie.
texts.en:
Ms. Thérèse M., age 47, is married and has four children in her care. This is a very energetic woman who struggles for her the future of her children and family. To do so, she has a business making and selling cornmeal porridge each morning in her village. This enables her to address the essential needs of her children. To grow her profits, she's requesting a loan to build up a sizable stock of corn, the basic ingredient that goes into making the porridge.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock corn for selling porridge

loans.name: Evangelina

texts.es: Evangelina es una mujer D. 45 años, sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su propia casa junto a su esposo Eleuterio D. 53 años y su hijo Rubén D. 17 años; y lo que más desea es que su familia tenga una vida feliz. Ya son 20 años los que lleva produciendo y comercializando productos artesanales, su negocio está ubicado en una zona altamente comercial, en la Explanada Laguna Temporal (lugar donD. se realizan ferias en Juliaca), ella está convencida que la variedad D. sus productos incrementarán sus ventas y con ello la mejora D. su calidad D. vida. Evangelina se divierte mucho trabajando y ese estado D. ánimo lo refleja en los acabados D. su trabajo. Gran parte del día está comprometida en la producción y comercialización, lo que le resta tiempo importante para dedicarlo sus hijos, pero está convencida D. que más adelante su negocio prosperará y que esta es una etapa en la que tiene que impulsarlo, sabe que el camino al éxito está plagado D. incertidumbres, pero que al final del mismo encontrará la satisfacción D. haber realizado un buen trabajo, contribuyendo al desarrollo D. su familia. Con este primer préstamo con MFP ha descubierto la importancia D. trabajar en grupo, está segura D. pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo y así no causar problemas a su banco comunal, en donD. es muy querida por la alegría que demuestra. Con los ochocientos nuevos soles que solicita comprará más lana para incrementar la cantidad D. tejidos que produce.
texts.en:
Evangelina is an unassuming and hardworking 45-year-old woman who lives in her own house with her husband, Eleuterio age 53, and their son, Ruben, age 17. What she would like the most is for her family to have a happy life. She has been producing and selling handicrafts for 20 years now. Her business is located in a highly commercial area in the Explanada Laguna Temporal, on the Juliaca fairgrounds. She is convinced that having a variety of products will boost sales, thus improving her quality of life. Evangelina has a lot of fun working, and her mood is reflected in her finished product. She commits most of her time in making and selling her handicrafts, and she spends the rest of the time with her children. She is certain that her business will prosper in the future, and that it is currently at a stage where she needs to give it a boost. She knows that the road to success is paved with uncertainty, but that in the end, she will find satisfaction with a job well-done, having contributed to her family’s development. With this her first MFP loan, she has discovered the importance of working in a group. She is sure that she will be able to make her payments on time so that she will not cause any problems in her microfinance institute, where she is beloved for her joyful personality. With the 800.00 PEN that she is requesting, she will purchase more wool to increase the amount of knitwork that she produces.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wool for knitwork

loans.name: Ni Putu Puri

texts.en:
Ni Putu Puri is 56 years old and lives in the town of Manistutu - Melaya. She is married and has three adult children.  To make a living, Ni Putu Puri raises livestock. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Ni Putu Puri has been engaged in this business for more than 10 years and earns approximately 400,000 IDR a month from these activities.

In 2007, Ni Putu Puri joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ni Putu Puri has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,000,000 IDR from DINARI, which she used to purchase breeding livestock. Ni Putu Puri is now requesting a new loan of 3,000,000 IDR, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be Ni Putu Puri's third loan from DINARI. Ni Putu Puri plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

About DINARI:

The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small business owners.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Ni Putu Puri - (DNR.M-0689) merupakan 56 tahun wanita.  Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Manistutu - Melaya.  Dia (perempuan) menikah dan memiliki 3 anak usia dewasa.  Untuk membiayai hidup, Ni Putu Puri memiliki & menjalankan usaha.  Bisnis beroperasi di sektor pertanian.  Tujuan utama bisnis tersebut adalah memelihara ternak.  Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual.  Ni Putu Puri sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 10 tahun.  Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Ni Putu Puri menghasilkan sekitar 400,000 IDR sebulan.

Dalam 2007, Ni Putu Puri bergabung DINARI untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan  -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis.  Ni Putu Puri meminta pinjaman untuk pertama kalinya dari DINARI.  Pinjaman sebelumnya ini digunakan untuk membeli ternak indukan.  Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 3,000,000 IDR.  Pinjaman saat ini akan digunakan untuk untuk membeli pakan ternak & pasokan lain.  Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 3rd pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari DINARI.  Ni Putu Puri berencana untuk menggunakan pendapatan tambahan yang dihasilkan dari bisnis  untuk tabungan sebagai cadangan bagi keadaan darurat di masa mendatang.

Tentang DINARI:

Misi DINARI adalah memperjuangkan kelestarian lingkungan, memberdayakan kaum miskin, dan menyediakan kesempatan pembangunan sosial ekonomi bagi pemilik usaha kecil.

*Catatan: Untuk memaksimalkan efisiensi & menurunkan biaya, pinjaman ini ditempelkan menggunakan templat sehingga dapat diterjemahkan otomatis oleh Kiva. .  Mengingat bahwa terjemahan manual atas profil memakan biaya besar, Kiva menciptakan templat ini untuk Mitra Lapangan untuk memungkinkan mereka terus menempelkan pinjaman dalam  Bahasa sambil memberikan informasi yang bermutu & akurat kepada para pemberi pinjaman Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes D. is thirty-five years old. She is married and has five children. Her children, two sons and three daughters, are currently in the senior high, junior high and the primary schools. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial town, called Dwenase, in the Western Region. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital. Her husband is a farmer. Agnes is a trader. She trades in corn dough. She sells from a tabletop stall at the market square. She also supplies to food vendors in her community. Agnes wants a loan to buy bags of maize in bulk. She buys from nearby communities. Agnes has been in this business for four years. She aspires to expand her business and to give her children good education.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize in bulk.

loans.name: Kwabena

texts.en: Kwabena is 53 years old. He is married and father to six children, all in school. He is a trader and he trades in smoked meat. He takes stock of goods from Tamale, in the northern part of Ghana. He buys them in bulk and supplies to the food vendors in the community market, where he lives. In most cases, people place their order and he supplies to them as soon as he arrives. He started his business six years ago with lots of experience and with the atmosphere of creating a good environment. He requests a loan so that he can trek to the north of Ghana to buy stock. He also dreams of providing education for his children.

loans.use: To buy meat in bulk.

loans.name: Margarito

texts.es:
A L. vivienda del señor Margarito U. le está haciendo falta terminar L. barda y algunos acabados D. L. casa. 
Es por eso que nos está solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar el material y así poder realizar L. mejora lo más pronto posible ya que si familia se queda soL. todo el día. 
Por que el trabaja D. guardia D. seguridad en un rancho que está a las fuera D. L. ciudad y es por eso que quiere L. seguridad D. su familia. 
Cuando fuimos a realizar L. visita a L. vivienda del Don Margarito el encontraba en su trabajo y quien nos atendió fue su esposa L. señora Hortencia Reyes, quien es L. persona que aparece en L. foto.
texts.en:
At the household of señor Margarito U., he needs to complete a fence and some finishing work for the house. That is why he is applying for a loan from us-- in order to be able to buy material and, thus, be able to complete the improvement as soon as possible since his family is left alone all day. Because his work as a security guard is at a ranch that is outsiD. the city he wants to protect the security of his family.

When we came to carry out the visit to Don Margarito’s home he was at work, and his wife, señora Hortencia Reyes, took care of us. She is the person who appears in the photo.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Completing a fence and finishing work for a house

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.es: Trinidad tiene 62 años, es una mujer admirable, ya que a su edad es muy trabajadora y empeñosa. Vive con su esposo, quien es carpintero y con la última de sus 6 hijos, quien es estudiante. Desde hace 2 años se dedica a la venta de ropa en todas las variedades y para los diferentes géneros, actividad que realiza desde su casa. Con esta labor está solventando los gastos estudiantiles de su hija, a quien espera verla, más adelante como una buena profesional. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es relacionarse con varias personas y sobre todo aprender mucho sobre el negocio, pues así se siente útil ante la sociedad. Por otro lado, su negocio le es rentable porque le compran constantemente, en especial las personas que no tienen acceso a las tiendas de la ciudad, porque Trinidad vive cerca de una zona muy pobre, por lo que vende sus prendas a bajo precio. Su deseo a futuro es tener una tienda grande de ropa. Este es su 8vo crédito con MFP y lo que le gusta de su banco comunal es todos los integrantes son personas con mucha responsabilidad, confiables y solidarios. El dinero que viene solicitando lo invertirá en la compra de más ropa.
texts.en:
Trinidad is 62 years old, married, and the mother of 6 children. The youngest child still lives at home and is a student. Her husband works as a carpenter. Trinidad is an admirable and hardworking woman. For the past two years, she has operated a home-based business selling clothing of different types and styles. Her income helps cover the education costs of her daughter, whom she hopes will become a successful professional. What Trinidad enjoys most about her job is the chance to interact with different people and continue learning about her business. She feels like she is a useful member of society. Her business remains profitable because her customers buy from her constantly, especially those who do not have access to stores in the city. Because she lives in a poor area, Trinidad sells her clothing at low prices. She hopes to open a large clothing store in the future.

Trinidad is taking her 8th loan with MFP. She enjoys working with her Communal Bank because all the members are responsible, trustworthy, and caring. She will be using her loan to buy more clothes.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her inventory of clothing

loans.name: Chafika

texts.en:
Chafika is a 54 year old widow woman who lives in Bourj El Barajneh, southern suburbs of Lebanon with her husband and their four children. Chafika has been working as a sewer. Chafika requested a loan of 700 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase thread for her work. This is the first time that Chafika has requested a loan.
Chafika is special in her business because she knows how to treat her clients and does a good job. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. When she first started her business, she didn’t have enough of cash. Chafika decided on doing her businesses because she wants to supplement her family’s income, as well as she already had a shop for her own. In the future, she plans on improving her business.

loans.use: To purchase thread for her work.

loans.name: Nuru

texts.en: Nuru is 40single mother of four children aged between 5 and 18 years. All her children go to school .She takes care of additional family members. Nuru resides and owns a four roomed house where she is staying with five people. There is electricity and no piped water at home  The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in semi urban area which in the outskirts of Kampala in Ndeeba Kizito Zone. Nuru works seven days a week.  Nuru owns stall selling Bananas ( matooke )in Ndeeba Market. She buys her bananas from the delivery trucks which get them villages and doesn’t incur any transport costs.  Nuru pays monthly market dues.  She sells to all categories of people and on both retail and whole sale and besides Nuru has been in this business for eighteen years and with MCDT for seven years servicing her eighteenth loan, working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more bunches of bananas Nuru is aspiring of seeing her business grow bigger and start going to get the bananas her self.

loans.use: To buy more bunches bananas

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase  more rice, beans, maize flour and sugar in bulk

loans.name: Sheila

texts.en:
Sheila L. is from the village of Poblacion, Aurora Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 41 years old. Sheila is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Sheila owns & operates a business in the retail sector operating a specialized "sari sari" retail store. Her main source of income from the business comes primarily from selling shampoo, soap, candies in the local community. Sheila has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Sheila joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and business activities. Sheila has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to improved and expand the business. Sheila is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Sheila from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell in her "sari sari" retail store

loans.name: Valeriana

texts.en:
Valeriana L. is from the village of Maular. She is 51 years old. Valeriana is married and has 8 adult children. To make a living, Valeriana owns and operates a "sari-sari" store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Valeriana is just starting this business.

In 2005, Valeriana joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Valeriana has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Valeriana is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 10th loan taken out by Valeriana from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Jeffrey

texts.en:
Jeffrey R. is from the village of Sabang in Bonbon, Catarman Camiguin Province. He is 33 years old. Jeffrey is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Jeffrey catches and sells seafood, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Jeffrey has been engaged in his business for over 12 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Jeffrey joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jeffrey has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. Jeffrey is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP to buy more fishing nets for his business. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Jeffrey from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement his family's income.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy fishing nets for his business

loans.name: Balel Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Balel est composé  de cinq femmes, une veuve et quatre  mariées majoritairement dans des familles  polygames. Ayant  en moyenne 44 ans, 5 enfants, elles habitent  dans le quartier Hamdallaye de la ville de Ségou  (4ème Région administrative de  la république du Mali). 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et sont toutes membres d’une  même association d’entre aide.  Elles font généralement  le commerce d’articles divers, la couture et l’embouche ovine. 
Elles sont à leur 5ème prêt solidaire, après avoir remboursés sans difficulté les quatre précédents. 
Ce nouveau prêt sera utilisé pour acheter, 100 pastèques, des citrons et des oranges, 10 pièces de pagnes wax, 6 habits  en cotonnade « Faso danfani », 4 rouleaux de popeline de diverses couleurs, 6 paquets de files  pour la broderie à la main, 1 chargement en bois de chauffe bois, 7 sacs de henné et 5 moutons. 
Elles s’approvisionnent en pastèque à Boki Wèrè, en citrons et oranges aux vergers, en pagnes wax  et en habits en cotonnade à Bobo-Dioulasso (Burkina Faso), en popeline, files et  henné dans le  marché Château de Ségou, le bois est acheté  à Tona, les moutons sont achetés à Konodimini. La plupart de ces marchandises est vendu, au marché Château, à domicile, au comptant, en détail, en gros et à crédit,  à une  clientèle  qui se compose d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elles  espèrent réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 41.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement des prêts, l’achat de nourriture,  de savons, de fournitures scolaires et de médicaments. 
Leur ambition est avoir une concession et assurer l’éducation et la formation de leurs enfants.
texts.en:
The Balel group is made up of five women – one widow and four married – who mainly live in polygamous families. They are, on average, 44 years old, have an average of five children each, and live in the Hamdallaye quarter of Ségou town (the fourth largest administrative region in the Republic of Mali). They met through neighbours and are all members of the same mutual-aid association. They are generally involved in the sale of miscellaneous items, dressmaking, and in sheep fattening. They are on their fifth solidarity loan, and have successfully repaid their four previous ones. This new loan would be used to buy 100 watermelons, some lemons and oranges, 10 pieces of colourful fabric [pagne wax is a West African term for a highly decorative colourful material], 6 ‘Faso danfani’ cotton suits, 4 rolls of poplin in various colours, 6 packs of hand embroidery thread, one cartload of firewood, 7 bags of henna and 5 sheep. They source their watermelons from Boki Wèrè, their lemons and oranges from orchards, their colourful fabric and cotton suits from Bobo-Dioulasso (Burkina Faso), and their poplin, thread and henna from the Château de Ségou market. The women buy their firewood from Tona, and their sheep from Konodimini. The majority of their merchandise is sold both individually and in bulk at the Château market and through home sales. Cash and credit payments are received from a customer base made up of both men and women. They aim to make an average monthly profit of 41,000 FCFA which would be used to repay loans and to buy food, soap, school equipment and medicine. Their ambition is to have a house and to guarantee the education and training of their children.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of various items.

loans.name: María

texts.es: María tiene 39 años, es una emprendedora mujer que vive al lado de su pareja Rodolfo de 41 años y sus hijos Rubén de 11 y Dayat de 4 años. Todos viven juntos en su acogedora casa que es propia.Desde hace algunos años se dedica  al tejido de prendas de vestir, actividad que realiza muy feliz  ya que es uno de sus pasatiempos preferidos, aprendió desde muy pequeña viendo a su madre que le enseñó todos lo secretos de este creativo oficio. Cada día debe trabajar mediante pedidos de las personas que viven por su zona, ya que todas sus amigas y conocidas  le solicitan los modelos según los colores y diseños que prefieren;  usualmente requieren las prendas para sus hijos(as) ya que es la especialidad de María tejer prendas pequeñas, pero cuando debe hacerlas grandes las confecciona sin problemas. Los pedidos son buenos, y los acaba en el tiempo pactado, es por esta razón  que para  el futuro tiene  pensado ampliar  su negocio, para empezar con las ventas de tejidos al por mayor.Es el  quinto préstamo con  MFP , promete ser responsable y puntual como siempre lo ha sido.Con el dinero del crédito comprará mayor cantidad de mercadería en lana para empezar a  tejer todos los pedidos que tiene pendientes.
texts.en:
Maria is 39 years old; she is an enterprising woman who lives with her partner Rodolfo (41) and their children Ruben (11) and Dayat (4). They all live together in a cozy house that is their own. For some years she has been knitting and crocheting garments, an activity that makes her very happy since it is one of her favorite hobbies. She learned to knit when she was very small watching her mother, who taught her all of the secrets of this creative craft. Every day she must work through orders from the people who live in her area, since all of her friends and acquaintances request her fashions in the colors and designs they prefer. Usually they request these garments for their children, since Maria's specialty is to knit small garments, but when they request something larger she is able to make it without a problem. The orders are good, and she completes them in the time agreed upon, and for this reason she is thinking of enlarging her business in the future by starting to sell knitted garments wholesale. This is her 5th loan with MFP, and she pledges to be responsible and punctual with her payments as always. With the money from this loan she will buy a larger quantity of wool to begin knitting all of her pending orders.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise (wool) so as to continue her creative business

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
La señora Bertha C. tiene ya más de tres años con su negocio de venta dulcería.
Al negocio le esta haciendo falta más variedad de producto pero en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para la inversión, es por eso que esta solicitando el préstamo para realizar las comprar de la mercancía que desea vender.
Planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias del negocio, ya que los gastos de la casa se encargara su esposo el señor Nicolás Banoni, quien se dedica a la venta de tacos por las mañana en diferentes partes de la cuidad. 
Es un matrimonio ya mayor de edad que viven de sus negocio.
texts.en:
Sra. Bertha C. has been in the business of selling candy for more than three years. Her business lacks a variety of products, but she does not have the money at the moment to make additional investments. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to purchase the merchandise she wants to sell.

She plans to repay this loan using the earnings from her business. The household expenses are covered by her husband, Sr. Nicolás Banoni, who sells tacos during the morning in different parts of the city. As a married couple, they must live off their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her business

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza V. is from the village of Parog Parog, Solana, Cagayan. She is 39 years old. Flordeliza is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Flordeliza plants and harvests rice for sale. Flordeliza has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Flordeliza joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Flordeliza has successfully repaid a previous loan of 22,000 PHP from ASKI. Flordeliza is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Flordeliza from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Mrs. Sok B. is a 40 year old married woman who lives in Pongro village, Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Vang Nget, are farmers who own a 7-hectare field where they grow crops. Because of the dry season, Mrs. Sok B. needs 2,000,000 Riel from AMK to purchase fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline to support the farm crop.
 
Aside from being a farmer, Mrs. Sok B. also breeds ducks at home, and earns a small income to support her family's living. The couple has two children, one of whom is a farmer who supports the parents with the farming, while the other one is a student in the local school.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline.

loans.name: Siyagul's Group

texts.en:
If you ask any person about what he expects, you usually get an answer that he or she hopes to finish school, go to college, find a good job, gradually get promoted and become a boss. However, this ideal path awaits not everybody. And whoever it would be, a person has to be ready to any turn and any situation. The strong people do not expect or dream much about less probable things and just use the best use of the opportunities that life presents for them.

Siyagul is the leader of this group. Siyagul lives in Tokmok, which is located in the north of Kyrgyzstan, near the border with Kazakhstan. She is fifty-two and has a son. Her son is a grown–up and works in the local municipality. He lives separately from his parents as he has already got an accommodation for himself. Siyagul and her husband are engaged in cattle breeding. They have been doing this for the last fifteen years and have increased the total population of their livestock. Siyagul has decided to apply for a loan as she is in need of some funds to invest in purchasing 4 sheep for feeding. As the spring is approaching, it is the most suitable time to make such purchases.

Siyagul’s partners are:

Rahat is twenty-nine. Her spouse provides for the family by working as a taxi driver. Rahat is a mother of two children. She also trades in electric supplies. She has two spots at the local market. Rahat manages to earn about $570 a month. She hopes to obtain this loan and buy more electric goods.

Munara is thirty-five. She has two sons. Together with her husband, Munara keeps cattle, and on weekends they sell cattle in the market. Munara has applied for this loan as she hopes to buy some more cattle for feeding and resale.

Adylbek is forty-three. Adylbek’s wife is a saleswoman. They have three children. Adylbek owns a container and also trades in consumer goods. They hope to obtain this loan and invest it in purchasing goods.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept: People (building human capital and taking care of their customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135.

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our lending team, Supporters of Kyrgyzstan, at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase 4 sheep for feeding

loans.name: Vorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Vorn P. is a villager in Kdei Tnaot village in the Takeo province. She is 60 years old. She is a farmer who owns 1.5-hectares of land and cultivates rice to support her family. Aside from farming, she is also a laborer and a pig breeder. In addition to all this activity, she is a widow who lives with a child who is enrolled in the local public school. 

However hard she tries to work with her all businesses, she cannot earn enough money. Thus, in order to improve her family's living conditions, Mrs. Vorn P. decided to seek a loan to buy a cow for breeding.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Wasu

texts.en: Wasu S. is currently in the business of selling bread and ice cream and is requesting a loan to stock more ice cream and bread to sell. Wasu is 37 years old and is married to an electrician. She has two children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more ice cream and bread to sell

loans.name: Suvineetha

texts.en:
Suvineetha  is a 45-year-old married woman living with her kids, 16 years and 13 years old. Last year her husband went abroad, so she manages her business herself.

Suvineetha has a work place where she weaves hats for local customers.  She started this business two years ago, and she is very enthusiastic about it. She cooperates well with others and is always in a positive mood.

Suvineetha has requested a 40,000 LKR loan from BRAC Sri Lanka to purchase raw materials for her business. She is grateful to BRAC Sri Lanka because of the financial support it provides her.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for woven hats

loans.name: Assumpta

texts.en:
Assumpta is 51 years old, married with three children who are 2, 16, and 19 years old.  Assumpta also takes care of 3 dependents of 5, 10, and 15 years old.  Assumpta works hard at selling many sacks of charcoal.  Assumpta has been in this business for about three years.

Assumpta needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to have a large stock of charcoal.  With this business expansion, Assumpta, apart from retailing, will hopefully start wholesaling to the retailers operating the same business around her area.  Through the access to this loan, Assumpta hopes to continue taking good care of her family as well as saving for a better future for her business.

loans.use: The purchase of many sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Luis Gerardo

texts.es: Luis Gerardo T. J., tiene la edad de 63 años, está casado, y vive con su esposa y su hijo de 32 años.  El crédito lo quiere para la compra de almácigo de café, la idea es comprar los almácigos de café, para aumentar la cantidad de café. Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento a los almácigos para lograr una mejor calidad, cantidad y para obtener una mayor producción cuando sea tiempo de la cosecha. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don Luis Gerardo también trabaja desde hace muchos años en la agricultura. El espera en un futuro mejorar su calidad de vida y tener una mayor estabilidad económica, y así poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.
texts.en:
Luis Gerardo T. J. is 63 years old, married, and lives with his wife and their 32 year old son. He wants the loan for the purchase of coffee plant beds. The idea is to buy the coffee plant beds to increase the amount of coffee. He hopes to give the proper maintenance to the coffee plant beds in order to achieve a better quality and quantity and to obtain greater production when it comes time to harvest. This is his first loan from FUDECOSUR and he is very happy with the opportunities that they offer him.

Don Luis Gerardo has been working for many years in agriculture. He hopes in the future to improve his quality of life and have greater economic stability and therefore be able to continue growing as a person and as a producer.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy coffee plant beds

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es: María Del Carmen es una mujer divorciada que sola ha sacado a sus hijos adelante a pesar de cómo esta la situación económica en esta ciudad. Ella es una persona emprendedora en este momento cuenta con la venta de ropa usada y la venta de botas vaqueras que trae desde el centro del país. A su cargo tiene un hijo joven que esta estudiando en el Bachiller y es por ello que esta preocupada por el bienestar y la preparación académica. María del Carmen solicita un crédito para invertir mercancía y así seguir vendiendo para ofrecer a su hijo una mejora calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María del Carmen is a divorced woman that has only helped her children get ahead despite how the economic situation is in this city. She is an enterprising woman and she currently sells used clothing and sells cowboy boots that she brings from the center of the country. She has one son under her care who is studying in high school and it is because of this that she is worried about his well-being and academic preparation. María del Carmen is requesting a loan to invest in merchandise so that she can continue selling to offer her son a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her business

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a married woman with three children who all attend school. Her husband is a primary school teacher and he contributes to the family's basic needs. She has been operating her retail shop for the past ten years and sells to the entire local community. She also runs a video show and cultivates plants as other sources of income. 


With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase stock (two 50kg sacks of sugar, rice and cooking flour); to purchase bulbs, wiring cables and sockets; and to pay a deposit of Kshs 35,000 to the Kenya power and lighting company.


Maria's major challenge is seasonality. In particular, sales are low during the months of January and February. She hopes to have a wholesale business in the future and to increase profits. She decided to join Yehu to get a loan for her business operations. She cited food as her greatest monthly expenses.

loans.use: to purchase stock for her store and other items for her video business

loans.name: Kissao

texts.en: Monsieur Kissao A. is 41 years old and lives in Lome, Togo. He is married to a seamstress and is the father of two children. Since 1999, he's been the director of his own organization called "INTEL - Informatique et Telecom" where he offers Internet services, sells computers, and trains others in information technology. He has requested a loan from WAGES of 500,000 XOF in order to purchase another computer for his office. This will be his second loan from WAGES.

loans.use: To purchase a computer

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en: Jackline J. is 33 years old and a widow. She has two children, and they do not go to school. Jackline is currently in the business of selling ice cream, juice and bread at the market. She is requesting a loan to stock more sugar and fruits to make more juice to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to send her children to school.

loans.use: To stock more sugar and fruits to make more juice to sell

loans.name: Roberto Carlos

texts.es:
Roberto de 24 años, vive en el Guasmo de Guayaquil (zona urbana, la mayoría de habitantes son comerciantes informales), el tiene una pequeña tienda de bebidas y lácteos. 

Comenzó vendiendo bebidas en el Guasmo, a sus amigos, vecinos, conocidos, con esfuerzo pudo readecuar una parte de su casa para tener su pequeña tienda, ahora el trabaja desde las 09h00am hasta las 20h00pm todos los días, vende bebidas, lácteos y otros víveres. 

Para surtir mas su pequeña tienda el quiere comprar con el préstamo bebidas y lácteos y así tener la oportunidad de ser un joven microempresario. En el futuro quiere tener una distribuidora de bebidas.
texts.en:
Roberto is 24 years old and lives in the barrio of El Guasmo in Guayaquil (an urban zone, the majority of whose residents are merchants in the informal sector). He has a small store that sells drinks and milk products. Roberto began selling drinks in El Guasmo to his friends, neighbors, and those he knew. With effort, he was able to remodel a part of his house to contain his little shop. Now, he works from 9:00am until 10:00pm every day, selling drinks, milk products, and other provisions. To restock his small store he needs a loan to buy drinks and milk products and, thus, to have the opportunity to be a micro-entrepreneur. In the future, he wishes to become a drink distributor.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beverages and dairy products

loans.name: Olga María

texts.es:
La Señora Olga María Álvarez es socia del banco comunal Atenas, vive  por el sector de las Orquídeas en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es reconocida por sus bellos paisajes, su centro histórico que fue nombrado en diciembre de 1999 como patrimonio de la humanidad y  la variada gastronomía hace de Cuenca una ciudad hermosa y calida.

Doña Olga tiene 49 años, es casada y tiene 6 hijos de 28, 26, 24, 22, 20 y 16 años de edad, su primera hija es casada y vive de manera independiente, su segundo hijo es soltero y vive de manera independiente, su tercer hijo trabaja y ayuda en la economía del hogar, su cuarta hija estudia en la universidad y sus dos últimos hijos estudian en el colegio, su esposo es de profesión chofer y labora en un taxi, con el sacrificio conyugal han logrado construir una casa pequeña.

Doña Olga es nuestra socia hace 10 años y los créditos le han beneficiado en su negocio, tiene una tienda en su casa hace 20 años, labora de domingo a domingo, vende desde las 6 a.m. hasta  las 9 p.m., en sus tiempos libres se dedica a tejer bufandas y colchas, sus tejidos los vende a sus amistades. El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más víveres para ampliar su tienda.
 
Su meta es  realizar algunos arreglos en su casa.
texts.en:
Ms. Olga María Álvarez is a member of the Atenas communal bank. She lives in the Las Orquídeas ("The Orchids") neighborhood in the city of Cuenca. This city is known for it's beautiful scenery and in December 1999, it's historic center was named a World Heritage Site. The varied cuisine of Cuenca makes it a beautiful and warm city. Ms. Olga is 49 years old, married, and has 6 children, who are 28, 26, 24, 22, 20, and 16 years old. Her oldest daughter is married and lives independently. Her second oldest, a son, is single and lives on his own. Her third oldest, a son, works and helps with the household finances. Her fourth oldest, a daughter, is studying at the university, and her two youngest children attend high school. Her husband is a taxi driver. With their joint sacrifice, they have been able to construct a small house. Ms. Olga has been a client of Fundación ESPOIR for 10 years. The loans she has received have been beneficial to her business. She has run a store out of her house for 20 years. She works from Sunday to Sunday, selling from 6 a.m. until 9 p.m. In her free time, she knits scarves and quilts, which she sells to her friends. She will use the money from this loan to purchase more food products to stock her store. Her goal is to make certain repairs to her house.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sugar, oil, eggs, rice, and foodstuffs in general

loans.name: Phin

texts.en:
Mr. Phin B. (pictured here) and his wife, Mrs. Sophy Leav, live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They married in 1987 and have three children--two sons and one daughter. Two of their children have full-time employment in Phnom Penh, and another one attends school.

Phin is a motor taxi driver. He is requesting a loan of US$ 500 to purchase a sugar cane juice machine for his wife. In the past, Mrs. Sophy Leav used to be a silk weaver, but she quit that business.

loans.use: To purchase a sugar cane juice machine for his wife's business

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.en:
Benedicta D. is 74 years old, is widowed, and resides in Pandan which is located in the Province of Antique.

Benedicta has a store in her house where she sells basic necessities and all types of products that people use in their homes. She is requesting a loan so that she can have the funds needed to buy more food products and basic household necessities. This will allow her to attract more customers and increase her sales.

Benedicta’s business is very important because it enables her to provide better financial stability for her family, enabling them to live in a decent manner. She hopes to provide them with everything necessary to move forward against poverty.

Benedicta dreams of the best for her family: to have an expanded business and to have a happy family. She has shown herself to be hard-working and strong-minded enough to make her dreams come true and she is hoping that her business will continue to be more productive and improve the overall quality of life of her entire family.

loans.use: To buy more food products and basic household necessities

loans.name: Noemí Alejandrina

texts.es:
Noemi de 64 años, tiene una pequeña tienda en la parte delantera de su casa, vive en la Perimetral de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, a su alrededor tiene el estero salado). 

Cuando Noemi tenia 28 años se caso y con sus ahorros ubico una farmacia en su casa pero como no le fue bien en ese negocio decidió vender su mercadería y comprar víveres para una tienda.  Ya que no puede salir a menudo los proveedores le van a dejar los víveres a su tienda. Ella trabaja desde muy temprano hasta el anochecer vendiendo bebidas, arroz snack etc. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz, azúcar, enlatados, bebidas etc. En el futuro quiere mejorar la fachada de su casa para ubicar un piso mas en su casa y dárselo a uno de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Noemí, aged 64, has a small store at the front of her house. She lives within the city boundaries of Guayaquil in a peri-urban area, next to the estuary of Estero Salado.

At the age of 28 Noemí got married and opened a drugstore at home. However, she was not successful in this business and decided to sell her inventory and buy groceries for her store. Since she cannot often leave her store, the suppliers deliver the groceries to her place. She works from early morning to dusk, selling drinks, rice, snacks etc.

She wants to use her loan to buy rice, sugar, canned food, drinks etc. For the future she intends to renovate the façade of her house and add another floor to her house which she will give to one of her children.

loans.use: To buy rice, drinks and snacks

loans.name: Hazel

texts.en: Hazel L. is a married woman who lives in Prk. Hangkayaw, Brgy. Nabulao, Sipalay City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating three business ventures: a general store, a rice mill and farming. Her husband, Alipio Loquiso, who is 47 years old, works as a rice mill operator to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have four children who are between 5 and 21 years old. Hazel joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1998 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 14 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Hazel has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 13,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 15th loan, she is borrowing PHP 12,000, which she intends to use to buy fertilizers for her farm so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children and the improvement of her businesses. Hazel L. is a Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable) woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon . Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Sofia Nalamai

texts.en:
Sofia M., aged 48, runs a grocery at Bissil market in Kajiado. She sells her goods to the Bissil residents and also gets business from the hotels and butchers nearby. She is married to Senteu M., who is a farmer, and together they have four children; two daughters aged 20 and 17 and two sons aged 12 and 10. All the children attend school. 

Sofia has been running her business for 11 years and her monthly profit is 8,150 KES. With the loan she plans to buy more stock of beans, fruits, eggs and vegetables for sale. She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer.

If the loan boosts the business, Sofia will save the extra income until it enables her to buy a pickup, which she will use to transport the fruits and vegetables from farmers in the upcountry to the market place.

Sofia describes herself as hardworking and dreams that one day she will be supplying fruits and vegetables to Nairobi business people.

loans.use: To buy beans, vegetables, fruits and eggs for sale

loans.name: Salome Marcos

texts.pt:
Salomé Marcos M. nasceu na Provincia de Gaza, Sul de Moçambique,é solteira  mãe de 2 filhas de 24 e 26 anos de idade nenhuma das duas encontra se a estudar, pois trabalham todas juntas. Fez somente 4ª classe e não continuou devido a gravidez precoce. Vive na casa propria e para além das suas filhas responsabiliza se pelos seus 4 netos que vivem com ela em sua casa, consegue poupar 2.000.00mt.

Saiu de Gaza para o Distrito de Namaacha com sua amiga a procura de emprego, chegado começa a trabalhar no Governo do Distrito como servente, mas devido a doença ela teve que abandonar o emprego porque a descriminavam no seu sector de trabalho. Os anos foram passando Salomé começa a trabalhar com plantas de varias especies tais como,(azaleias, antores e catos) pois são faceis de multiplicar e  ela tem muito jeito para jardinhagem e cultiva um lindo jardim em sua casa. Hoje  é uma das mais famosas da região, vendendo flóres ate para pessoas da capital Maputo ganhando por mês aproximadamente 10.000.00mt porque para além de vender ela tem contratos de jardinhagem com proprietários de quintas na vila.


Este é o quarto empréstimo de Salomé na Hluvuku e Kiva, no valor de 20.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar sementes para a multiplicação das suas plantas. Os anteriores empréstimos foram de (15.000.00mt, 10.000.00mt e 20.000.mt) forão para a mesma finalidade. 

Esta confiante que vai melhorar muito no seu negócio e deste modo reembolsar sem nenhum problema.
texts.en:
Salomé Marcos M. was born in the Gaza Province, South Mozambique. She is single and has two daughters who are 24 and 26 years old. None of them go to school because they all work together. She only went to school until 4th grade and did not finish due to a teen pregnancy. She lives in her own home and besides her two daughters, she also supports her four grandchildren who live with her. She manages to save 2,000 meticais.

She left Gaza to go to the Namaacha District with a friend, looking for work. Once she got there she started working for the District's government, as a janitor. She had to leave her job due to the workplace discrimination she suffered because of her illness. Years went by and Salome started working with various plants (azaleas, antores and catos) because they are easy to multiply. She has a gift for gardening and grows a beautiful garden in her house. Today she is one of the most famous flower sellers in the region. She even sells to people in the capital, Maputo. She makes approximately 10,000 meticais because besides selling she has gardening contracts with the village's landowners. 

This loan, in the amount of 20,000 meticais, is Salome's fourth with Hluvuku and Kiva. She intends to purchase seeds to multiply her plants. The previous loans were for 15,000, 10,000 and 20,000 and were used for the same goal.

She is confident she will increase her business and that she will have no issues paying the loan back.

loans.use: Purchase of seeds to multiply her plants

loans.name: Esmerna's Group

texts.en:
Esmerna P. is from the town of Puntod, Lopez Jaena. She is 40 years old. Esmerna is the group leader of a 2-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Pandan.

Esmerna is married. To make a living, Esmerna owns & operates a business venture in the food sector operating a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling seafood product such as fish in the local community.  Esmerna has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 1000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Esmerna joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Esmerna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6000 PHP from GDMPC. Esmerna is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fish to raise. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Esmerna from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to raise

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es:
Manuela es socia del Banco comunal Despertar, tiene 47 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos D. 23 y 20 años D. edad. Manuela es feriante, viaja a las feria D. Seccelambras llevando abarrotes en general, ahí compra cereales y los trae a Ayacucho, lo venD. en el mercado mayorista Playa Grau o a veces a su casero que es mayorista que lo lleva a Ica.
Su sueño es que su negocio crezca y que sus hijos puedan terminar su carrera profesional en la Universidad.
texts.en:
Manuela, a member of the “Despertar” ("To Awaken") Communal Bank, is 47 years old, married, and has 2 children, aged 23 and 20. She is a stall-holder and travels to the Seccelambras fair, carrying groceries in general. There she buys grains and brings them back to Ayacucho to sell in the Playa Grau (Grau Beach) wholesale market, or at times, for her own wholesaler who sells them in Ica.

Manuela's dream is that her business will grow and her children will finish their professional career studies in the University.

loans.use: TO BUY VARIOUS GRAINS TO SELL

loans.name: Lilian Onyuma

texts.en:
Lilian Onyuma O. is a 38-year-old lady married to Dominic, and together they are blessed with three children. Lilian is a grocery shop owner and a charcoal dealer in Shanzu. She has been in this business for the last three years.

This marks Lilian’s second loan from KADET LTD. With the loan, she plans to purchase more bags of charcoal for her business. Her anticipated profits will be directed to her children’s education.

Lilian’s dream is to become a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Nulu

texts.en:
Nulu M. is 21 years old and lives in the town of Bugembe in the Jinja region of Uganda. She is married and has three children, two of whom are currently in school. Nulu has a salon business, which she has run for six years.
To help expand her business, Nulu has requested a loan of 150,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase braids for the hair. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Nulu hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees. In the future, she hopes to own a plot of land. Nulu is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to work hard.

loans.use: To purchase braids for the hair

loans.name: Efrain Miguel

texts.es: Efrain Miguel, tiene 24 años de edad, es soltero, es ayudante de albañil y cuando no tiene trabajo de albañileria, se dedica a tejer ropa típica de la localidad, cuenta con 5 años de experiencia, cruzo el segundo grado de primaria en la escuela de su comunidad, solicita su primer crédito en ASDIR para sufragar gastos de matrimonio, en su comunidad es conocido como un joven responsable y participativo.
texts.en: Efrain is 24 years old and single. He works as a bricklayer's assistant, and when he is not doing this he knits clothing that is typical in his region. He has five years of experience and attended school through the second grade. He is requesting his first loan from the Asociacion ASDIR to pay for his wedding expenses. In his community he is known as a responsible and lively young man.

loans.use: Wedding Celebration Expenses

loans.name: Susana

texts.es: Susana tiene 61 años, vive con su esposo en su casa propia. Hace más D. 6 años que posee una tienda en el interior D. su casa, ya que en años anteriores lo tenía en otro lugar, pero el alquilar no le era muy rentable. Hoy su tienda esta implementada D. diversos productos, que necesarios para sus clientes, permitiéndole así captar más clientela y sus ganancias aumentar. Por otro lado, esta laboriosa mujer se dedica a la agricultura, y D. los productos que cosecha lo venD. en su tienda, así es como se gana la vida y ahora con mayor prioridad necesita implementar su tienda con más productos. Es su  séptimo crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta D.  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte D. su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso D. su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra D. mercadería para su tienda en gaseosas, productos comestibles, y cerveza.
texts.en:
Susana, 61, lives with her husband in her own house.  She’s had a store in her house for over six years because years ago she had it in another place but rent was not affordable.  Today, her store is stocked with various products that are needed by her customers allowing her to capture more customers and increase profits.

On the other hand, this hard working woman also farms and she sells what she harvests in her store.  This is how she earns a living so her priority to stock her store now is even higher.

This is her 7th loan with MFP.  She is very happy to know that she has financial support because she’s always been responsible with her payments. Besides, she enjoys being part of a communal bank because all the members are responsible, mutually supportive people.  She thanks all those who will fund the loan that will be so useful for her business’ progress.  

She will use the requested loan to buy merchandise for her store like soft drinks, food items and beer.

loans.use: To buy more stock food items for her store.

loans.name: Nemesia

texts.en: Nemesia is a married woman who lives in Cebu. She earns her living by weaving abaca. Her husband Alejandro, who is 54 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have four children who are between 18 and 28 years old. Nemesia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past four loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Nemesia has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 10,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 4,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her fifth loan, she is borrowing PHP 15,000, which she intends to use to buy abaca fiber for weaving and also to pay for other operating expenses so that she can continue to save up for future family needs. Nemesia is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: to purchase abaca fiber for her abaca weaving business

loans.name: Uuganjargal

texts.en:
Uuganjargal, 33, is married and lives with her husband and two children in a house that they own on a small plot of land in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. They enjoy a decent standard of living, as in 2001 her husband began making water tanks and water trucks which Uuganjargal sells at a local market. With a current inventory of 1,000,000 MNT, their family-based business is stable, and sometimes they get custom orders.

Uuganjargal is now requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to purchase more materials and necessary equipment for their business. She says, "We want to expand our business and have our own workshop in the future".

loans.use: to purchase more materials for their business

loans.name: Maura

texts.en:
Maura works hard to support her family. Maura is married and has a crab and fish vending business in the Philippines.

Maura requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to buy crabs and fish to sell.

Maura has been in this business for 25 years now.

In the future, Maura would like to save money to expand her business. The photo was taken after the center meeting. Only the crab is shown  because her fish already sold out early in the morning.

loans.use: to buy additional crabs and fish to sell

loans.name: Rayda

texts.es: Rayda, de 25 años, es una mujer sociable y trabajadora, vive en su propia casa junto a su  pareja Raúl de 37 años y sus 02 queridos hijos,  lo que más desea es brindar una buena educación a sus hijos, para lo cual está dispuesta a trabajar muy duro. Con mucho esfuerzo Rayda ha logrado abrir  su tienda  de bebidas como: gaseosas, cervezas, y helados, por lo cual se esmera por brindar una buena comodidad a sus clientes, es así que los fines de semana es muy concurrido su local por los pobladores de su zona quienes después de realizar sus deportes favoritos se ponen a degustar las bebidas heladas. Lleva 02 años en este negocio y le va muy bien. En adelante desea ampliar su negocio y comprar más congeladoras y así mantener sus bebidas refrigeradas. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar sus cuotas puntualmente si desea acceder a otro préstamo posteriormente. Agradece a la institución por concederle el préstamo. Con el crédito solicitado comprará una maquina fotocopiadora y prestar servicio de fotocopias a los alumnos de diferentes centros educativos ya que tiene espacio suficiente para montar este negocio.
texts.en:
Rayda, age 25, is a very friendly and hard-working woman.  She lives in her own house with her life partner, 37 year old Raúl, and their two beloved children.  What she wants most of all is to give her children a good education.  In order to do this she is prepared to work very hard.

With great effort Rayda has managed to open a store with drinks like soft drinks, beer, and frozen drinks.  She does her best to make her customers very comfortable.  That is why her place is very busy on the week-ends.   The villagers in the area come to enjoy frozen drinks after they play their favorite sport.  She has had this business for two years, and it is going very well for her.

In the future she wishes to expand her business.  She wants to buy more freezers in order to keep the drinks refrigerated.

This is her first loan with MFP.  She knows that she has to make her payments on time if she wishes to get another loan later on.  She is grateful to the institution for granting the loan.  She will use the requested loan to buy a photocopy machine.  She will provide photocopy services to the students in different educational centers because she has enough space to start up this business.

loans.use: to buy a photocopier

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more beauty products.

loans.name: Jorge Washington

texts.es:
Jorge de 49 años, vive en una zona urbana en el Guasmo (fue nombrado así debido a la especie de árboles Guazuma ulmifolia. El Guasmo es un barrio popular, de clase humilde, que anteriormente era una hacienda) de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento y si cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, tiene un taller de cerrajería y automotriz.

Comenzó como ayudante en un taller y luego empezó a comprarse poco a poco maquinas y herramientas para abrir su propio negocio. El labora junto con un empleado desde las 8H00 am a 18h00 pm. Con la ayuda del préstamo quiere comprar maquinas de cortar $240 planchas de moldear $150 herramientas varias $100 para mejorar su negocio. En un futuro quiere comprar otra maquinas para poder abastecerse con la demanda de trabajo que tiene.
texts.en:
Jorge, 49, lives in an urban zone in El Guasmo (named after a species of tree, Guazuma ulmifolia.  El Guasmo is a popular, humble neighborhood that used to be a hacienda in Guayaquil).  His house is cement and has all basic utilities.  He has a car repair and metal working shop.

He started out as a shop assistant and then gradually bought some machinery and tools to open his own shop.  He has an employee that helps him.  He works from 8am until 6pm.  

With help from the loan he wants to buy saws ($240), molding presses ($150) and assorted tools ($100) for his shop.  In the future he wants to buy other machines to equip himself for the demand of work he has.

loans.use: to buy saws, molding presses and tools.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 41 years old. She is married and has seven children between the ages of 10 and 15 years old. She owns a small business selling milk, water and eggs. This business is well known and organized. She has one year of experience and she employees two people to help her.

Rose has requested her first loan from Kiva lenders, via Vision Finance Company, in order to expand her business by purchasing more milk, water and eggs to sell. Rose will be able to earn more profit. With this extra profit, she plans to build her own house and to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase more milk, water and eggs.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is a married with two children who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Lina is 41 years old.

Lina has a business selling brined shrimp in the Philippines. Lina requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more shrimp to brine and sell.

Lina has been in this business for 14 years.  In the future, Lina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more shrimp to brine and sell

loans.name: Phary

texts.en:
Phary, 47 year old, is a farmer.  Her husband is a driver in a factory and their income is $4.50 per day.  They have 4 children, two are studying in school and other two are working in a factory.  

Every month she has to spend $30 on food, $5 on electricity, $10 on rent house fee, and $35 on other expenses.  She would like to request a loan of $1,000 to buy a store in a market in Phnom Penh to sell groceries.  She also wants to buy a flat in Phnom Penh and send her last two children to study in the university.

loans.use: To buy a store in a market

loans.name: Iturbide Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama "IturbiD.", porque así se llama L. calle donD. se reúne el grupo. Está ubicado en el estado D. Morelos, en México. El grupo está conformado por 9 integrantes y es L. segunda vez que solicitan un prestamo. María es L. tesorera del grupo. Tiene 48 años, estudió hasta el quinto año D. primaria, vive en unión libre y tiene en total 3 hijos (2 varones y una mujer). ElL. se dedica a L. venta D. comida casera, negocio que inició hace 22 años. Solicita el préstamo para ampliar su negocio y piensa invertirlo en comprar más mercancía como insumos, refrescos y jugos. Sus clientes L. prefieren porque tiene buen sazón al preparar sus comidas. Al momento D. solicitar este préstamo se siente contenta. Con las ganancias obtenidas también espera apoyar a su hija que término L. escueL. para que continue estuniando y tenga una mejor vida. Observaciones, las personas que no se ven bien en L. foto son: Lorena y Jesus.
texts.en:
This group is called IturbiD., because that is the name of the street where the group meets.  It is located in the state of Morelos in México.  The group has nine members and this is the second time they are requesting a loan.  

María is the treasurer of the group.  She is 48 years old, went to school until the 5th year of primary school, lives in a common-law marriage, and has three children (two sons and a daughter).  She works selling homemaD. food, a business she started 22 years ago.  

She is asking for this loan to expand her business.  She wants to purchase more merchandise such as goods and supplies, sodas, and juices.  Her customers prefer her because her food has good flavor.  She feels happy to apply for this loan.  With the income she earns, she hopes to support her daughter who is finishing school so that she can continue studying and have a better life.
