The people that you don't see well in the photo are Lorena and Jesus.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise such as goods and supplies, soda, and juices.

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Belinda is 42 years old and married with three children. She is a farmer who grows rice in Banga, South Cotabato. Belinda sells her crop to rice traders. She also raises pigs in her backyard to sell at her town’s market.

Belinda is requesting a loan to purchase seed, fertilizer, and feed. In the future, she hopes to have a stable income to help support her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase seed, fertilizer, and feed

loans.name: Mónica Isabel

texts.es: Mónica (28 años) es una mujer valiente y dispuesta a luchar por sus ideales. Es casada y  madre de 3 hermosos niños. Ella trabajó junto a su pareja para comprar un terreno y levantar una casa de madera.El trabajo de Mónica empieza desde muy temprano, yendo al mercado en busca de las mejores verduras y carnes para así poder cocinar los menús que vende en un lugar cerca de su casa. Debido a que hay muchas obras en construcción, los obreros son sus clientes fijos. Ella cuenta con la ayuda de dos personas para este trabajo ya que sola no podría porque preparar comida para mucha gente.Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que la gente que tiene como clientes son muy puntuales y respetuosos. Lo que no le agrada es tener que levantarse temprano para ir al mercado ya que cuando su pareja no puede ir con ella, tiene que ir sola y el lugar por donde vive es un poco alejado de la ciudad y peligroso. Sin embargo Mónica sabe que todo riesgo vale la pena porque considera que su actividad es muy rentable.Este es el tercer préstamo de Mónica con la institución MFP y hasta ahora le ha ido bien con todo y espera poder seguir así ya que quiere seguir formando parte del grupo que trabaja con MFP.Con el monto solicitado 1500 soles ella comprará ingredientes e insumos para poder seguir en este trabajo que le gusta mucho.
texts.en: Mónica (28 years old) is a courageous woman who is ready to fight for her ideals. She is married and the mother of 3 beautiful children. She works, along with her husband, so they can buy a piece of land and build a wooden house. Mónica’s work begins very early in the morning, going to the market to choose the best vegetables and meats so that she can cook the meals that she sells in a place near her house. Because there are a lot of jobs in construction, the construction workers are her regular customers. She has two people to help her in her work because she couldn’t prepare food for so many people by herself. What she likes about her job is that the people who are her customers are punctual and respectful. What she doesn’t enjoy is having to get up early to go to the market because her husband can’t go with her. She has to go by herself and the area where she lives is on the outskirts of town and is dangerous. However, Mónica knows the risk is worth it because she finds her work to be very profitable. This is Mónica’s third loan with Microfinanzas Prisma and things have gone well for her. She expects to be able to continue the same and she wants to continue to be part of the group that works with Microfinanzas Prisma. With the PEN 1,500.00 that she has requested, she will buy ingredients and inputs to continue working in this business she likes so much.

loans.use: buy ingredients and inputs to continue working in this business she likes so much.

loans.name: Altankhuyag

texts.en: Mr. Altankhuyag is 31 years old and has applied for a loan to raise his current business assets. He manages a clothing retail kiosk in a store called “Sunday” and has been running this business since 2008. Currently he is unmarried and lives in a ger: a nomadic tent of Mongolia. He sells many typical clothing including sports, seasonal and casual clothes. Now, he is planning to purchase a large number of brand-named clothes from abroad. But, he has a financial problem in carrying out this plan. A loan he is taking will be used to supplement the purchase of his inventory.

loans.use: to aggregate the money of his sale commodities supply.

loans.name: Kadidia

texts.fr:
Madame Kadidia a plus de 30 ans, mariée, mère de deux fillettes et vivant avec son époux et leurs enfants à Sanoubougou I-Kapel Kourou, un des quartiers périphériques de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Madame Kadidia après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès, s’est initiée à cette activité d’achat et vente des produits alimentaires et condiments tels , le thé Arawane, l’huile alimentaire, le couscous arabe, les boîtes de petits pois, de macédoines de légumes, les cubes Magie, les sels de cuisine, les boîtes de concentrées de tomate, les sachets de moutarde et divers autres condiments alimentaires depuis plus de six  années. Elle mène son activité à la maison et au marché de son quartier où elle dispose  d’une place. Elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de collaborer avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant de trois ans. Elle est actuellement à son 5ème prêt  et tous les quatre précédents ont été bien remboursés.
 Elle compte acheter avec ce prêt, 10 bidons d’huile alimentaire, 5 cartons de couscous arabe, 12 cartons de maggie, 5 cartons du thé Arawane et de stock de condiments. Elle  achète ses marchandises sur commande à Bobo Dioulasso (république de Burkina Faso) et aussi dans les huileries de place avant de les revendre en détail, au comptant et à crédit au marché de sa localité.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 180 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce de ses dépenses, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en:
Mrs. Kadidia is over thirty years old, married, and is the mother of two girls. She lives with her husband and their children in Sanoubougou I-Kapel Kourou, one of the suburbs of the city of Sikasso (the third administrate region of the Republic of Mali). 

After conducting many unsuccessful activities, Mrs. Kadidia entered into the business of buying and selling food products and seasonings such as Arawane tea, cooking oil, Arabian couscous, boxes of peas, vegetable salads, Magic Cubes [cubes of seasoning], cooking salts, boxes of tomato concentrate, bags of mustard, and various other food seasonings. She has been in business for over six years. She runs her business out of her home as well as from her space in her neighborhood market. She is much sought after by her customers because of the quality of her products. 

In order to satisfy her increasingly expanding clientele, she decided to collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution and has been working with them for three years now. She is currently in her fifth loan cycle and has repaid all of her four past loans. With this loan, she plans to buy 10 drums of cooking oil, 5 cases of Arabian couscous, 12 cases of Maggie [Magic Cubes], 5 cases of Arawane tea, and to stock up on seasonings. She purchases her goods on order in Bobo Dioulasso (in the republic of Burkina Faso) and at nearby oil mills before reselling them at her local market as retail for cash or on credit. 

With this loan, she envisions achieving a monthly profit of 180,000 FCFA, which she will use primarily to supplement her business assets for her expenses, to contribute to her family's expenses, and to pay the interest on her loan.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. She works hard to support her family. 

Diana requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fishing nets for her business.

Diana has been in this business for 14 years now.

In the future, Diana would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional fishing nets for her business

loans.name: Liz Mariela

texts.es: la señorita Liz  se dedica a la venta de accesorios para celulares como carcasas radios,  USB, chicotillos , cables USB, cargadores vende en una de las avenidas mas concurridas de la ciudad de La Paz y vive en la zona céntrica de la ciudad,  pertenece a un banco de emprendimiento  Sam Soom  es cliente antigua muy responsable  el dinero del crédito es  para la  compra de mercadería en cargadores, radios carcasas de celular y de este modo incrementar su capital de trabajo, es una persona joven con ganas de superación, trabaja duro ya que su deseo es el de mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Liz sells cell phone accessories like cases, radios, USBs, cables, straps and chargers along the city of La Paz’s busiest streets.  She lives in the central part of the city and belongs to the Sam Soom communal bank.  She’s a longstanding client and very responsible.  The money from the loan is to buy merchandise like chargers, radios, mobile phone cases to increase working capital.  She’s a young person with a strong drive to improve.  She works hard because she wants to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy cell phone cables and chargers.

loans.name: Sokhom

texts.en: Sokhom, 54, is a grocery seller who earns $1.5 per day. She is a single mother and lives with her one daughter, who works in a garment factory earning $2 per day. Every month, she has to spend $50 on food, $5 on electricity, and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $200 to buy more grocery goods to sell. She hopes she can have enough money to extend her career to sell more kinds of products.

loans.use: to buy more grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Souad

texts.en: Souad is a 55-year-old Lebanese widowed woman living with her kids. She has been working as a housekeeper since 2000. After noticing that her income is barely sufficient to satisfy her family needs, she decided to start her own business working in producing Lebanese homemade food. Today, she’s asking to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase cooking tools and supplies. She plans to expand her business in order to augment her revenue. Souad’s only target is to be able to support her family well, especially after her husband’s death.

loans.use: to purchase cooking tools and supplies.

loans.name: Adelaida  Del Carmen

texts.es:
La Sra.  Adelaida tiene una pequeña fábrica de lácteos donde fabrica productos de queso y crema acida, estos productos son comercializados en el mercado Ivan Montenegro. Ella junto son su esposo se en cargan de ver el negocio. Tiene mas de veinte años de tener este tipo de actividad comercial.
Ella acude a las oficinas de ceprodel para solicitar un nuevo financiamiento para la compra de leche.
texts.en: Adelaida has a small dairy factory where she makes cheese and sour cream products. These products are sold in the Ivan Montenegro market. She and her husband oversee the business, and she has been doing this type of commercial activity for more than twenty years. She came to the CEPRODEL offices to request a new loan for the purchase of milk.

loans.use: to purchase milk for making cheese and sour cream

loans.name: Hong

texts.en:
Hong is a 33-year-old married woman with two children. She lives with her husband and children in Ho Chi Minh City. Hong has run a  business of selling lime since 1999. Hong's husband supports the family as a driver for hire and sometimes helps her run her business. 

Hong would like a loan to increase the scale of her business by purchasing more lime in bulk. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers. 

She also hopes that through her loan she will increase her income and allow her to save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to expand her current business by purchasing lime in bulk to sell.

loans.name: Angela Patricia

texts.es: La señora Ángela a sus 36 años de edad es madre de un hijo de 9 años, se dedica a la venta de almuerzos y desayunos en la semana en su negocio ubicado al norte de la ciudad de Medellín y los fines de semana tiene un punto de venta de comidas rápidas.  La señora Ángela necesita comprar una olla grande para fritar que le permita producir mas empandas, buñuelos y palitos de queso, lo anterior le permitirá aumentar sus ventas y así poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su hijo y a futuro tener su propio restaurante.
texts.en: Ángela is 36 years old and mother of her 9-year-old son. She makes a living selling lunch and breakfast during the week at her business located to the north of the city Medellín. On the weekends she has a fast food stall. Ángela needs to buy a large pot to fry food. This will allow her to make more pasties, small donuts, and cheese sticks. The pot will allow her to increase her sales and thus be able to better the her son's quality of life and in the future have her own restaurant.

loans.use: to buy a pot to fry food.

loans.name: Isroil

texts.ru: Исроил целеустремленный и ответственный человек. Он женат и имеет двоих детей. Более 5 лет он занимается купле- продажей овец и выращиванием пшеницы и ячменя. Его жена помогает ему по ухаживанию и откорма скота, а также в  переработке земли и посева семян. Исроил хотел бы получить займ в размере 3000 Сомони  для  покупки  5 голов овец и на  остальную сумму хочет посеять пшеницу и ячмень. На полученный доход хочет благоустроить свой дом.
texts.en: Isroil is a goal oriented and dependable man. He is married and has two children. For more then five years he has been growing wheat and oats and raising sheep. his wife helps him take care and feed the animals as well as work the land and plant seeds. Isroil wants to take out this loan of 3000 somoni to purchase five sheep and will use the rest of the money to plant more wheat and oats. He is hoping to use the profits from this loan to make improvements to his home.

loans.use: To buy sheep and seeds

loans.name: Rosmelly Karina

texts.es: Esta pequeña historia data de una joven estudiante que tiene un gran espíritu por salir adelante, Rosmelly de 22 años de edad, estudia para ser diseñadora de moda,  ella se esmera todo el día para poder obtener buenas calificaciones y estar entre los primeros de su clase, nos comenta que escogió este estudio  ya que desde pequeña le llamo mucha la atención los dibujos de los trajes, la moda. Ella en el futuro desearía ser una empresaria de la moda, ser muy exitosa y reconocida, terminando sus estudios le gustaría implementar  un taller en su propia casa para poder realizar   todos sus diseños, a su vez le gustaría estudiar ingles para poder viajar a otros países para hacer unos cursos de diseño y moda, por el cual el reciente préstamo es para pagar sus estudios. Rosmelly es una joven estudiante con  grandes deseos de superación,  con metas bien establecidas y con gran futuro profesional.
texts.en:
This little story is about a young student who has a tremendous will to get ahead.  Rosmelly is 22 years old, and she is studying to be a fashion designer.  She does her utmost all day in order to be able to get good grades and to be among the best in her class.

She tells us that she chose this field of study because ever since she was little drawings of clothing and fashion caught her attention a lot.  In the future she wishes to be a businesswoman in the fashion industry.  She also wishes to be very successful and well-known.

Upon finishing her studies she would like to set up a workshop in her own house in order to be able to make all of her designs.  At the same time she would like to study English to be able to travel to other countries to take some fashion and design classes.  The recent loan is to pay for her studies.

Rosmelly is a young student with big wishes for self-improvement, well established goals, and a great professional future.

loans.use: to pay for her educational costs.

loans.name: Progreso Y Desarrollo Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Villa Elisa se unieron 21 mujeres con las ganas de formar parte del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación paraguaya. El objetivos que tuvieron para unirse ha sido salir adelante y de esa forma poder ayudar a su familia. Ellas se encuentran muy contentas con la ayuda y las capacitaciones que están recibiendo.
Una de las miembros es la señora Maria, quien nos comenta que es modista. Ella hace todo tipo de trabajos en telas, como ser camisas, remeras, pantalones y demás. Ella se define como una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora que lucha por darle lo mejor a su familia. Una de sus metas es poder seguir creciendo y poder trabajar con grandes empresas.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de telas, hilos, botones, cierres y demás insumos necesarios para surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
In the city of Villa Elisa, 21 women got together with the desire to be part of Fundación Paraguaya's program for women entrepreneurs.  Their objective in getting together has been to get ahead and in this way be able to help their families.  They are very contented with the help and the training they are receiving.

One of the members is María, who tells us she is a dressmaker.  She does all types of work in fabric, such as shirts, t-shirts, pants, and others.  She describes herself as a very hard-working and enterprising woman who struggles to give her family the best.  One of her goals is to be able to continue growing and be able to work with big companies.

She is requesting the loan to buy fabric, buttons, closures, and other necessary supplies to stock her business.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, buttons, closures, and other supplies.

loans.name: Gracita

texts.en:
Gracita is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has six children. 

Gracita is buying and peddling vegetables like eggplants and string beans. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 4,000 to buy stocks of vegetables to sell.

Gracita is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: El señor José nacido  en Chuquisaca, actualmente vive y tiene su parcela en la localidad de Betanzos a 25 km de limoncito hacia el sur,  el se dedica a la agricultura siembra: maíz, sorgo, sandia, y también se dedica a la producción del carbón, todo lo que el siembra lo saca a vender al mercado de la zona,  ya viene trabajando con emprender hace cinco créditos, por  que es la única institución que le ha brindado un apoyo para mejorar su calidad  de vida, por lo cual el cliente manifiesta que esta muy agradecido con la institución ya que con este dinero del crédito comprar semillas para la siembra de maíz y también lo utilizara en el preparado de la tierra para la siembra.
texts.en:
José, born in Chuquisaca, currently lives and has his land in the community of Betanzos, 25 kilometers to the south of Limoncito.  He works in agriculture growing corn, sorghum, and watermelon, and he also works producing charcoal.  He takes everything he grows to the area market.

He has been working with Emprender for five loans because it is the only institution that has given him support to improve his quality of life.  The client says he is very grateful to the institution for this because with the money from the loan he will buy seeds for the corn crop.  He also will use it to prepare the land for planting.

loans.use: to buy seeds to grow corn.

loans.name: Umedjon

texts.ru:
Умедчон  мужчина в возрасте 28 лет. Он  женат и имеет двоих детей. Его жену зовут  Саодат.  Она домохозяйка.  Умедчон  очень трудолюбивый парень, любит семью и старается для семейного благополучия! Он работает продавцом в мебельном магазине. В месяц он зарабатывает 1800-2000 сомон.
В данное время Умедчон вместе со своей женой хотят отремонтировать дом, где они живут, чтобы улучшить условия для проживания. Но собственных средств у них недостаточно. Для этого Умедчон обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку строительных материалов для ремонта дома. Он надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en: Umedjon Boboev is a 28-year old man. He is married. His wife, Saodat Barotovna Chumaeva, is a homemaker and does not work outside the home. Umedjon has two children. He is a very hard-working person who loves his family and does everything for them. He has been collaborating with our organization since February 13, 2015. This is his first time he is taking out a loan of 3,000 TJS for 12 month to renovate his house. He works as a salesperson in a furniture store. He works well and earns 1800-2000 TJS per month. Eventually he would like to take out a big credit. Umedjon father lives with him. His father sells brand name medications and earns 1200-1500 TJS per month. In the future [Umedjon] would like to continue collaborating with Arvand. He thanks our organization in advance and says: "Thank you for your trust and support!" He is truly grateful.

loans.use: to buy the building materials

loans.name: Afdal

texts.en: Afdal is a 32 years old Lebanese married woman and mother of two children, who are still studying. Her husband is the main income source in the family, he works in a gas station. Today, she is in need to borrow a loan from kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay school fees for her children. She is very happy that she will be able to ensure a good education for them what makes her very happy and thankful for Kiva.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Marco Tulio Morales

texts.en: My name is Tulio Morales, my business is the making and selling of cement blocks.  My operation is located on my property where I live, near the town of La Entrada a Copn.  We live in an area where there are a lot of cement shops like mine.  Right now, I have several good orders from people that live in neighboring townships, people who have their own construction businesses.  Peolple come to me for my good quality and fair price.  I have four children of school age, so I work hard to have a good businesss.

loans.use: Purchase of materials such as cement, sand, and gravel.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario has 20 years experience in business, which she started at the age of 23 when she traveled with her Mother to Peru to buy merchandise.  He Mother helped her with $100 of capital which she lent her to start her own business.  After that, she got married and left the business for a time, but then realized that she would need to have her own money and that is how she came to get a loan and reactivate her business 5 years later. At this time she decided to sell cosmetics due to a friend's suggestions.  She has maintained that work until the present time, working from 9am until 7pm.  Rosario wants the loan to invest in her business and get more income.  The company she is dealing with gives rewards to its consultants based on how much they sell each month. Rosario is 43 years of age, and has three children, the oldest works and pays for school, and the other two, by means of her business plan to finsh school and then work.  She is separated from her husband for the past 8 months, and her main desire now is to be able to buy a car to get around since her work requires her to walk promoting her products, and with a car she could do that and save time.

>p< >b< Translated from Spanish by Dwight Davis, Kiva Volunteer.>/b<>p<

loans.use: Rosa will invest in cosmetic products to sell

loans.name: Eldar

texts.en: Eldar is an Internally Displaced Person from the Armenian-occupied Zangilan district of Azerbaijan. He fled to Baku in 1993. Married, he has two children. He started his business in 1995, and borrowed five Normicro loans from Baku branch totaling $3000. Now he wants to borrow $1200 to increase the variety of goods in his shop.

loans.use: To increase variety of goods

loans.name: Huyen

texts.en: Huyen is 45 years old.  She lives with her youngest daughter, who is an 8 year old and a student in primary school. Huyen runs a grocery store at home because she has no land for cultivation. She hopes to get a loan of $75 so that she can stock up her grocery store. The family income is $10 per person/month. Mrs. Huyen is going to repay the loan on a monthly basis.

loans.use: to add stock to the grocery store.

loans.name: Palolo

texts.en: Palolo is married with 4 children. Her husband is unemployed and they rely on their plantation as a source of income for the family. Palolo decided to join the SPBD loan programme so she could get some money to buy a weed sprayer, cromoxone chemical and other things needed for her plantation. Palolo and her husband are working extremely hard on their plantation and hope to own a mini market to sell their crops in  future.

loans.use: To purchase a weed sprayer and Cromoxone chemical, etc. for the family's plantation.

loans.name: Maria Elisa

texts.es:
Doña Maria Elisa is 38 years old, has 2 children and her husband works at a contruction site. She sells timber in the town of Tuxtla Gutiérrez with some distribuitors and also from her home. She belongs to the group Reina 5 together with doña Mauricia García Méndez, who sells food from a stand and doña Guadalupe T. Hernández, who sells clothes from her home. With the loan they will buy implements to condition their houses and promote the sale of their products.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

MARIA E., tiene 38 años, 2 hijos, su esposo trabaja en las obras de una construcción, ella se dedica a la venta de maderas en la ciudad de Tuxtla Gutiérrez con unos distribuidores y también en su casa. Pertenece al grupo Reina 5 junto con doña Mauricio García Méndez (vende comida en un local día por medio) y doña Guadalupe T. Hernández (venta de ropa en su casa). Con el préstamo compraran implementos para acondicionar sus casas y promocionar y vender mejor sus productos.

loans.use: PROMOTE SALE OF TIMBER

loans.name: Thai

texts.en: Mrs. Thai T., age 23, is a housewife. Her husband (pictured in the photo) is a recycler, earning about US$1 a day from selling the items he collects to a recycling plant. They have two small children who are not yet in school. Mrs. T. would like to borrow US$600 in order to purchase five piglets to raise, feed, and house in a barn. By then selling the grown pigs, she will be able to increase the family’s income, which will help finance her children’s education one day.

loans.use: Purchase of pigs to raise and sell

loans.name: Khatira

texts.en: Khatira (her husband is pictured) was born in 1977. She has 2 children. The Hadjiyev"s family lives in the Khachmaz region. They have been in this business for 3 years. Now they need a loan of $850 to buy one cattle for improving their cattle breeding.

loans.use: To buy one cattle

loans.name: Adjowa

texts.fr:
Madame A. Adjowa est mariée et mère de six (06) enfants. Très dynamique, elle arrive à contribuer aux charges du ménage grâce aux revenus de son commerce de vente de denrées alimentaires. Très exigeante en matière d’hygiène, elle est beaucoup appréciée par les habitants de son milieu.

Ayant pour ambition de renforcer son commerce, elle sollicite un crédit de $300 qui va lui permettre de constituer un stock permanent de riz, haricot huile et autres pour sa restauration. Ceci améliorera ses revenus ainsi que les conditions de vie au sein de son foyer.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva volunteer.

Madame Adjowa A. is married and mother of six children. She is a very dynamic woman who uses the income from her food-selling business to contribute to her household expenses. Fastidious with respect to hygiene, she is highly esteemed by local residents.

Wishing to strengthen her catering business, she is asking for a loan of $300 that will allow her to build up a permanent stock of rice, beans, oil and so on. This will allow Madame A. to increase her income and improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to stock up on rice, beans and oil for her catering business

loans.name: Ann

texts.en: Ann S. is married with 2 children, is 40 years old, and comes from Shibiri, Lagos state, Nigeria. She rents out plastic chairs & tables for parties and any celebration. She learned how to do this business for 5 years, and she has been in it since 1998. She now needs a loan of $450 to enable her to buy more chairs and tables. This loan will help her serve her customers better. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more plastic chairs and table to rent.

loans.name: Susan

texts.es:
Susan belongs to the Warac Community Bank. She sells pies and cakes for all types of social events. She runs her business from her house, which is located in the Independencia district, Huaraz province, in the city of Ancash. With this loan of $450, which she will repay in six months, she will buy three crates of eggs, 120 kilos of flour, 4 boxes of butter, and a bottle of vanilla. She is 35-years-old, married, and has three small children. Her husband is a mechanic and both of them work to raise their children.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Susan, pertenece al Banco Comunal Warac, se dedica a la elaboración de tortas y pasteles, atiende pedidos para toda clase de eventos sociales. Ella realiza su negocio en si casa que esta ubicada distrito de Independencia, provincia de Huaraz departamento de Ancash. Con el préstamo de S/.1200.00 el cual será cancelado en 6 cuotas, comprará, 3 jabas de Huevo, 120 kilos de harina preparada, 4 cajas de mantequilla, vainilla una botella. Ella tiene 35 años de edad, casada, tiene 3 hijos pequeños, su esposo es mecánico ambos trabajan para educar a su hijo.

loans.use: To buy eggs, butter, etc. to make pastries.

loans.name: Carol Davis

texts.es:
Carol Davis C. D. Velezmoro is 34 years old and has completed secondary school. She has 2 kids who depend on her. She lives in Saucipe, in the district of Paijan, in the province of Ascope in the county of La Libertad, in Peru.

When Carol started,her business was rearing ducks which she killed every 3 months to sell to different market stalls and restaurants in Paijan. Since their food started to cost more, Carol decided she could not go on with her business as she was not making enough from it. She became a member of the beauty product company UNIQUE, and she is still selling their products to friends and neighbors, and it is going very well.

With the loan of $300 that she got from the Banco Comunal which belongs to the group 'manos unidas', she bought a lot of bags of food for her birds.

With a loan of $800, which she will pay back over a periodof 6 months, she will buy beauty products like perfumes, jewellery, creams and make-up.

Carol's dream is to open a shop in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Carol Davis C. D. Velezmoro tiene 34 años D. edad, estudio secundaria completa. Tiene dos hijos que aun dependen D. ella.Vive en Saucipe en el distrito D. Paiján en la provincia D. Ascope en el departamento La Libertad – Perú. Cuando la señora Carol inicia su negocio lo hizo con la crianza D. patos el cual después D. tres meses aproximadamente los mataba para ofrecerlos y venderlos por los diferentes mercados y restaurantes del distrito D. Paiján. DesD. que el alimento balanceado subió D. precio la señora Carol deciD. ya no seguir con el negocio ya que no obtenía utilidades satisfactorias. Posteriormente ingresa a la empresa D. productos D. belleza UNIQUE, hasta la actualidad venD. estos productos a sus vecinas y amistades, y le va muy bien. Con el primer préstamo D. S/. 300.00 que obtuvo en el Banco Comunal al que pertenece “Manos Unidas” compro varios sacos D. alimento balanceado para sus aves. Con el préstamo D. S/. 800.00 el cual cancelara en seis meses comprará productos D. belleza como: fragancias, joyas, cremas y maquillaje. La señora Carol tiene un gran sueño que es el D. poner una tienda en su domicilio.

loans.use: With the loan she will buy more products to sell/Con el prestamo comprara mas productos para su venta

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi D., 50 years old, joined the TYM Fund since 2002. Her family has 5 members: 2 parents and 3 children who are still going to school. At first, she used her borrowed money in breeding pigs and chickens. Then, she realized she needed to do more activities to earn enough money to repay weekly. Therefore, Mrs. D. bought a rice-husking machine to assist local people. She spent the profit in sending her children to school. Currently, her oldest child is attending a university. Her wish is to raise her children to maturity. This time, she wants to borrow 950 USD to buy rice to husk and animal-feed.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Dũng năm nay 50 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ năm 2002. Gia đình chị gồm 2 vợ chồng và 3 con đang trong độ tuổi đi học. Số vốn vay lần đầu được chị đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn gà. Sau khi kết thúc vòng vốn chị nhận thấy cần có thêm công việc cho thu nhập thường xuyên để hoàn trả tuần. Chị mua một máy xát lúa phục vụ bà con trên địa bàn. Số lãi thu được chị Dũng đầu tư cho các con ăn học. Hiện nay người con đầu của chị đang theo học đại học. Mong ước của chị Dũng là được thấy cả 3 con của mình trưởng thành, có công ăn việc làm tử tế. Mức vốn của chị Dũng đề nghị vòng này là 950USD mua lúa xay xát và thức ăn gia súc.

loans.use: Buy rice to husk and animal-feed

loans.name: Hilvat

texts.ru:
Hilvat A. lives in the town of Yavan with her family. She is married and has four children. Hilvat graduated from a medical college and works as a nurse in the local clinic. She also has a small business at home, where she breeds calves. That is why she wants to buy another calf. With that she's turned to us for help. Once she receives the $600 USD loan, she will buy the calf and repay the loan within ten months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Ezhevskaya, Kiva translator.

Азимова Хилват жительница города Яван. Проживает со своей семьей. Она замужем и имеет четверых детей. Хилват закончила медицинское училище и работает медсестрой в поликлинике ее кишлака.Кроме того дома имеет небольшое хозяйство, где разводит телят. Поэтому хочет еще купить одного бычка. Для этого она обратилась к нам за помощью. Получив кредит в размере 600 долларов США она купит бычка и погасить кредит сможет в течении 10 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase of a calf.

loans.name: Abel Albino

texts.pt:
Abel Albino D. is 47 years old. He is married and the father of four children, all of whom are school-age and attend school. In addition to caring for his own children and his wife, he supports his mother plus grandchildren, nieces, and nephews, making a total of 18 people in the family for whom he is responsible.

Abel studied through a basic level of auto-mechanics and was not able to continue because he lost his father very early. He has never moved from this city and always lived here in the city of Maputo. In his free time he likes sports and volleyball. He lives in his own house, inherited from his father.

Abel has been an employee of C.M.O. for 21 years and works from 7am to 3:30pm. He learned his trade in the industrial school of Matola. He has a monthly salary of 2882 meticals. This is his second loan. His dream is to complete the restoration of his home and ask for another loan to construct small rooms to rent in order to add to the family’s income.

Translated from Portuguese by April Newman, Kiva Volunteer.

Abel Albino D., 47 anos de idade. Casado e pai de 4 filhos, todos com idade escolar e vão a escola. Para alem dos seus filhos e esposa sustenta a sua mae mais netos e sobrinhos que totalizam uma família de 18 pessoas sub sua responsabilidade.

Abel frequento o ensino até o nível básico na área de mecanica auto e não continuou por falta de condições perdeu o seu pai muito cedo. Nunca mudou de cidade sempre viveu aqui na cidade de Maputo nos tempos livres gosta de atletismo e Voleibol. Vive numa casa própria herdada do pai.

Abel é funcionário da C.M.O a 21 anos e tem um Horário das 7 as 15:30h. Aprendeu o trabalho na escola industrial da Matola. Tem um salário mensal de 2882,00mt. Este é o segundo empréstimo. Constitui seu sonho concluir com as reabilitações para solicitar outro empréstimo afim de construir pequenas dependências para aluguer assim aumentará os rendimentos famíliares.

loans.use: To buy construction materials for his family's house

loans.name: Lily Isabel

texts.es:
Lily belongs to the Communal Bank “El Arenal”, she lives at Jr. Comandante Suarez #7, Calleria district, Ucayali state. She is 35 years old, has 5 beautiful daughters, and her husband works in the lumber industry. Lili with her first loan from Manuela Ramos for S/.300 decided to invest in selling wood.

This business today is going well and she buys and sells merchandise. She gets up very early to prepare breakfast for her daughters and husband, then she works in the morning as a teacher and in the afternoons she works on her lumber business.

With the current loan for S/1.600 which will be repaid in 5 months, she will invest in purchasing wood.

Lily is very happy because every day she is growing as a businesswoman and is able to support her family’s needs. She is thankful for the immense support from Manuela Ramos, and she also wishes that her daughter has this same opportunity.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Lili, pertenece al Banco Comunal El Arenal, ubicado en el Jr. Comandante Suarez # 700, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 35 años, tiene 5 hermosas hijas, su esposo trabaja en extracción forestal. Lili con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertir en la venta de madera.

Este negocio en la actualidad le va bien en donde compra y vende esta mercadería se levanta muy temprano a preparar su desayuno para sus hijas y su esposo, ella trabaja en las mañanas de profesora y en las tardes se dedica al trabajo de madera.

Con este préstamo recibido de S/ 1.600 el cual será pagado en 5 meses, invertirá su dinero en la compra de madera.

Lily, se siente muy feliz por que cada día esta creciendo como empresaria y aportando en las necesidades que puedan tener sus hijos agradece por el apoyo inmenso que Manuela Ramos le brinda, también desea que su pequeña hija tenga esta misma oportunidad.

loans.use: Purchase wood

loans.name: Ouk

texts.en:
Ouk M. is 41 years old and lives in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She has a business as a tailor from her home to earn a living and is able to make around $3 of profit per day. Her husband, Duch Dem, 44, is a construction worker building a house. On average, he makes $2 a day. This couple has two children and both of them are employed. Mrs Ouk is asking a loan of US$300 to purchase a water pump to irrigate her farm. She needs to buy a water pump because of decreased rain over the past few years.

CREDIT MFI is an independent Cambodian faith-based organization. It aims to empower the economically active poor and small entrepreneurs by providing inclusive financial services.

loans.use: To purchase a water pump to irrigate her farm.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac E. is married and has four children. He has received schooling through to Junior High education. Isaac sells used clothing at Kotokoraba, which is the heart of Cape Coast. He has been in this business since 1998. His wife is a trader. 

Isaac uses his income to feed the family and to pay for utility bills. He will use the loan to increase his capital to buy used clothing in larger quantities for resale. With the new profits from his expanded business, Isaac plans to help his wife with the renovation of their house.

loans.use: To increase his capital to buy used clothing in larger quantities for resale.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria A. is a 36-year-old married woman with four kids. She owns and operates a grocery shop in her neighborhood, where she sells items such as rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, soft drinks, and powdered milk.

At present, she is seeking a loan to expand her inventory; specifically, she is hoping to purchase more bags of rice, sugar, and body and hair creams, as well as cartons/crates of vegetable oil and soft drinks. In turn, she is optimistic that she can save more money to support her children while they attend school.

Victoria is a member of the group known as "Bamali Sha Allah" (without God, you can do nothing) Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee each others' loan as social collateral to ensure that their respective loans are promptly repaid. Her picture was taken at one of their group meetings.

loans.use: The increase her grocery store's inventory by purchasing more bags of rice, sugar and creams, and cartons/crates of vegetable oil and soft drinks

loans.name: Noem

texts.en: Mrs. Noem U. is a farmer in Kor village in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. She can earns only a small revenue to support her family so she wants to also cultivate rice during the dry season. Thus, she decided to request a loan to buy rice seed, fertilizer, and pesticides and to hire a laborer with two oxen to plow the field. Her husband, Mr. Vong Chek, is a construction worker. Mrs. Noem U. is 34 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the youngest one is too young to work or study. Her husband is shown with her in the picture.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds, fertilizer, pesticides, and hire a laborer with two oxen to plow a field.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy Charcoal to sell

loans.name: Kotognogontala Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Kotognogontala (composé de 4 femmes  mariées) ont une moyenne d’âge de 28 ans avec en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles résident dans le quartier  Médine de la ville de sikasso.
Elles  exercent des activités commerciales différentes respectivement : la vente de bananes, de bazin, d’habits pour enfant et de chaussures.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle de plus en plus croissante. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe).Le prêt précédent a été correctement remboursé.
Elles comptent acheter avec ce prêt 4 douzaines de vêtement  pour enfants, une dizaine de régime de banane, une quinzaine de paire de chaussures et 25m de tissu bazin. Elles s’approvisionnent sur place à Sikasso et environnants 
Les produits sont vendus en détail et  au comptant dans les marchés de la ville de Sikasso (surtout au marché de Médine et au grand marché de la ville) et dans les quartiers à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de 17.500 FCFA par mois qui sera utilisé pour subvenir au besoin de la famille et investir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the group Kotognogontala (composed of four married women) average 28 years of age and three children. They reside in the Médine district of the city of Sikasso and do commerce variously in: bananas, damask fabrics, children’s clothing, and shoes.

They are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso to satisfy their burgeoning customer base and are on their second solidarity loan (group loan). The preceding loan has been correctly repaid. They plan to use this loan to buy 4 dozen pieces of children’s clothing, a dozen bunches of bananas, 15 pairs of shoes, and 25 meters of damask. Their supplies are gotten locally in Sikasso and surrounding areas.

The goods are sold at the retail level and for cash in the marketplaces of Sikasso (especially in the Médine marketplace and the grand marketplace of the city) and in the districts, to customers composed of women and men.

The group members each hope to realize a monthly profit of 17,500 francs CFA per month that will be used to provide for the family and to invest the rest in their businesses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy children's clothing, bananas, shoes, and cloth

loans.name: Sann

texts.en: Sann S., 28, is married and lives with her one child in the Siem Reap province. She works in a grocery store, making around US$3 each day, while her husband works as a barber. Her husband makes about US$5 each day. Food prices have soared in the past year as inflation has gotten out of control in Cambodia. Unfavorable climate conditions have also played a factor in making the price of rice very high. Sann S. is asking for a loan of US$1000 to expand her grocery store by adding more products to meet her client’s demand. She is confident that this will be a good business venture and sees it as a tool to increase her income and raise her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: To expand her grocery store.

loans.name: Georgette

texts.fr:
D. Georgette est originaire de DJIGBE un petit village du département de l'Ouémé au Bénin. Mais, elle est Née le 06 Janvier 1981 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, où elle vit présentement dans la maison de sa mère au quartier Kpondehou. Georgette est célibataire sans enfant et coiffeuse de profession. Cependant Georgette ne fait pas la coiffure par manque de moyens financières pour ouvrir un salon de coiffure. Georgette exerce l'activité de la vente de glacières,bassines, bols, plats en plastique ainsi que des produits de cheveux et de beauté. Georgette va s'approvisionner à TOKPA, marché international du BENIN. Ensuite, Georgette distribue ses produits à crédit à ses clientes dans les quartiers environnant. Georgette repasse après quelques jours collecter son argent auprès de ces clientes selon le délais fixé à chacune. Sa clientèle augmente ainsi que leur demande; c'est pourquoi Georgette sollicite de crédit afin de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle.  


 
La signification d’ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique d’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux a 0% d’intérêt aux gens très vulnérables et il est dans un groupe qui lancent bientôt un programme de la microassurance santé.
texts.en:
Georgette D.'s family comes from Djigbe, a small village in the Ouémé department in Bénin. She was born in Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin, where she currently lives at her mother's house in the Kpondehou neighborhood. Georgette is unmarried and doesn't have children. She's a trained hairdresser, but is not practicing at this time because she lacks the financial means to open a hairdressing salon. Instead, she sells coolers, basins, bowls, plastic ware, as well as cosmetics and hair care products. Georgette gets her supplies at the Topka market, an international marketplace in Bénin. She then resells her products on credit in the surrounding neighborhoods. After a few days, she comes back to collect the money from her customers, according to the specified payment terms. Her clientele is growing, which is the reason why Georgette is seeking a loan in order to meet customer demand.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy an resell coolers, basins, bowls, plastic ware, cosmetics and hair care products

loans.name: Long

texts.en:
S. is 28 years old and a resident of Pursat Province, Cambodia. She is the mother of two children who are students. She is married to Kimleang, 26. The family owns a laborious business. Kimleang produces marble statues and S. sells the marble statues from her house, where everyone knows the statues are sold.

S. is asking for a loan of $1200 to buy more marble and to repair the generator machine. She wants her children to earn their degrees. S. was available during the photograph so her husband is taken instead.

loans.use: To buy more marble to make statues and to repair the generator machine.

loans.name: Maura

texts.en: Maura Tac is a 67 years old widow who has four married children.  Hog raising is her project.  She became a member of Paglaum MPC, last September, 2008.  Maura is a good member who religiously paid her obligation to give her a good credit rating with the Co-op.  She is seeking a loan of PHP10,000.

loans.use: Buy pigs.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia es pequeña agricultora y productora de leche de vaca con la que elabora quesos por cantidad para la comercialización de los mismo en las ferias populares de la ciudad de El Alto y La Paz; vive con sus dos hijos de 14 y 15 años quienes le ayuda en el cuidado de las vacas; viven en casa propia ubicado en la Provincia Ingavi – Achica Baja (a dos horas y media de la ciudad de El Alto). 

El crédito lo destinará a la compra de una vaca lechera de mediana calidad  para incrementar la producción de  quesos que son muy requeridos en la feria y de esta manera mejorar sus ingresos.
 
Es el tercer  crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago permite aprobarlo otro préstamo solicitado por la prestataria.
texts.en:
Julia is a small agricultural and dairy farmer who makes cheeses and sells them in the markets of El Alto and La Paz. She lives with her two children, 14 and 15 years old, who help her take care of the cows. They live in their own home in Provincia Ingavi – Achica Baja, two and a half hours from El Alto. She will use the loan to purchase a dairy cow, which will give her more milk for her cheese production and increase her income. This is her third loan from Impro, and she has been approved because of her history of faithful payment.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a dairy cow to increase her cheese production

loans.name: Elsa Marina

texts.es: Elsa Marina, se dedica desde hace 3 años a la venta de ropa típica, como cortes, güipiles, blusas y suéteres; ella sale a vender de manera ambulante en el municipio de San Juan Sacatepequez cerca de donde ella vive. Ella cuenta que inicio su negocio vendiendo 2 o 3 prendas, las cuales ella compraba al crédito y después de la venta ella los pagaba, pero poco a poco las personas empezaron hacer mas pedidos, por lo que se integro a un Banco de Confianza con FAPE, este capital  le  ayudo ya que contaba capital pequeño para comprar al contado parte de la mercadería y ya no todo al crédito.  Sus sueños son poder abrir un local propio para ya no vender de forma ambulante ya que tiene dos niñas, una de 3 años y otra de 7 meses de edad, por lo que cuando sale a vender es un poco difícil llevarlas a ambas,  si tuviera un local propio podría atender mejor a sus hijas y mantener su negocio.  El capital que solicita le ayudará a surtir su negocio, ya que sus clientes le piden variedad de colores y estilos diferentes de blusas, fajas y delantales los cuales ella no tiene, ella quiere aprovechar estos meses que se aproximan,   ya que serán las fiestas locales de San Juan  y San Pedro Sacatepèquez.  Elsa Marina cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien es carpintero y a la vez ella ha sido un apoyo para él, porque contribuye a la economía de su casa,  y al incrementar sus ganancias en el negocio también mejora su condición de vida  ya  que quiere darles un buen futuro a sus hijas.
texts.en:
For the past 3 years Elsa Marina has been selling typical clothes such as lengths of material, "güipiles", blouses, and sweaters. She is a street vendor in the municipality of San Juan Sacatepequez, close to where she lives. She tells that she started her business selling 2 or 3 garments, which she bought on credit, and after selling them she would pay, but little by little people started making more orders and therefore she joined a "Banco de Confianza" with FAPE. The capital helped her, as with a small capital she could buy some merchandise and pay cash, not all on credit. It is her dream to open a shop so that she does not have to sell on the streets as she has two daughters, 3 years and 7 months old, and it is difficult for her to take both, and if she had her own store she could look after the girls while maintaining her business. The loan requested will help supply her business as her clients ask for a variety of colors and styles, different blouses, girdles, and aprons which she does not have in stock, and she wants to take advantage of the following months as there will be local fiestas at San Juan and San Pedro Sacatepequez. Elsa Marina has the support of her husband who is a carpenter and she is also a support to him as she contributes to the home economy. Increasing her earnings, the living conditions will improve as she wants to give a better future to her daughters.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in merchandise for clothing sales.

loans.name: Tahira Parveen Muhammad Habib Group

texts.en:
Ulfat kanwal baji wants a loan to buy iron to sell. 
Parveen baji wants a loan to buy furniture for her tuition center. 
Shahnaz begum baji wants a loan to buy readymade garments to sell. 
Parveen akhtar baji wants a loan to buy seasonal vegetables to sell. 

Tahira parveen baji is a very efficient and caring lady. She helps her husband in his fruit selling business. She arranges the fruit in the cart to make it easy to call the fruit names and to appear attractive to people. Her husband has been doing this business for the past 3 years. Tahira baji is applying for a loan to buy more seasonal fruits to expand her husband’s fruit selling business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members; each the members will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: “Parveen baji is showing her vegetable business in the picture”.

loans.use: To buy seasonal fruits to sell.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita es socia del Banco Comunal Suni que significa Abundante en quechua.
Margarita es conviviente, tiene 32 años y 2 hijos, Margarita junto a su esposo viajan a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde compran animales que vende en la feria dominical de Ayacucho, además compra quesos que vende por mayor.
Margarita necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ganado vacuno.
Los sueños son tener un negocio estable, un tractor agrícola y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Margarita is a member of the Community Bank Suni which means Plentiful in quechua. Margarita lives with her partner, she is 32 years old and has 2 children, Margarita and her husband travel to different fairs in the region where they buy animals that they sell at the Sunday fair in Ayacucho, she also buys cheese that sells at wholesale prices. Margarita needs a loan of 1000 soles which will be invested to buy livestock. Her dreams are to have a stable business, a tractor for her farm and that her children turn into professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy livestock

loans.name: Zebi

texts.en:
S. Zebi is 36 years old. She is married with three children. Zebi is a market vendor who sells confectionery. She has been in this business for 11 years. As Zebi is very popular in her neighborhood for selling fresh and tasty pastry, she tries to maintain a wide range of goods. Thus, today Zebi requests $1,000 for purchasing confectionery for selling. She and her family appreciate your support in helping her improve her business.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing confectionary for selling and fodder for the cattle

loans.name: La Solucion Group

texts.es:
Antonia F. es una socia del grupo “La Solución” que pertenece al Centro Focal Juan Pablo, ella confecciona fundas hace 8 años, los  préstamos que obtuvo ha invertido en su negocio, comprando máquinas industriales como la OVER ya que antes solo tenía máquinas domésticas. Ahora necesita el préstamo  para comprar tela por mayor. Antonia tiene 4 hijos y  dos nietos y confía en el personal de salud de Pro Mujer para hacer los controles respectivos de sus nietos, además  le gusta asistir a las reuniones porque es un espacio de esparcimiento.
Las demás integrantes  también tienen sus negocios como la venta de muebles, aretes, comida, pasteles, ropa y necesitan el préstamo par ala compra de mercadería ( muebles, aretes, arroz, papa, pasteles) y materia prima ( tela).
texts.en:
Antonia F. is a member of “The Solution” group, which belongs to the center city of Juan Pablo. She has been making coverlets for 8 years, and has invested the loans she’s received into her business. She bought industrial machines such as the OVER, since before she only had domestic machines. Now she needs a loan to buy fabric at wholesale. Antonia has 4 children and two grandchildren, and she has trust in the health of Pro Mujer to provide for the necessary controls for her grandchildren. In addition, she enjoys attending the reunions because it is a place for recreation. The other members also have their businesses, such as furniture, earrings, food, cakes, and clothing sales, and they need a loan to buy merchandise (furniture, earrings, rice, potatoes, cakes) and raw materials (fabric).

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise and raw materials.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is 50 years old and married with 5 children. She sells foodstuffs drinks and provisions. She is from Delta State, Nigeria. She is requesting for the loan amount of N80000 to purchase more provisions, drinks and foodstuffs to sell. She thanks you for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Arfino

texts.pt:
Arfino C. nasceu na província de Nampula (2.800 km a norte de maputo) tem 35 anos de idade, casado e pai de três filhos compreendidos entre dois e seis anos. Somente o mais velho estuda na 2 classe. 
Arfino estudou ate 6 classe tendo parado quando foi chamado para cumprir o serviço militar obrigatório. Treinou na província de Cabo Delgado e nos finais de 1999 foi transferido para província de Maputo no distrito de Boane.

Passou a disponibilidade no ano de 2007 e começou a trabalhar como segurança na empresa de construção civil (C.M. C) onde recebe 3.500,00MT por mês. Vive na casa própria na vila de boane com sua família. Com o salário consegue alimentar a família e poupar um pouco na sua conta bancaria.

Conheceu a hluvuku através de amigos e outros vizinhos, também clientes da instituição.
Este é o terceiro empréstimo do arfino com a Hluvuku-Adsema no valor de 15.000,00MT para compra de material de construção de casa de alvenaria (cimento, barrotes e outros materiais). Os outros dois créditos foram também para o mesmo propósito nos valores de 7.000,00MT e 12.000,00MT, respectivamente.

Propõe a pagar o empréstimo sem problemas para poder aceder a mais créditos com objectivo de concluir a casa de alvenaria e iniciar um negocio.
texts.en:
Arfino C. was born in the province of Nampula (2,800 km north of Maputo) he is 35 years old, he is married and has 3 children who are between 2 and 6 years old. Just the oldest one studies 2nd grade. Arfino studied until the 6th grade and had to stop because of obligatory military service. He trained in the province of Cabo Delgado by the end of 1999 he was transferred to the province of Maputo in the district of Boane. He finished his service in 2007 and started to work as a security officer at a construction company where he receives 3,500MT a month. He lives at his own house in the village of Boane with his family. With his salary he is able to support his family and is able to save a little in his bank account. He learns about Hluvuku thru a friends and neighbors who are clients of the institution. This is Arfino's third loan with Hluvuku-Adsema for the amount of 15,000MT to buy construction material for his masonry house (cement, columns, and other materials). The other two loans were also used for construction and were for 7,000MT and 12,000MT respectively. He expects to pay the loan without any problem and access more credit in order to finish his house and start a business.

Translated from Portuguese by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Ester

texts.en: Ester is a 30-year-old widow and mother of three school-going children. She lives in Nyalenda, Kisumu, Kenya. She currently supplies fresh fish, especially tilapia, to other retailers. She has relied on this business since her husband passed on. She needs Kshs 20,000 to buy more stock.

loans.use: To buy more stock.

loans.name: Fayiba

texts.en: Fayiba F. is currently in the business of selling maize, sorghum (a type of grain), etc., and is requesting a loan to purchase millet (another type of grain) to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a store for her cereals to protect them from rain and from the maize weevil. Fayiba is 36 years old and is married with a husband who is a secretary. They have five children who all go to school. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy millet to sell

loans.name: Myagmar

texts.en:
Myagmar A. is a 36-year-old single mother who lives with her three children in Bayanhongor province in central Mongolia. She and her three children live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her oldest two children attend a local secondary school and her youngest is in kindergarten.

A. operates a small cafe in her town, specializing in a variety of traditional Mongolian meals. Her most popular menu items include huushuur, a fried flour pocket filled with meat; buuz, steamed meat dumplings; and lapsha, a soup with meat and noodles.

A. started her business in 2000 by cooking meals at her home and delivering them to her customers at local businesses and the market. After years of successful operations, her earnings enabled her to open a cafe in a small three-room building. She is now thinking about expanding further and hopes to soon open a small bakery beside her cafe.

A. is requesting a 4,000,000 tugrug loan to purchase equipment and supplies to start her bakery and food products for her cafe.

loans.use: To start her bakery and purchase food products for her cafe

loans.name: Yean

texts.en:
Yean N., 31 years old, lives with other family members in Kompong Tom province in Cambodia. His wife named Chenglim, 31, is in the picture. The couple has a small daughter who is a clever student, learning in the local primary school. To earn a living, the family retails beds that they produce or buy from carpenters. They own a trailer-motorbike which they use to pick up beds to sell door-to-door around the community, and they usually generate an income of US$ 10 per day to buy food for their family.

Recently, Yean N. has ordered many sets of beds on credit from his carpenter but he doesn’t have enough money to pay his supplier. Because of that, he decided to request a loan of US$ 500 loan from Kiva’s partner HKL.

loans.use: To buy many beds to sell

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana S. is from the village of San Roque, Maramag, Bukidnon. She is 58 years old. Susana is married and has 2 adult-aged children. To earn a living, Susana owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector, running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means of generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Susana has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Susana joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Susana has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was very helpful for her business. Susana is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to continue her business. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Susana from HSPFI. She plans to reinvest the additional business profits into her business and to pay off her credit. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in renovating her business

loans.name: Tahani

texts.en: Tahani is a young woman. She is 21 and married with one child, less than one year old. Tahani's husband is working as a police officer in the Palestinian National Authority. His monthly income hardly covers his monthly expenses, especially since his wife is still studying sociology at the university. She is in her third year. Tahani hopes after finishing her university degree to get a job and help her husband on the daily expenses. Tahani requested $2,000 from FATEN to pay her tuition at the university. Tahani appears in the picture at the FATEN office, while signing some papers.

loans.use: To pay university tution

location.town: Aseerah Alshamalya village, Nablus, West Bank

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is twenty-nine years old. She is married and has two children who are both in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a fishing community in the central region of Ghana. Mary works hard to help her husband provide for the family. She runs a chop bar in her community. Mary buys her goods from nearby communities. She has been in business for barely a year and desires to improve upon her business. Mary desires to give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy food stuffs for sale

loans.name: Eden

texts.en: Eden T. owns and operates a specialized retail store selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste, noodles, coffee, sugar, salt, etc. in her community. She is 28 years old, married and has three school-age children. They are from the village of Calabayan, Ozamiz City. Eden has been in her business for over five years and earns approximately 9,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2008, Eden joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Eden has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Eden is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her fourth loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to pay for the tuition fees of her children and save for future needs. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 40 years of age, married with four children aged 6 and 15 years. All her children go to school. The family resides and rents  a one roomed house where she stays with seven people. She doesn’t take care of additional family members.  The family has access to electricity and no piped water at home.  The family has two meals a day.

Agnes' three greatest monthly expenses includes paying utility bills, school fees for children and rent for business and residence. Agnes operates a bar in Kamwokya Kifumbira selling all types of beers and liquors and sells to all categories of people. She works seven days a week and serves about twenty customers a day. She has done this business for over seven years.

Agnes' main challenges are transportation and the rainy season which disturbs her a lot because she works from an muddy place which hinders her customers to reach out to her and also ever increasing prices of beers and alcohol in Uganda .  She has been with MCDT for ten years and has taken out twenty loans, working all this long with the same borrowing group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more crates of beer and jerrycans of alcohol. She aspires to see her business grow bigger and wants to start a fully stocked bar

loans.use: To buy more crates of beer and jerrycans of local gin /alcohol.

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en: Roseline U. is 40 years old and married with 4 children. Her husband is a commercial driver and he also supports the home. Her youngest child is 11 years old. She hopes to give her children a quality education.  Roseline loves jewelry and that is why she sells jewelry to earn a living. She has been in this business for a long time.  Roseline is a LAPO client. She hopes for a loan amount of N80,000 to purchase more jewelry to sell. She hopes to expand her business in the future.  Roseline says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional inventory in bulk

loans.name: Chan

texts.en: Mrs. Chan Y., 46, lives in Ta Ou Khang Cheung village in Takeo province. She is a pig breeder and her husband, Mr. Sok Sim, is a farmer who owns a small plot of land to cultivate rice to support their family. The couple has four children, one a clothes designer, and the others in school. Although they work hard, they have very little income. Mrs. Chan Y. has therefore decided to apply for a loan to buy two cows to breed.

loans.use: To buy two cows to breed

loans.name: Afia

texts.en:
Afia T. sells fresh groundnuts (peanuts) and sugarcane at Jukwa. In the photo, the sugarcane behind her was bought by one of her customers.

Afia has attained a junior high level of education. She is divorced and has two children. She is responsible for the paying of school fees and utility bills.

Afia’s loan will be used to buy more groundnuts and sugarcane for sale. She hopes to save the new profits from her business to further her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy more groundnuts and sugarcane to sell

loans.name: Djénèba

texts.fr:
Djénèba N. est une veuve de 57 ans, mère de douze enfants, qui vit avec 7 de ses enfants chez son défunt époux à Wayerma I, un des  quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative du Mali).
Djénèba N. mène cette activité d’achat et de vente de charbon de bois il y a environ 10 ans. Elle jouit d’une forte réputation dans cette activité et reçoit beaucoup de commandes surtout en saison hivernale.
Dans ses recherches de ressources financières complémentaires, elle sollicita la collaboration de Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elle est à son deuxième prêt individuel après 5 prêts solidaires. Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Djénèba compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des chargements de charrettes en sacs de charbon de bois auprès des producteurs dans les localités environnantes de la ville de Sikasso. Elle vend  devant son domicile, en gros et détail, au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée  de revendeurs et de consommateurs.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 100.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour régler l’essentielle de ses dépenses, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Djénèba N. is a 57-year old widow and the mother of 12 children. She lives with seven of her children in the house of her late husband in Wayerma I, a modest district in the town of Sikasso (the third administrative region of Mali). She has been engaged in buying and reselling charcoal for about 10 years. She has a good business reputation and receives a lot of orders, especially in the winter season. In her search for additional financial resources, she has started collaborating with Soro Yiriwaso, and this would be her second individual loan after five joint loans. All previous loans have been duly repaid. Djénèba plans to use this loan to buy cartloads of charcoals in bags from the local producers in the villages surrounding Sikasso. She sells in front of her house, wholesale and retail, for cash and n credit, to a customer base composed of both women and men. With this new loan, she anticipates obtaining a monthly income of 100,000 West African francs, which will be used to cover the most essential expenditures, contribute to the family budget, pay off the interest on her loan and reinvest the rest in her business.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing charcoal (for resale)

loans.name: Umoja Kibabi Group

texts.fr:
Baseme B. Apoline est présidente du groupe de crédit  Umoja Kibabi, en blouse blanche, elle lève sa main sur la photo, cliente au 14e cycle de crédit, âgée de 36 ans, Mariée, mère de 5 enfants tous étudient convenablement.  Son mari est chômeur (sans emploi). En dehors de ses enfants légitimes, elle héberge également  4 autres enfants de sa famille élargie (cousin, neuve, voisin du village).   
Baseme B. Apoline vend des  boissons (bière Primus, Mutzing et sucrés Fanta, etc.). Elle expose ses produits devant des boutiques des amis et connaissances (sur la voie publique, rond point Signers) pour la vente en gros et parfois à son domicile c’est la vente en détails . Elle a commencé son petit commerce  avec  son fonds propre reçu de son beau père sous forme d’un don. Son capital initial était 20$ équivalent aux deux caisses de la bière Primus. Il y a 16 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. 
Avec  le crédit  de  l’IMF Hekima, Baseme B. Apoline souhaite augmenter son chiffre d’affaire en achetant des 36 caisses de sucrés Fanta.
Le grand défi de Baseme B. Apoline est que les gens consomment parfois à crédit avec risque de lui payer avec retard. Et d’autres achètent mais ne lui restituent pas les bouteilles vides. Malgré tout cela Baseme B. Apoline y tire son maximum de bénéfice, elle est confortable avec son business.
Baseme B. Apoline remercie l’IMF Hekima pour  les crédits permanents qu’elle reçoit sans aucune garantie matérielle car grâce à ces crédits, elle parvient à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille dit - elle.  
Ce groupe Umoja Kibabi est  composé de 20 membres majoritairement femmes.
texts.en:
Baseme B. Apoline is president of the loan group Umoja Kibabi. In the white blouse, raising her hand in the photo, she is a client on her 14th loan cycle; she is 36 years old, married and the mother of five children, all studying well. Her husband is unemployed. In addition to her own children, four other children are also living with her from her extended family (cousin, nephew, neighbor in the village). Baseme B. Apoline sells drinks (Primus and Mutzig beer, Fanta sodas, etc.). She displays her products in front of friends' and acquaintances' shops (on the street, the Signers roundabout) and sells wholesale; she occasionally sells retail from her home. She began her small business with her own money, which she received from her father-in-law as a gift. Her initial capital investment was twenty dollars, which is equivalent to two cases of Primus beer. She has been in business for sixteen years. With the loan from the microfinance institution Hekima, Baseme B. Apoline would like to increase her sales by buying 36 cases of Fanta. Baseme B. Apoline's greatest challenge is that people sometimes drink on credit, with the risk of paying her back late. Others buy, but do not return the empty bottles. Despite all this, Baseme B. Apoline makes her maximum profit; she is comfortable with her business. Baseme B. Apoline thanks the microfinance institution Hekima for the permanent loans which she is receiving with no material collateral. Thanks to these loans, she is able to meet her family's needs, she says. The Umoja Kibabi group is comprised of twenty members, the majority of which are women.

Translated from French by Robin Clochard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: 36 cases of Fanta and Primus

loans.name: Jose Jonny

texts.es:
José de 43 años, vive en una zona periurbana en la Perimetral de Guayaquil, su esposa vende frutas ellos tiene dos hijos de 18 y 16 años, hace años atrás el era albañil y sufrió un accidente que le desfiguro la cara, poco a poco con cirugías fue sanando pero al ver que necesitaba dinero para mantener a su familia, decidió invertir sus últimos ahorros en tubos y parches, con el fin de trabajar como vulcanizador (personas que arreglan bicicletas). 

Poco a poco fue incrementando su capital, y compro mas herramientas para su negocio. En la actualidad el arregla también llantas de carro. Trabaja desde las 06h00 hasta las 21h00pm todos los días. Una de las dificultades que tiene para trabajar son las muletas que utiliza por otro accidente que tuvo. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar parches, tubos y llantas para su negocio. En el futuro quiere tener otro local y empleados.
texts.en:
José is 43 years old and lives in a semi-urban zone in the perimeter of Guayaquil. His wife sells fruit and they have 2 children - 18 and 16.
