Years ago José was a bricklayer and suffered an accident which disfigured his face. Little by little, with surgery, he became healthier but has needed money to maintain his family. He decided to invest his last savings in tubes and patches, with the goal of becoming a tyre repairer (a person who fixes bicycles). Little by little José saved his capital and purchased more tools for his business. He actually also fixes car tyres. José works from 6am to 9pm every day. One of the difficulties he has in his work are the crutches that he uses due to the accident. With the loan he is seeking he will buy patches, tubes and tyres for his business. In the future José wants to have another location and employees.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase patches, tubes and tyres

loans.name: Sope Serigne Barra Mbacke Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe SERIGNE BARRA MBACK a est créé il y a de cela 6 mois, il est composé de 09 femmes toutes issues du même Banc Villageois et du même village. Elles se sont organisées par affinité, elles sont âgées de 30 à 60 ans et sont au moins mères de 2 enfants. Dans le village se trouve un grand marché hebdomadaire qui draine des milliers de personnes par semaine. Ce qui fait que l'activité commerciale est permanente dans le village et contribue au développement économique de la localité et ses environs. Le nouveau crédit du groupe de solidarité lui permettra de renforcer ses activités économiques et de les diversifier. Leurs activités s’articulent au tour de la vente de céréales locales, de produits halieutiques, d’arachide et de crème glacée pour les détentrices de réfrigérateur. 

Madame Diouma D., la présidente du groupe de solidarité, à droite de la photo en grand boubou jaune et emmitouflée avec une écharpe blanche  est âgée de 53 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants. Elle joue un rôle fondamental dans le groupe par rapport au renforcement de la solidarité entre les membres. Elle est vendeuse de beignets et de condiments de cuisine depuis 04 ans. Son financement lui a permis de renforcer son activité de petit commerce. Son objectif est de réaliser plus de bénéfices et participer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille par la nourriture et la bonne couverture sanitaire et scolaire des enfants.
texts.en:
The SERIGNE BARRA MBACK group was created 6 months ago. It is composed of nine women all from the same “Banc Villageois” and the same village. Their mutual affinity brought them together. They are from 30 to 60 years old and are the mothers of at least two children. There is a large weekly market in the village that draws thousands of people every week. This means that there is a constant business activity in the village and it contributes to the economic development of the town and its vicinity. The new loan to the solidarity group will allow it to strengthen and diversify its economic activities. Their activities are structured around the sale of local cereals, seafood products, peanuts and ice cream for those who own a refrigerator. Mrs. Diouma D., the president of the solidarity group, is on the right of the photo wearing a large yellow “boubou” wrapped in a white scarf. She is 53-years old, married and the mother of six children. She plays a fundamental role in the group, strengthening the solidarity between members. She has been selling “beignets” and condiments for four years. Her funding has allowed her to bolster her small business. Her goal is to make more profit and to participate in the improvement of her family’s living conditions through food, health care and schooling.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To strengthen the economic activities of the solidarity group.

loans.name: Mabelita

texts.en:
Mabelita B. is 38 years old and from the village of Gingoog City. She is married with two school-aged children. To make a living, Mabelita owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. Mabelita has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Mabelita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mabelita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI and is now requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to further improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Benkadi  4 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Benkadi 4 est composé de femmes mariées du village de DANGASSO dans la préfecture de SAN, région de SEGOU (quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 36  ans et au moins 5 enfants.
Elles cultivent  du  fonio, de l’oseille et du gombo.  
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis 2 ans. Après avoir correctement remboursé  les  prêts précédents, elles sont à leur deuxième  prêt de campagne.
SATOU C. compte utiliser son  prêt pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semence de fonio, des petits matériels et des intrants agricoles,  au grand marché de SAN. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes  sont  stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de SAN,  DAH et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Tandis que SATOU C. espère avoir 40.000FCFA, certains membres du groupe comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 22000à 30.000FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The Benkadi 4 group is made up of married women from the village of Dangasso in the San district which is in the Segou area (the fourth administrative province of Mali).They live in traditional families. They are on average 36 years old and have at least 5 children each.They cultivate fonio, sorrel, and gombo. Hoping to optimise the production of their farms,the members of the group decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso group 2 years ago. Having repaid the previous loans correctly, they are requesting their second rural loan. Satou C. intends to use her credit to buy an adequate amount of fonio seeds, small farm machinery and fertiliser and other products at the market at San. After the winter period the crop is stored for a period of time in order to appreciate in value before being sold retail (often wholesale) at the grand market at San, at Dah and at other local markets for cash to customers usually from the large towns. Whereas Satou C. hopes to make 40.000FCFA, some members of the group expect to make a profit of 22000 to 30.000 FCFA each after the sale of their farm products which will be used to repay the interest of the loan and daily family expenses.

Translated from French by Barbara Belli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of seeds,fertiliser and other farming products and small  agricultural equipment.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty A. is currently in the business of selling foodstuffs at her restaurant and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of local Sudanese beans (ful) to cook and sell.  Betty is 30 years old and is married with a husband that is a police officer. She has 2 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to extend the floor of her restaurant and purchase more tables and chairs for accommodation.

loans.use: Stock more bags of local Sudanese beans (ful) to cook and sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase basic foodstuffs

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios S. is from the village of Santo Domingo, Alicia, Isabela. She is 46 years old, married, and has five adult-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a general store, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. She is just starting this business.

In 2010, Remedios joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 1st loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Lung

texts.en:
Lung S., 42, is married and resides with her husband and nine children in Battambong Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality rice products. She provides laundry services for an income of USD 3.50 per day. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver, earning an income of USD 2.50 per day.  

S. is requesting a loan of USD 500 to pay one of the children's university fees.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. S.'s husband appears in the photograph because S. was not available.

loans.use: pay her child's university fees

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
Adela B. is from the town of Panglao. She is 46 years old and is married.

Adela owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years.

Adela joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI.

Adela is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like soft drinks. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell like soft drinks

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda tiene 46 años, es una mujer alegre y sacrificada, tiene un hijo, pero vive sola en la comunidad de Huaracayo. Los años de dedicación y servicio hacía su hijo le enseñaron, que no hay mejor recompensa en la vida que verlos salir adelante. Hace ya 10 años que se dedica a la agricultura, sembrando maíz y arveja; los que después de cuidarlos los lleva al mercado central de la capital, donde los vende al por mayor.  Pero ahora ella quiere abrir una pequeña ferretería, en la zona central de su ciudad de Tarma, porqué sabe muy bien que sus fuerzas ya no son las mismas, se siente sola y desea estar junto a su hijo, que vive en la ciudad. Es el primer crédito con MFP y esta muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal que es muy respetado en su localidad; con el que está segura podrá lograr sus objetivo. Con el crédito que obtendrá, comprará abono y contratará operarios para que la ayuden en la cosecha.
texts.en: Yolanda is 46 years old and is a very happy and hard-working woman.  She has one son but she lives alone in the community of Huaracayo.  The years of dedication and service she spent raising her son taught her that there is no better reward in life than seeing your children progress.  Ten years ago, she began to work in agriculture, raising corn and peas.  After growing them, she takes them to the central market in the capital where she sells them wholesale.  Now, she would like to open a small hardware store in the central area of her native city of Tarma, because she understands that she does not have the strength that she used to; she feels alone and wants to be close to her son who lives in the city.  This is her first loan through MFP and she is very happy to belong to a village bank that is very well-respected in her neighborhood.  She knows that with the help of the bank, she will be able to achieve her goal.  With the loan, she will purchase fertilizer and contract workers to help her with the harvest.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer and pay the day-laborers who help with the harvest

loans.name: Sao

texts.en: Sao H. is a rattan cupboard and bed seller who is 41 and is a married mother caring for six children, all of whom are no longer in school. Since 2006, Sao H. and her husband have owned a small rattan cupboard and bed sales point. This couple also orders rattan items in bulk from braiders and takes them to retail door-to-door across the province. They always take a week or two weeks to sell their products. Sao H. is now running her business very well because she sells her items at a reasonable price. In order to better satisfy the needs of the customers, Sao H. seeks a loan to stock a bigger amount of rattan beds to sell.

loans.use: To stock a bigger amount of rattan beds to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 29-year-old single man from Lebanon. He has 10 years of experience working as a farmer. He has owned his own farm since 2007.  He works independently on his farm and he lives on his own. He learned this occupation from his father and after his death, he took over the operation of the land. He cultivates all type of vegetables according to the season. He also uses plastic tents to grow his products. Today he is requesting a loan of $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase needed supplies for his agriculturA. work. He is a first-time Kiva borrower and a first-time Ameen client. He estimates that the loan will help him increase his profits by 15% for the coming harvesting.

loans.use: To purchase supplies needed for his agricultural work

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth V. is from the town of Surallah. She is 49 years old. Elizabeth is married and has 4 children. Her eldest child is 24 years old and the youngest is 11. To make a living, Elizabeth owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Elizabeth also grows pigs for fattening and sale. She hopes to acquire more piglets to raise.

Elizabeth joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elizabeth is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase 5 sacks of fertilizer and 3 piglets. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: To purchase 5 sacks of fertilizer and 3 piglets

loans.name: Floriano

texts.en:
Floriano V. is from the village of Victoria. He is 43 years old. Floriano is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, he plants and harvests corn to sell. He has been engaged in his business for over twenty-nine years and earns approximately $117 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Floriano joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be his 1st loan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Zinia Mitmey

texts.es:
Zinia es socia del Banco Comunal Emprendedoras, es casada y tiene 24 años.
Se dedica a la venta de pescados. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en surtir su mercadería, (comprar variedad de pescados).
Zinia trabaja en la venta de pescados desde muy niña,aprendió de este negocio de su mamá, Zinia sólo vende los sábados y domingos tiene un puesto en el terminal pesquero hay fechas en la que viaja llevando su mercadería a la feria de Andahuaylas.
Le gusta FINCA Perú, porque le dan préstamos y puede ahorrar, le gusta mucho las capacitaciones porque aprende mucho en diferente temas como: la familia, matrimonio, negocios, escalera del desarrollo.
Su sueño es llegar hacer un mayorista en la venta de pescado como su mamá.
texts.en:
Zinia is a member of the communal bank Emprendedoras. She's 24-years-old and married. 

She sells fish. She'll use this loan to stock up her merchandise (buy a variety of fish). Zinia has worked selling fish since she was very young. She learned the business from her mother. Zinia only sells on Saturdays and Sundays. She has a stand at the fishing terminal. Some days she travels with her merchandise to the fair in Andahuaylas. She likes FINCA Perú because they give her loans and she can save. She likes the training because she learns a lot on different subjects such as: family, marriage, business, and development. Her dream is to become a wholesale fish vendor like her mother.

loans.use: Purchase of various fish

loans.name: Annonciate

texts.en:
Annonciate is a 32-year-old widow with two children who go to school. Annonciate sells foodstuffs, which she has been doing for two years.  

Annonciate will use the loan to purchase more potatoes and bananas for additional sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Annonciate plans to reinvest in the business for continuous growth. She dreams of owning a stock of foodstuffs in the future.

loans.use: To buy more food to sell

loans.name: Syed's Group

texts.en:
Syed lives in Okara, which is a small city in Pakistan known for its agricultural industry. She is 45 years old and married to M. S., who works as an electrician. His shop is located in the market and he offers electrical repair services to his clients.

Syed is a housewife and a very good administrator. She manages her household expenses very well and does her household work by staying at home. She is the mother of 4 children, 2 sons and 2 daughters. Her eldest son works in a soap manufacturing factory while the others stay home. Only her third child is enrolled in school and studying in the 8th grade.
 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her husband’s electrician business. With the loan, he will purchase electrical repair tools to offer better quality services to his clients. He has been operating this business for the past 15 years and Syed is very hopeful that her husband’s business will be expanded further after buying necessary tools with the loan.  She is a new loan applicant of Asasah and hopes that it will be a profitable experience for her.

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (an Asasah Passbook) is Syed.

loans.use: To buy electrical repair tools

loans.name: Matar

texts.fr: Matar F. est âgé de 24 ans il est marié c'est un cocher de charrette il mène en même temps des activités commerciales plus précisément le commerce de produits céréaliers il s'approvisionne depuis le bassin arachidier (kaolack) où il achète du mil et de l'arachide en grande quantité qu'il achemine à mbour pour le revendre en détail c'est un secteur qu'il maitrise très bien car n'ayant jamais connu de problèmes d'écoulement car les produits qu'il vend sont très prisés par la population
texts.en: Matar F. is 24 years old and married. He drives a horse cart. In addition, he is engaged in business activities, more specifically selling cereals. He stocks up in the peanut-growing valley (Kaolack), where he purchases large quantities of millet and peanuts and brings them to Mbour for retailing. He knows this business very well and ever had problems moving his stock as the products he sells are very popular with the local population.

loans.use: Retail

loans.name: Perveen's Group

texts.en:
Perveen is a resident of a city called Faisalabad which is known in Pakistan for its textile industry. She owns a four-room house there and has been living in it with her family for the past 22 years. 

Parveen and her husband E. are very hard-working people. They are involved in a dairy business. For this purpose, they keep a buffalo at their home which produces about 8 to 10kg milk every day. E. transfers the milk to the milk pots and sells it to different community people by delivering it to their homes on his motorbike. 

Perveen has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for their dairy business. With the loan, they will buy another buffalo which will increase the milk productivity and help them to sell more and to earn better profits. Perveen is hopeful that her family business will improve after making a loan investment in it. This will not only make an asset (the buffalo) but also increase their income. 

She is a new loan user of Asasah and hopes that it will be a profitable experience for her family. 

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Perveen.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for dairy business

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en: Marcelina is currently in the business of selling retail goods like soap. She is 30 years old, married to a doctor, with 3 children. Two of them go to school. Marcelina borrowed a loan to stock more retail goods like soap to sell. She hopes to build a house and pay for her children in school with the extra profits from her business in the future.

loans.use: To stock more retail goods such as soap to sell.

loans.name: Enilda

texts.es:
La señora Enilda pertenece al Banco Comunal “María de Jesús II”, del Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 31 años y terminó sus estudios superiores de Costura, Corte y Confección.

Costurera de profesión y negociante de vocación, Enilda empezó con el negocio de diseño y costura. Con el apoyo del Movimiento Manuela Ramos decidió implementar su propio Taller de Costura, ubicado en una galería por el centro de la ciudad. Nos cuenta que le va muy bien, trabaja con pedidos que con anticipación sus clientes le solicitan, a quienes atiende con la amabilidad y el carisma  que la caracterizan.
 
 Con su primer crédito de 300 Nuevos Soles, compró retazos, telas en metros e hilos de diferentes colores. En la actualidad sigue con el mismo negocio.

Con el préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará telas en metros de diferentes tipos y colores,  tijeras, hilos en carretes grande y de variados colores, agujas de coser y de máquina, alfileres, botones. 

Hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas de alcanzar y hacer realidad sus demás sueños. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciar su negocio.
texts.en:
Enilda belongs to the María de Jesús II Communal Bank in the Tarapoto district in the San Martín province.  She is 31 years old and single.  She has completed her higher education in sewing and dressmaking.  Seamstress by profession and merchant by vocation, Enilda started with the business of design and sewing.  

With support from the Movimiento Manuela Ramos, she decided to set up her own sewing shop.  It is in a gallery in the center of the city.  She tells us that it is going very well for her.  She works with orders that her customers request in advance.  She takes care of her customers with her characteristic kindness and charisma.

She bought remnants, meters of fabric, and different colors of thread with her first loan for 300 soles.  She now continues with the same business.

She will use the loan of 1,000 soles to buy meters of different types and colors of fabric, scissors, large spools of various colors of thread, needles for sewing and for the machine, pins, and buttons.

She now feels like a fulfilled woman with a great desire to make the rest of her dreams come true.  She is grateful to the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping her start her business.

loans.use: to buy fabric, scissors, thread, needles for sewing and for the machine, pins, and bottons

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a 29-year-old member of Imani group under Faulu Kenya.  She has been operating a boutique so as to earn a living.  She has employed one person in the business.  Even though she runs her business in a competitive environment, she is able to retain her clients because of her good customer care.  

Eunice is determined to expand her business and open other outlets in the future.  She has requested a loan of 50,000 Kes to buy belts and clothes.

loans.use: To buy belts and clothes for resale.

loans.name: Ramiro

texts.es:
El señor Ramiro y su esposa desde hace tiempo compraron un terreno, que con ahorros propios fueron construyendo lo que ahora es su casa. Ramiro es un hombre muy trabajador al igual que su esposa; esto lo hacen con el fin de ofrecer a sus 2 hijos una mejor calidad de vida y un patrimonio para el futuro. 
En este momento se le esta presentado una oportunidad para arreglar las escrituras de su terreno, que por circunstancias económicas no realizaron hace años, una oficina de localidad esta ofreciendo arreglar estos documentos a un bajo precio para que esta familia tenga todo en regla. El señor Ramiro no cuenta con el suficiente capital para aprovechar esta oferta recurre a esta institución para pedir un apoyo y así arreglar sus documentos para que no afecten en un futuro.
texts.en:
Ramiro and his wife bought a plot of land some time ago.  They have been using their own savings to build what is now their home.  Ramiro and his wife are very hard-working people.  They did all this so that they could offer their two children a better quality of life and assets for the future.

Right now, there is an opportunity for Ramiro to sort out the deeds to his land.  He did not do this years ago due to his economic circumstances.  An office in town is offering to sort out these documents for him, at a low price, so that he can have everything in order.  Ramiro doesn't have enough capital to take advantage of this offer.  For this reason, he is requesting the support of this institution so that he can sort out the documents to ensure that he doesn't experience difficulties in the future.

loans.use: to pay to sort out the deeds to his land

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma P. is from the city of Pantaon Ozamiz City. She is 56 years old. Norma is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Norma owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting gabi for sale. Norma has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 1000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2011, Norma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be her first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches  covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Olawalé Pascal

texts.fr: Olawalé Pascal est né en 1967 à Omou dans le département de l’Ouémé. Olawalé Pascal est marié à Brigitte une marchande. Le couple  à six enfants à charge dont cinq sont les leurs. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés. Olawalé Pascal à arrêté l’école au secondaire et a appris le métier de soudure. Olawalé Pascal exerce ce métier  passionnément depuis vingt et un ans, ce qui lui permet de satisfaire aux exigences de sa clientèle et d’assurer les diverses charges de sa famille. Olawalé Pascal désire agrandir son atelier en s’approvisionnant en matériels de soudure (plieuse, fer, perceuse, etc.). Olawalé Pascal s’approvisionne à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. C’est la deuxième fois que Olawalé Pascal demande l’appui financier de ALIDé. Ceci lui permettra certainement de rehausser le niveau de son activité, d’accroître sa clientèle et son revenu.
texts.en: Olawalé Pascal was born in 1967 in Omou in the Ouémé department. He is married to Brigitte, a shopkeeper. The couple have six children in their care, of whom five are their own. All of the children attend or have attended school. Olawalé Pascal ended his studies in secondary school and trained to be a welder. He has practiced this profession passionately for 21 years, which has allowed him to meet his customers' demands and to provide for his own family. He would like to enlarge his workshop by supplying himself with welding equipment (a press, iron, a drill, etc.). Olawalé Pascal gets his supplies in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin. This is the second time he is seeking financial support through ALIDÉ (one of Kiva's field partners). This will certainly allow him to raise the level of his business and increase both his clientele and his income.

loans.use: To buy welding supplies (a welding machine, hand shears, etc.)

loans.name: Khvicha

texts.en:
Khvicha is 50 years old. He comes from village Kvenatkotsa, East Georgia. Khvicha is married and lives in the village with his wife Ketevan, two sons (21 and 20 years old) and his parents. All members of the family are involved in agricultural activities. They run a dairy farm with three milk cows, produce cheese and sell it on the open market. Also they rent 4.5 ha of land, where wheat, barley, maize, haricot beans and garlic are grown. Harvested products are sold locally.  Also Khvicha has a modern multifunctional tractor which performs different types of agricultural tasks – tilling, cultivation, sowing. He uses it in his farm, as well as carrying out orders of neighbor farmers. Total average monthly income of the family accounts to 1700 Laris. 

With the requested credit Khvicha will purchase the plot of land with an area of 4.5 ha, for which he now pays rent - 600 Laris. This is quite a significant expense for the family. As a result of the purchase of land, the income of the family will increase, as they won’t have to pay rent for the land. 

With the increase in profit Khvicha plans to purchase more agricultural machinery, which will be used in his farm, as well as neighboring farms.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural land.

loans.name: Loreta Feil

texts.en:
Loreta is very much interested and enjoys mat weaving. Loreta is 32 years old, and she is married with three school-age children. She lived in Bañadero Ozamis city. To earn a living Loreta sells weaved mats. She has been in this business for more than three years. Each month she earn PHP 4,500.00. Loreta has been a member of GDMPC for one year. Loreta requested a loan of Php 5,000.00 at GDMPC to purchase additional materials for mat weaving.

In the future, Loreta hopes that she has a progressive business, and can reproduce more product that are demanded by the public.

loans.use: To buy materials for mat weaving.

loans.name: Keswe

texts.en:
Kaswe is 46 years old and married to Resiato. They are blessed with three children.

Keswe is a livestock trader in Enkaroni–Bissil where by he sells livestock like cows, goats and sheep for slaughtering by the butcher men. He has been doing this for the last 11 years and gets an income of KES 29,000 per month.

Kaswe has got good credit history and he is applying for his second loan from KADET Ltd., with which he plans to purchase more livestock like cows, goats, sheep and others.

He will use the extra profit to buy a pick-up for transporting meat to the Nairobi Barma open air market.

Kaswe hopes to get orders at Nairobi and be slaughtering animals and transporting them to Nairobi. He is very hardworking and focused.

loans.use: To purchase more livestock like cows, goats and sheep.

loans.name: Nuha

texts.en:
Nuha, from Madaba Jordan, is a 48-year-old married mother of four children. Nuha started her enterprise years ago from her home, selling a limited range of products from a small table; she later dedicated a corner in her home for the business and added shelves to hold more products. Now requesting a loan of 600 JD to purchase more products for her store, Nuha aspires to license it and move it from her home.

Note: the man in the photo is her husbened and sue to culturA. issues she refused to add her picture.

loans.use: to purchase products for her store.

loans.name: Kimly

texts.en:
Kimly is a mason, while his wife stays at home and does house work. They live along National Road Number Five about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have two sons and two daughters. One is married and lives outside the family home, two are garment workers and another one is in school.

Kimly is asking for a loan of $1,000 to build a new house and pay for house moving fees. Because the house where he lives is located on his parents’ land, he wants to move to his own land. 

Hence he decided to apply for a loan to use for the purpose. 

Photo: Kimly and his wife.

loans.use: To build a new house and pay for house moving fees.

loans.name: Emilio

texts.es:
Emilio de familia de 68 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijos en su casa propia, no cuenta con servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande, la cual pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

Emilio desde hace varios años se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado ovino (ovejas), su corral se encuentra en la parte posterior de su casa, los cuales son apropiados y amplios, los alimenta con comida balanceada y pastos naturales, una vez que lleguen a tener un crecimiento óptimo los ofrece en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así obtiene buenas ganancias para solventar los gastos diarios de su casa.  

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 800 nuevos soles para comprar alimento balanceado, con los ingresos que obtenga puede cubrir su crédito y mejorar su calidad de vida.  Emilio es una persona trabajadora y responsable que lo único que quiere es poder superarse y  mejorar económicamente para gozar de algunas comodidades en su casa.
texts.en:
Emilio is 68 years old and lives in his own home with his wife and children. They do not receive basic services. He resides in the rural section of the District of Tambogrande, which is part of the Department of Piura. This area is known for its businesses that involve agriculture, livestock breeding, and handicrafts.

Emilio has been raising and selling sheep for several years. The animals are kept behind his house in a pen that has an appropriate and ample amount of space. They are fed a diet of balanced feed and natural grasses. Once the animals have reached optimal growth, they are offered at different markets in the area. With the money he earns, Emilio is able to cover his daily household needs.

He is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 800 PEN in order to buy balanced feed. With the revenue he generates, Emilio will be able to repay his loan and improve his quality of life. He is a hardworking and responsible person who only wants to succeed and improve financially so that he can obtain a few household comforts.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed for his animals.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul, aged 33, is a father of two aged eight and six and has been in farming in his hometown of Litein for four years with the help of one farmhand. His farm produces milk, potatoes, and maize. Apart from selling his own milk, Paul sources more from other farmers which he retails to customers within the local market.

Paul has requested a loan of 60,000 KES from Juhiudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says that the income will help him pay for his children's education. He is optimistic that his farm will grow owing to the experience he has so far.

Paul says infrastructure remains the biggest challenge followed by price fluctuations.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is 36 years old, married and with three children in school.  To earn a living, she does dairy farming.  She has been in the business for 15 years.  Previously, she was employed.  She managed to go into farming after getting capital from Faulu Kenya. 
 
In five years, she hopes to have more cows in her farm for more milk production.  She has requested a loan of 100,000 Kenya shillings to buy a dairy cow.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Aiymkan's Group

texts.en:
Aiymkan is the treasurer of this group. She is a 48-years-old, married woman. Together with her husband she has raised a son and a daughter; both of their children are working in Russia. Aiymkan, with the help of her husband, breeds livestock to earn additional money.

Aiymkan applied for this loan because she needs money to purchase furniture for her younger sister’s dowry. She explains that her sister is getting married soon. In the future, Aiymkan wants to see her daughter get married. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase furniture

loans.name: Justo

texts.es: El señor Justo nacido en la población de Mocoya - Chuquisaca, de 54 años radicado actualmente desde hace 30 años en la comunidad de San Miguel perteneciente al municipio de la Guardia, vive  en concubinato (que conviven pero no son casados) con la señora Paulina y tienen 4 hijos  ya mayores de edad, el Sr.  Justo y su señora se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 30 años, es su primer crédito y lo va a destinar a la siembra de maní y o que implica el preparado de la tierra,  el señor justo también esta a punto de conseguir la titulación de sus tierras, por ello el trabaja con esmero en la agricultura, estando agradecido por el préstamo.
texts.en: Justo was born in the town of Mocoya - Chuquisaca.  He is 54 years old and has been living in the community of San Miguel, in La Guardia, for thirty years.  Justo lives with his partner Paulina (they live together but are not married) and they have four grown-up children.  Justo and his partner have been farming for thirty years.  This is his first loan and he will use it to sow peanuts, preparing the land for planting.  Justo is also about to receive legal ownership of his land.  For this reason, he carries out his farming with great care.  He is grateful for his loan.

loans.use: to sow peanuts

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena, 34, is married and has three school age children. Her husband is a farmer. She supports her husband in supplying for their needs, especially with their daily food. 

Rowena has a general store, a business she has been in for three years. She sells different kinds of products, such as sugar, shampoo, eggs, cooking oil, noodles and other basic needs items to earn an income. She has a monthly income of 3,250 PHP. Now, Rowena wants to expand her business and she has thus requested a loan of 4,000 PHP to purchase additional goods to sell. Her products are very salable in their community. Rowena hopes to expand her business so that she can earn more profit and repair her house.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell.

loans.name: Abubakarr's Group

texts.en:
In the photo above is a group of teachers from a primary school situated in Koidu/Kono, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. This group has come to Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva based in Makeni, northen Sierra Leone to seek a loan. Like their teacher colleagues in other regions of the country, they have requested this loan so that they will be able to meet their immediate financial challenges. They will repay the loan at the end of each month, using their monthly salaries. 

The leader of this group of teachers is Abubakar. Born in Makeni city, the 45 year-old is married and has two children who are attending primary school. With five years of experience in the teaching profession, Abubakar is requesting for this loan in order to buy food for the family and use the rest of the loan to pay his medical bills.

loans.use: to buy food for the family and use the rest of the loan to pay his medical bills

loans.name: Gerry

texts.en:
With his desire to improve his family's living situation, Gerry has devoted himself full-time to his corn farm business for 25 years. He is 41 years old and is married to a business minded woman. They have five children. His wife works in her sari-sari (convenience) store and sometimes she sells different kinds of fish in the local community. They work hard to give their children a good quality of life and to lift them out of poverty.

Now, he is requesting a loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase seedlings and fertilizers for his corn farm business. He hopes to grow and increase his yield with the help of this loan.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and fertilizers for his corn farm business

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. 
Imelda has a shop that sells firewood & green bananas. She has had this business for 2 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 14,000 to buy stocks of bananas & firewood to sell.
Imelda has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future,Imelda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of bananas &  firewood to sell

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 39 años, está casada con Edgar de 39 años, que fruto de esta relación tienen 3 hijos. Ellos viven en su casa propia ubicada en el distrito de Sivia.  María es una mujer emprendedora, recuerda que antes de tener su botica , ofrecía productos de belleza tocando puertas, trasladándose de un pueblo a otro atendiendo a cuanto cliente pudiera encontrar. Con el tiempo su negocio estaba creciendo de a pocos, además ya tenía una cantidad considerable de clientes. Mas adelante conocería a Edgar su actual esposo, y cuya profesión es enfermero. Desde entonces montaron una botica, en el ahora se dedican. Pues es así que ahora María expende sus productos de belleza en su botica juntamente con los medicamente de su esposo. María esta satisfecha por los logros que le esta dando el dedicarse a éste negocio, por que le esta generando buenos ingresos económicos. En un futuro espera que su botica sea la mejor de Sivia. Éste será su segundo credito con MFP, por lo que se compromete una vez más en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 2500 nuevos soles, comprará más medicamentos para surtir su botica.
texts.en:
María is 39 and is married to Edgar, 39. The couple has three children. They live in their own house located in the Sivia district. María is an enterprising woman. She recalls that before she had her pharmacy, she offered beauty products from door-to-door, moving from one city to another, serving any customers she was able to find. With time, her business grew slowly and she also had a considerable number of customers. Later, she met Edgar, her now-husband, who is a nurse. 

Since that time, they opened a pharmacy where they currently both work. Thus María sells her beauty products along with her husband’s medications. María is pleased with the achievements she is seeing from working at her business, as it is generating good profits.

In the future, she hopes that her pharmacy becomes the best in the city. This will be her second loan with MFP, and she commits to once again punctually making her repayments. With the 2,500 nuevos soles, she will purchase more medication to sell in the pharmacy.

loans.use: to purchase more medication.

loans.name: Bobo

texts.ru: Бобо занимается скотоводством и одновременно выращивает сельхозпродукты. Он женат и на воспитании имеет троих детей. Его жена домохозяйка, иногда помогает мужу. Он хочет расширить свой бизнес и хочет купить скот потому что  хочет содержать их на отходы выращенных сельхозпродуктов . С этой целью Бобо запрашивает займ и просит вас о финансовой помощи. Он надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Bobo raises cattle and grows crops. He is married and is raising three children. His wife is a home maker and sometimes helps her husband with the farm. Bobo wants to expand his business and buy more animals which he plans to feed with leftovers from his crop harvest. For this reason Bobo is requesting this loan and asking you for financial assistance. He hopes for your charity.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Luisa Catalina

texts.es:
La Señora Luisa es socia del banco comunal El Mirador, vive por la parroquia de Turi, esta parroquia tiene el nombre de Mirador ya que desde allí se puede observar gran parte de la ciudad de Cuenca, su gente se dedica al comercio, agricultura y cría de animales, se caracterizan por ser amables y gentiles con todos sus visitantes.

Doña Luisa tiene 30 años, es madre soltera de 4 hijos de 16, 14, 12 y 10 años, sus tres primeros hijos están estudiando en un colegio de la ciudad y su último hijo está estudiando en la escuela. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de un familiar.
 
La Señora Luisa se dedica a la compra de pollos vivos  y los vende pelados, esta actividad lo realiza hace 4 años, trabaja de domingo a domingo y vende su producto a sus conocidas y amigas.
 
Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por una amiga, su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos para continuar con su negocio.
 
Su meta es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Luisa is a member of the El Mirador Village Bank and lives in Turi Parish. The parish is called Mirador because from that lookout point most of the city of Cuenca can be seen. The people of the area mostly work in commerce, agriculture and animal husbandry, and are known for being friendly and gracious towards all of their visitors. 

Luisa is 30 years old and is the single mother of four children who are 16, 14, 12 and 10 years old. Her oldest three children are studying in a high school in the city, while her youngest child is in elementary school. She does not have her own house, so she lives a relative's house. 

Luisa has a business buying live chickens and selling them (dead and) plucked. She has had this business for four years and works seven days a week. She sells her chicken to friends and acquaintances. 

This is her first communal bank loan; she was invited by a friend to join the group. She plans to use her loan to buy chickens in order to continue with her business. 

Her goal is to own her own home.

loans.use: buy chickens

loans.name: Acosta Ñu Group

texts.es:
21 mujeres de la ciudad de Asunción se han unido para que por medio del programa de mujeres emprendedoras puedan salir adelante y ayudar a sus familias. Actualmente este comité se encuentra en su 4to. ciclo en donde se puede destacar el sentido de responsabilidad en las actividades y en las reuniones y los deseos de progresar que tienen cada una de ellas.
Fatima es una de esas mujeres. Ella comenta que gracias a su trabajo y a la ayuda del grupo ella ha podido salir adelante y ayudar a su familia. Ella cuenta que se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de ropas, como ser remeras, camisas, pantalones y demás tipos de prendas. Dice que su sueño es poder seguir creciendo y de esa forma continuar ayudando a su familia.
Fatima pide la ayuda de la fundación y de kiva para poder comprar prendas de verano, y de esa forma estar preparada para recibir los pedidos de sus clientes. Agradece por esta oportunidad que se le esta dando.
texts.en:
Twenty-one women from the city of Asunción have joined together so that they can get ahead with their families through the enterprising women program.  The committee is currently in its 4th cycle and they stand out for their sense of responsibility in the activities and meetings and for the desire to make progress that each one of them has.

Fátima is one of these women.  She comments that thanks to her work and help from the group she’s been able to get ahead and help her family.  She relates that she sells all types of clothes like t-shirts, shirts, pants and other types of clothes.  She says that her dream is to be able to continue to grow and continue to help her family this way.

Fátima asks for the Fundación’s and for Kiva’s help to be able to buy summer clothes to be prepared for her customers’ orders.  She is grateful for the opportunity she’s being given.

loans.use: to buy clothes for subsequent resale.

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing and fish vending business in the Philippines. Nena has been in this business for 20 years. She earns additional income from her sari-sari (variety) store.

She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase materials for her fishing and fish vending business.

Nena has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase materials for her fishing business.

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es: Maria Mercedes es una pequeña comerciante, se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, el crédito lo está solicitando para pagar el curso de titulación de su carrera de Psicología. Sus planes son formarse como una de las mejores profesionales, trabajando en un hospital. Sus planes son en un futuro estudiar un postgrado o maestría. Le inspira el poder ayudar a otros, crecer como persona. Uno de los desafíos ha sido poder mantener su carrera, ya que la situación del negocio ha sido buena y mala.
texts.en: Maria Mercedes is a small merchant selling beauty products. The loan will be used to pay for her graduation as a Bachelor in Psychology. She plans to become one of the best career women working in a hospital. In the future, she also plans to study for a post doctoral or Master's program. She's inspired by the power to help others and personal growth. One of the challenges she has faced is to maintain her career, since the job environment has been good and bad.

loans.use: to finish her studies and pay for her graduation.

loans.name: Nyabahegere Group

texts.en:
Nyabahengere is a Nuru International group of three farmers in Kuria West District in Kenya. The members joined the group to acquire skills and knowledge on improved farming methods. They are able to obtain loans through Nuru to acquire farm inputs. As a group, the members of Nyabahengere collectively guarantee the loan.

Eunice, who is raising up her hand, is the chairperson of the group and has been a member of the group since the year 2009. She is 53 years old and is married with five children, three of whom are in college.
 
The loan from Kiva will enable Eunice to acquire hybrid seeds and fertilizer which will enable her to obtain high yields. Just like the other members of her group, Eunice will take input loans for one acre. She plans to grow maize on 1/2 acre and sorghum and millet on ¼ acre each. Eunice plans to sell the surplus and join a saving and loaning scheme so she will save some of the money obtained from selling the surplus. She will then obtain a loan to invest in a business and contribute to paying school fees for her children in college.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum and millet.

loans.name: Roth's Group

texts.en: Roth is a local village from the Battambang province and she is 33 years old. To overcome her financial burden, she grows rice and cassavawhich she has been for one year. This business earned her 60,000 KHR per day. Now, she is applyingfor a loan with VisionFund(Kiva’s partner) and she leads a group consisting of three members. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay for plowing the field and use a her portion of it to buy cassava seedling. She believes that her condition of living will be remove and getting better than before.

loans.use: to pay for plowing the field

loans.name: Milham

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma’s agents, Milham. Milham lives in East Serang, located about two hours drive from Jakarta, the capital city. He lives there with his wife and his only son. He owns a small stall where he sells snacks, drinks, mobile phone accessories and provide mobile payment service for his community. He feels that since he joined Ruma he learnt a lot about how to improve his business, as well as gave more contribution to his community. 

As the business keep growing, Milham is hoping to get another working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile payment services to his community, especially on weekends. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Milham improves his business and accordingly, his community who needs access to such services. As seen in the photo, Milham is the one who is sitting in his own stall. He will be thankful for your support.

loans.use: to process more prepaid mobile airtime purchases and utility bill payments (like electricity, water, etc) for members of his local community.

loans.name: Nancy Njoki

texts.en:
This business is a member of the Queen Esther Women Group. Group lending, also known as solidarity lending, is a mechanism that allows a number of individuals to provide collateral or guarantee a loan through a group repayment pledge. The incentive to repay is based on peer pressure; if one person in the group defaults, the other group members make up the payment amount. - Kiva Staff

Nancy is a member of Queen Esther Women Group and she is married. Nancy has no professional training in business and also farming but uses indigenous farming methods.

Nancy takes farming as her sole business venture. Mostly she cultivates food crops that range from maize, beans and other types of cereal. Her activities have been affected over the last seasons because of the prolonged drought. She has been straggling with irrigation using local means on a small piece of land but it would have been better if she had a water pump. This is costly and thus would like to buy a dairy cow for zero grazing.

loans.use: She plans to buy a dairy cow to enable her diversify her income.

loans.name: Ayifo

texts.en:
Mrs Ayifo A. is married and mother of four (4) children. Her husband, a driver of a motorcycle taxi, doesn't have a salary that insures the expenses of the family will be covered, despite their daily efforts. It is because of this that Mrs A. has invested in the sale of food as her primary activity. Very dynamic and daring, she began her business with her own finances and she dedicated herself to it completely. This activity has grown in scope, because of the quality of the dishes she offers to her clientele. Today, because of the importance her business, Mrs. A. needs a loan of $800 to enlarge her business and respond to the needs of clientele.

Translated from French by Susan Bell, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame A. Ayifo est mariée et mère de quatre (4) enfants. Son mari, conducteur de taxi moto, ne possède pas un revenu qui assure les dépenses familiales malgré tous ses efforts quotidiens. C’est pour cela que Madame A. s’est investie dans la vente des denrées alimentaires comme activité principale. Très dynamique et audacieuse, elle a commencé ses activités commerciales avec ses propres moyens financiers et s’est consacrée entièrement à son commerce. Cette activité a pris une ampleur importante compte tenu de la qualité des plats qu’elle offre à ses clients. Aujourd’hui, compte tenu de l’importance que prennent ses activités commerciales, Madame A. a besoin d’un appui financier d’un $800 pour agrandir son commerce et répondre aux besoins de sa clientèle.

loans.use: sale of food supplies

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Felicia is a client of Kraban Support Foundation and has benefited several times from the organization. She sells yams in her locality. She wants to expand her business and is therefore seeking a loan of US$700.00 from Kiva.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Rosa

texts.pt:
Rosa M., was born and raised in Mudissa, in the Matutuine province, Maputo. She was raised by her maternal grandmother. Her family’s financial situation provided little opportunities for studying. Rosa studied until the 4th grade. Since 1990, Rosa has supported her family through her small business which expanded to 2 stores.

In 2006, Rosa was introduced to HLUVUKU ADSEMA by her neighbors and requested her first loan in order to expand her business. Since then the business has grown. Today it provides employment for 3 people. With the earnings from the business, Rosa provides for her family, and pays for the schooling of her children. Rosa was also able to open a savings account.

With the loan of 20.000,00 MT, Rosa plans to increase the stock in her business. Rosa’s work has a positive impact in her community because it provides employment for Rosa and 3 other people. It also brings basic products closer to her community especially in the neighborhood Bairro 1.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

LOCALIZAÇÃO: Bairro 01 - Boane ACTIVIDADE: Comercio CLIENTE: Rosa Mafambame VALOR DE EMPRESTIMO: 20.000,00MT (800.00US$) APLICAÇÃO DO MONTANTE: Compra e venda de Produtos Inicio: 10/06/2007 Fim: 31/07/2008 Rosa M., Natural de Mudissa, Distrito de Matutuine, Provincia de Maputo, cresceu na responsabilidade da Avo na parte da Mae, a situacao financeira da familia criou-lhe poucas oportunidades para estudar, tendo concluido apenas 4 classe. Desde 1990 vem assumindo na integra a gestao de negocio da familia e conta hoje com dois (2) pequenos estabeleciomentos comerciais.

Apartir do ano de 2006 por indicação da vizinha teve conhecimento da existência da HLUVUKU ADSEMA tendo aproximado e solicitado o seu primeiro emprestimo para ampliacao do seu negocio. Desde entao a sua actividade conheceu outra dinamica. Actualmente o seu negocio esta num bom ritmo e providencia emprego para tres (3) pessoas. Com os rendimentos da sua actividade suporta os encargos familiares, despesas Escolares e conseguiu abrir uma conta poupança.

Com o emprestimo de 20.000,00 pretende aumentar o volume de mercadoria. A sua actividade tem impacto maior na comunidade porque alem de providenciar emprego para ela propria e tres (3) outras pessoas, coloca o produto mas perto da comunidade em particular destaque para todo pessoal do Bairro-1.

loans.use: To increase stock in her business

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina G. Tucupa, 29, makes the wide woven shawls that women here use as baby carriers. She uses a mechanical weaving machine. The shawls are called trajecitos in Spanish.

With the weaving machine she and her husband can make 30 dozen in one month, making a profit of about US$.70 on each item. They deliver them to a reseller in Guatemala City for resale. She and her husband turned to Friendship Bridge for credit in order to increase their output, which is on track and they are accomplishing their objectives in this second cycle of credit. Now that they have more working capital they can purchase in bulk and have the material they need for their weaving.

Angelina and her husband have 6 children under the age of 10, and the kids that should be in school are studying. She herself completed only the second grade.

Here is a video of the paperwork meeting that Angelina attended to apply for this loan.

Written by Nancy Lewis and Randy Fay, Kiva Fellows

loans.use: Purchase yarn for her weaving machines

loans.name: Maria Ingracia

texts.en:
For 10 years, Maria Ingracia S. R. has been cooking baleadas to order. Baleadas are typical food of Honduras. They are corn tortillas filled with a mixture of beans and egg, banana, and butter. She sells her popular baleadas to her neighbors and people who live nearby. She supports her 3 children with her business.

She is requesting this loan of $150 to purchase supplies to make and sell baleadas.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to make baleadas to sell

loans.name: Mussarat

texts.en: My name is Mussarat B. and I'm from Lahore, the second largest city in Pakistan. I am married with six children. My husband and I do not work anymore, as we have grown old. My eldest son feels that it is time for us to rest and time for him to work. He has started a business making steel rulers (a strip of wood, metal, or other material that has a straight edge and usually marked in inches or centimeters, and is used for drawing lines, measuring, and so on). I am requesting a loan of US$350 for my son’s business. With this loan, he will be able to buy steel in bulk and use it to manufacture these rulers. Buying in bulk is relatively cheaper and will enable us to produce more rulers.

loans.use: Buy steel in bulk to manufacture rulers

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
Julio is 40 years old, works in transportation and already has two vehicles (taxis), of which he drives one. He rents the other one out to a third person.

Julio is separated from his wife, but he is responsible for and lives with his son, who is studying in school.

He has been working as a taxi driver since 88 months ago, so he can say that he has quite a bit of experience.

With his competence in this work, Julio's experience allows him to rely on stable customers who contact him by cell phone. This is also an advantage, so he knows which are the best places to pick up passengers, when traffic is congested, and other details.

This request will serve to acquire home appliances for his home. Currently, Julio only has debts at Fundación Agrocapital, and one additional financing source. His history and responsibility level at both are excellent.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Julio tiene 40 años de edad, se dedica al transporte ya que cuenta con dos vehículos (taxis) de los cuales uno lo maneja él y el otro lo renta a una tercera persona. Julio se encuentra separado de su esposa, pero el se hace cargo y vive con su hijo, el mismo que se encuentra estudiando en el colegio. La actividad de chofer de taxi la desempeña desde hace 88 meses atrás, por lo que se puede decir que cuenta con una amplia experiencia en el rubro. Si bien existe bastante competencia en este rubro, la experiencia de Julio le permite contar con clientes fijos que lo ubican mediante celular y también es una ventaja para él el tener conocimiento de cuales son los mejores lugares para recoger pasajeros, las horas conflictivas de tránsito y otros. La presente solicitud será destinada a la adquisición de electrodomesticos para su hogar. Actualmente Julio sólo tiene deudas en Agrocapital y otra financiera más, su cumplimiento y responsabilidad en ambas es excelente.

loans.use: Home appliances

loans.name: Simésso

texts.fr:
Married and mother of six (06) children, Mrs. Simésso A. is a gardener by primary occupation. The income from her business is meagre due to the low yield of the soil and the destruction of the majority of her garden by insects. All of this leads to a lack of sufficient means to cover the basic needs of the family.

To remedy this situation, she is asking for a loan of $400 to buy fertilizer and insecticide in order to increase her agricultural yield and satisfy her clientele.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Mariée et mère de six (06) enfants, Madame A. Simésso à pour activité principale le jardinage. Le revenu de son activité toujours maigre dû au mauvais rendement du sol et la destruction de la majeur partie du jardin par les insectes. Tout ceci a pour conséquence l’insuffisance de couverture des besoins vitaux de la famille. Pour remédier à cela, elle sollicite un financement de $400 afin de pouvoir s’acheter de l’engrais et d’insecticides afin d’accroître son rendement agricole et satisfaire sa clientèle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and insecticide

loans.name: Kyebando Central B(Ii) Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Sauda K.. She is currently in the business of running a retail shop and is requesting a loan to purchase more shop items. Sauda is 37 years old and is married to her husband who is an electrician. She has 4 children ranging from age 7 to 21 and her children go to school. Each week, Sauda makes approximately UGX 35000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to save it and buy a plot of land and a house.

Sauda is joined in her small group by Deborah T., Josephine B., Betty A., and Dorcus B.. Deborah T. has a business in carpentry and wants to boost business. Josephine B. is currently operating a retail shop business and wants a loan to purchase a fridge. Betty A. operates a business of selling millet and wants to add more millet to her stock. Dorcus B. is currently in the business of poultry farming and is requesting a loan to purchase chicken feed.

loans.use: To add to a retail shop business

loans.name: Nelly Nancy

texts.es:
Nelly is a single woman who lives in the Peruvian "departamento" of La Libertad. She's 41 years old and has a high school education. Three years ago she had a business selling sweets and snacks to neighbors and acquaintances but the earnings were poor and she decided to switch to cooking to earn a living. She rents a small stand where she operates the business on weekends. From Mondays to Fridays, she sells soft toys, decorative items and all kinds of gifts from her house. Her neighbors and friends seek her out to buy her products to give as gifts.

Nelly is a member of the Luis Alberto S. community lending group from which she received her first loan of S/.300. She used the loan to buy food and kitchen supplies for her business. With this loan of S/.500, to be repaid in four months, she will buy 2 turkeys, 1 sack of rice and other ingredients to make the traditional dishes of the region. She will also give part of the money to her brother, who travels to Lima every week, so that he can buy a few things such as soft toys and gifts that she will resell. Her greatest wish is to have her own restaurant or a place where she would no longer have to pay rent.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Nelly Nancy Sánchez A. es una mujer soltera, vive en el distrito de Moche en la provincia de Trujillo en el departamento La Libertad. Tiene 41 años de dad, estudio secundaria completa. Hace tres años su negocio era la venta de chocotejas y gelatina, el cual ofrecía y vendía a sus vecinos y conocidos, pero este negocio no le daba muchas ganancias así que decide dedicarse a la cocina, consiguió alquilar una pequeña ramada en la campiña de Moche y desde entonces todos los fines de semana se dedica a este negocio. De lunes a viernes en su casa vende peluches, adornos y todo tipo de regalos. Algunos vecinos y amigos la buscan para adquirir alguno de sus productos como regalo para ocasiones especiales.

Es socia fundadora del Grupo Mientras Tanto “Luis Alberto Sánchez”, lugar donde obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 con este dinero compró leche, vasos, gelatina, cobertura y moldes. Con el préstamo de S/. S/.500.00 el cual cancelara en cuatro meses comprara 2 pavos, 1 saco de arroz y demás ingredientes para preparar diferentes potajes tradicionales en la zona, además un poco de este dinero le dará a su hermano que viaja semanalmente a Lima para que le compré un poco de mercadería como: peluches y regalos. Su mayor sueño es tener su propio restaurante o un local propio en el que ya no tenga que pagar alquiler.

loans.use: Buy supplies for restaurant business and stock for gift business.

loans.name: Thị Thoi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Ngo Thi Thoi (ID number: 020025), is 44 years old. She wants to borrow 125 USD to breed the chickens. She is very hard-working. Since her hushand does not have very good health conditions, she is on her own raising and sending 3 children to school. She also works as a cleaner to earn extra money. Together with her pension, she is able to repay the borrowed money during the last 6 months. Mrs. Duong Thi Nga (ID number: 020022), is 28 years old. She would like to borrow 125 USD to buy wood to practice carpentry. Mrs. Nguyen Thi Hue (ID number: 020026), is 37 years old. She wants to borrow 140 USD to breed the pigs. Mrs. Dang Thi Nhan (ID number: 020024), is 38 years old. She borrows 175 USD to breed the pigs. Mrs. Nghiem Thi Lan (ID number: 020052), is 37 years old. She would like to borrow 125 USD to breed the pigs.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Cô Ngô Thị Thoi (MS: 020025), năm nay 44 tuổi. Vay 2.006.000 VND để lấy vốn chăn nuôi gà thịt. Cô rất chịu khó và đảm đang, cô nuôi ba con đang đi học, chồng cô thì sức khoẻ không được tốt. Ngoài ra cô còn đăn ký đi làm vệ sinh ở thị trấn để có thêm thu nhập, cộng với lương của một giáo viên về hưu sớm. Cô đã tiết kiệm để hoàn trả vốn cho chương trình tốt trong sáu tháng vừa qua và những kỳ tiếp theo. Chị Dương Thị Nga (MS: 020022), năm nay 28 tuổi, vay 2.006.000 VND về mua gỗ làm mộc. Chị Nguyễn Thị Huề (MS: 020026), năm nay 37 tuổi, vay 2.242.000 VND để chăn nuôi lợn. Chị Đặng Thị Nhân (MS: 020024), năm nay 38 tuổi, vay 2.714.000 VND để chăn nuôi lợn. Chị Nghiêm Thị Lan (MS: 020052), năm nay 37 tuổi,vay 2.006.000 VND để chăn nuôi lợn.

loans.use: breed the pigs, chickens and practice carpentry

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
Gregoria has always been a hard-working woman who has wants to send her three dear children to college. Since beginning her family, she has always thought about getting ahead and helping her family prosper. This is why she began selling food and opened a small stand to sell candy and soft drinks. Every day she sells her goods until late at night so that she can sell the most that she can. Gregoria has her small candy stand in a strategic location of which she wants to take full advantage. This is why she wants to increase the variety and stock of her goods.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

Gregoria, siempre fue una mujer emprendedora con el gran deseo de ofrecerle estudios superiores a sus 3 queridos hijos. Desde que formó su familia tuvo en mente salir adelante y prosperar junto a su familia, es por ello que se dedica a la venta de comida y al mismo tiempo posee un puestito de venta de golosinas y bebidas gaseosas en el que también se desempeña diariamente para ofrecer sus productos hasta altas horas de la noche con el fin de vender la mayor cantidad de mercadería posible.El puestito de venta de golosinas de doña Gregoria es muy estratégico, es por ello que desea sacarle mayor provecho, para ello tiene pensado aumentar la variedad y el stock de mercadería.

loans.use: A loan to be able to offer more goods.

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr:
Kossi A., 29, is married and the father of two children. He is a mechanic and auto body repairman in Avetonou, a little village situated about 100 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. The loan will allow him to purchase some tools and to make improvements on his garage so as to attract more clients. In this way, Kossi will earn more money and be able to improve living conditions for his family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Kossi A. est âgé de 29 ans, marié et père de 2 enfants. Il est mécanicien soudeur à Avetonou, un petit village situé à environ 100 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Le crédit lui permettra d’acheter des outils de travail et d’aménager son garage pour attirer plus de clients. Ce faisant, monsieur Kossi gagnera plus d’argent pour améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use:
purchase tools and upgrade his garage

Acheter des outils de travail et aménager son garage

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 41-year-old Dorothy N., who is married and has four children aged between 3 and 15. In 1998, Dorothy established her tailoring business. Working six days a week, 11 hours a day, and assisted by her husband and one employee, she earns about $50 every month from this business. Dorothy now requests a loan in order to purchase an additional sewing machine, as well as cloth and thread. In the future, she plans to open another business. Dorothy thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

loans.use: To purchase an additional sewing machine, cloth and thread.

loans.name: Agustina Ilmer

texts.es:
Agustina belongs to Las Románticas Community Bank located in the AA.HH 7 D. Junio Avenue Colonización Mzc. Lt.3, in the San Fernando District of the Department of Ucayali. She is 46 years old and is the mother of 4 children. Her husband works in a company. With the first loan of S/. 300 that Agustina received from Manuela Ramos she decided to invest in a small grocery store. Today she continues with her grocery store and day by day she has more will to continue advancing her business. In the evenings she has another type of income which is the sale of “salchipapas,” a dish that combines sausages and potatoes. With this loan of S/ 700.00, which will be paid over 4 months, she will expand her business with the purchase of groceries like packages of noodles, sugar, rice, oil, sweets and others. Agustina is satisfied with Manuela Ramos because it has given her the opportunity to continue expanding her business and she hope to start a store to sell auto parts so that she can continue improving her economic situation.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Agustina, pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Románticas, ubicado en el AA.HH 7 D. Junio Av. Colonización Mzc. Lt.3, del Distrito D. San Fernando, del Departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 46 años es madre D. 4 hijos, su esposo trabaja en una compañía. Agustina con el primer préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertir en bodega. Hoy continua con su bodega y que día a día le pone muchas ganas para seguir surgiendo en su negocio. y por las noches también tiene otro tipo D. un ingreso que es vender sus salchipapas. Con este préstamo D. S/ 700.00 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, incrementará su negocio con la compra D. abarrotes como: paquetes D. fideos, azúcar, arroz, aceite, golosinas y otros. Agustina esta satisfecha con Manuela Ramos porque le da la oportunidad D. que pueda seguir aumentado su negocio y que tiene toda la esperanza D. poner una tienda para venta D. repuestos D. motokar para que así pueda seguir incrementando su economía.

loans.use: Purchase of diverse products (groceries).

loans.name: Cheb

texts.en:
This is the second time Mr. Cheb S., 29, is requesting a loan in order to improve his living conditions. His wife, Mrs. Buoy Koeurn, is a housewife who cooks delicious food for her household. The couple has three children, two of whom are enrolled in school. The family lives in Pongro Village in Kampong Cham Province

He is a potato farmer. Since his field has been covered by grass, he needs to chop the grass out in order to clear the land for growing more potatoes. Mr. Cheb S. has decided to hire laborers to do this work and is requesting a loan to help pay for their services.

loans.use: To hire laborers to chop the grass out of the field in order to grow a larger potato crop.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan es soltero, tiene 37 años, vive con su hijo de 8 años Jhony.  Desde que terminó sus estudios secundarios, tuvo que  dedicarse a trabajar, ya que no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar una carrera universitaria, es así que hace 5 años, con sus ahorros compra un triciclo, el cual se ha convertido en su principal fuente de ingresos, realizando transporte de pasajeros.  Usualmente trabaja desde las 8 de la mañana hasta entrada la noche  para ganar lo suficiente y mantener a su pequeño Jhony y así cubrir todos sus gastos.  Le gusta mucho su  trabajo, ya que se siente útil al realizarlo y puede conversar y compartir  con la gente que requiere de sus servicios, pero algunas veces, cuando trabaja de noche, las calles se tornan peligrosas, haciendo que esta sea la parte difícil de su trabajo.  El motivo de  tanto esfuerzo es su pequeño, a quien quiere sacar adelante y hacer un hombre de bien.  El dinero del préstamo quiere invertirlo en la reparación de su triciclo, el cual presenta algunas averías y mejorar así, el servicio que presta.  En el futuro Juan quiere comprar un motocarro o poner otro negocio paralelo, y así incrementar su negocio.
texts.en:
Juan is single, is 37 years of age and lives with his 8 year-old son Jhony. Since he finished high school, he has had to work as he did not have the opportunity to study in the university.
