It is because of this that, 5 years ago, with his savings, he purchased a three-wheel cart, which he has turned into his primary source of income by transporting passengers. Usually he works from 8 in the morning until the early evening so that he can earn enough to support his little Jhony and that way cover his expenses. He really likes his work and feels useful now that he is doing the work and can talk and share with the people that need his services. But, sometimes, when he works late, the streets become dangerous making this the hard part of his work. The motivation for such effort is his little one, who he wants to get ahead and make a good man. He would like to invest the money from the loan to repair his cart which is damaged and that way improve the service he provides. In the future, Juan wants to buy a three-wheeled motor cart to start another business on the side and that way increase his business.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair of his three-wheeled cart that he uses to transport passengers

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose A. is a 56-year-old divorced mother of two children, both of whom are currently in school. For the past twenty five years, Rose has been a trader at the local market of Tema in Ghana. More specifically, she is food vendor operator who sells porridge (koko and masa). She notes that many Ghanaians enjoy this food, especially in the morning, and that most students eat this food (which they call "sha bra," meaning "sharp brain") because it is very affordable.

With her 25 years of experience, however, she is convinced that her business can really excel with an increase in capital. As such, she is seeking a loan to increase her inventory by purchasing an additional stock of firewood and food stuffs such as sugar, beans, groundnuts, millet, and wheat. Moreover, she hopes to use any remaining loan proceeds to finance her children's education.

Rose is a member of the community group known as the Ultimate Trust Group. In this group, members not only provide support for one another as they try to repay their loans, but they also guarantee each others' loans as social collateral to ensure that their respective loans are promptly repaid. Her picture was taken at one of their group meetings.

loans.use: To increase her inventory by purchasing additional firewood and food stuffs (e.g., sugar, beans, and wheat)

loans.name: Yon

texts.en: Mrs. Yon O., 58, is a resident of Preyngy Commune in Pursat Province. She sells groceries and ice-creams for kids, and has been doing this for a long time. She is married with five children; four who are in school, and one who is married. Her husband, Mr. Yem Norin, aged 61, is a national lottery agent who gets commission from the company to sustain his family's needs. Recently, O. sold her groceries till she had an empty store, and she would like to request a loan to refill her grocery stock for resale.

loans.use: To buy groceries for sale

loans.name: Un's Group

texts.en:
This small loan group has been established by three borrowers, all residents of Battambang Province. The group leader, Mrs. Un S., is 35 years old and is a vegetable seller, as well as selling a little dessert from her home. She currentL. earns about $2 each day and started running her businesses more than two years ago. She is married with eight children, five of whom are single, and the other three are married. To help a little more with the famiL.'s expenses, one of her sons is employed as a construction worker, while her husband is a motorcycle taxi driver.

Un S. hopes to expand her business, but she is lacking the capital to do so; thus, she would like to appL. for a loan to build her side-workshop and then buy more vegetables for sale.

The other two borrowers:

Chan C., 52 years old, makes a living selling fritters. She asks for a loan to buy more ingredients to make the fritters for sale.

Bun L. is 57 years old. She is a dessert seller who is applying for a loan to enlarge her business.

loans.use: To decorate her workshop and buy more vegetables for sale

loans.name: Bukola

texts.en: Bukola J., 37, lives in Ilogbo, Lagos state, Nigeria and has three children. She has been in the business of selling under garments, notebooks and school materials for quite a long time. Bukola hopes to expand her business by adding the grinding of cereals, millet, etc. to her product offerings. She is requesting a loan amount of $350 (N50,000) to purchase a grinding machine. She thanks those who loan money to help her succeed. She is a LAPO client.

loans.use: To purchase one grinding machine

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en: Pamela owns a boutique where she sells children's clothes, ladies shoes, and handbags. Pamela is 37-years old and married with three children. Pamela is requesting a loan to increase her inventory and expand her business. She says thank you, and she looks forward to earning a better income for her family.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes, hand bags and shoes to expand business

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi: Chị Ân năm nay 48  tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tìnhthương từ năm 1998. Ba con của chị đã trưởng thành và đều đi làm thợ xây cùng với bố tại địa phương .Chị Ân hiện đang chăn nuôi tại nhà. Thu nhập hiện tại của gia đình chị là 4.000.000đ/ tháng.  Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 10.000.000đ để đầu tư mua trâu và sửa sang chuồng trại phụcvụ cho chăn nuôi.
texts.en:
Mrs. A., 48 years old, has participated in TYM Fund since 1998. She has three grown-up children, all of them work as construction workers with her husband in the home town. Mrs. A. raises livestock at home. Currently her family's income is VND4,000,000 per month.

In this loA. cycle, she wishes to borrow VND10,000,000 to buy buffaloes to raise and renovate the barn for livestock.

Translated from Vietnamese by Tu Duong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy buffaloes to raise and renovate the barn for livestock.

loans.name: Doljinsuren

texts.en:
Doljinsuren D. is a widow with four children. Today she lives with her youngest son in the Han-Uul district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her husband passed away last year and her three grown-up children are all married and live with their own families. The youngest son, who lives with his mother, is a taxi driver.

In 2000, Doljinsuren started selling milk from the two cows that she owned. Currently, she has four milk cows and some loyal customers. With the help of her daughter-in-law, she hopes to expand the business by increasing to ten the number of cows she owns. She has always wanted to have a successful milk business so that she can pass on her good business to her youngest son and his wife. She requests a loan to buy fodder for her cows.

loans.use: To buy fodder for her cows

loans.name: Nena

texts.en: Nena P. is of legal age, has three children, and lives in Salimpuno, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She has lived with her common-law husband for years. She started the business with her savings. She's been a member of Paglaum for almost three years now and she's on her seventh loan cycle, seeking PHP 14,900. With her previous loans, she displayed a good record of payment and has no defaults. At present, she is applying for a loan to buy additional stock such as laundry items, seasonings, goodies, toiletries and other household items. Some of the money will be used for the construction of her sari-sari store. She aims to have a successful business so her youngest child can finish her studies and have a good future.

loans.use: Sari-Sari store capital

loans.name: Natalio

texts.es:
Natalio, vive en la Calle Juan Manuel Caceres de la zona Alto San Pedro en la ciudad de La Paz.
 
Vive  en la casa propia, junto a su esposa y sus hijos los cuales se encuentran en edad escolar.
 
Se dedica al auto transporte, trabaja como chofer propietario en la linea del trufi   N. 5 el cual recorre el centro de la ciudad. 

El crédito lo destinará a la compra de  motor y realizar otras reparaciones a su movilidad.
 
Es el primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgar el crédito.
texts.en:
Natalio lives on Juan Manuel Caceres Street in the upper San Pedro area of La Paz. He lives in his own house with his wive and school-age children. He works as a self-employed taxi driver on the number 5 Trufi line which runs down the center of the city. This loan will be used for the purchase of a motor and for other repairs as well. This is his first loan with Impro, but his evaluation determined that he is a qualified candidate.

Translated from Spanish by Cyrus Maher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Automobile repair

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
La señora Yolanda T. está agradecida por su gran apoyo que le brindaron con sus anteriores créditos. 
Ella está solicitando su cooperación para esté nuevo préstamo ya que desea invertir en el negocio más variedad de mercancía como (Verduras, Frutas y Lácteos), ya que sus clientes se lo están pidiendo que venda estos productos, que es el único negocio de la colonia.
Así tendrá más ingresos a su negocio y posterior mente para la familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Yolanda T. is grateful for all the support offered with previous loans. She is requesting your cooperation for this new loan as she wants to invest in a larger variety of goods for her business (vegetables, fruits, and dairy products). Her customers are already demanding that she sell these products, and her business is the only one in the neighborhood. This will increase revenue for her business and then her family.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Hopkins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase goods.

loans.name: Hurshed

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 


Хуршед Хакимов 1984 года рождения, он  разведен и детей не имеет. Имеет среднее образование. Пять лет назад начал заниматься бизнесом откорма скота. Он с отцом и братом ездят на рынок и присматривают подходящего быка или корову. Кредит получил в первые 3 года назад. В этот раз он прикупил пару голов скота. За это время от продажи и прибыли он провел дома ремонт и сделал несколько крупных покупок. Благодаря КИВА его благосостояние улучшилось, он благодарен КИВА за поддержку.
texts.en:
Born in 1984, Hurshed H. is divorced and has no children. He has a secondary education. He became involved in the business of raising livestock five years ago. Together with his father and brother, Hurshed goes to a market to find suitable cows or bulls. He received his first loan 3 years ago and used it to purchase a couple of heads of livestock. Since then, he was able to use profits from sale of livestock to remodel his house and to make several large purchases. Thanks to Kiva, his livelihood improved. Hurshed is grateful to Kiva for the support.

MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”. “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of two cows

loans.name: Logogalu

texts.en:
Logogalu P., 41, is married with 3 children. She has experience in the bakery business. She sells to the village school and people 4 days per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 150 Tala (~ USD).

SPBD loans are Logogalu’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She will use her loan to buy a sack of flour and sugar for her business, and also for her home improvement.

loans.use: Purchase sack of flour, sugar, tank of oil, etc.

loans.name: Rahima

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Атабаевой Рахиме 45 лет . Вдова имеет пятерих детей. Занимается откормом и продажей скота. Она откармливает скот дома затем их продает. В этом ей помогают дети. Она также занимается переработкой козьей шерсти и производством шерстяной нити.  На запрашиваемый займ хочет увеличить поголовье скота.
texts.en:
Rahima A. is 45 years old. She is a widow and has five children. She is involved in feeding and selling livestock. Rahima feeds the livestock at home and then sells it. Her children help her with this business. She also processes goat fleece and makes wool yarn. Rahima wants to use this loan to increase her livestock headcount.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of small livestock

loans.name: La Peñita De La Segundita Group

texts.es:
Brígida V. V.

La señora Brígida V. de  ha iniciado la inversión en un  huerto de aguacates Haas en la pequeña población indígena llamada Donaciano Ojeda en el Estado de Michoacán. Ella ha solicitado este préstamo justamente para invertir en este huerto ya que tiene  planeado comprar otras plantas de aguacate, fertilizante orgánico para nutrir el suelo y para no dañar el  ambiente, también quiere tener dinero para pagar apoyo técnico que la asesore junto con su familia para eliminar plagas y enfermedades  de la manera mas segura y para hacer crecer de manera optima las plantas de aguacate en su huerto.  Es importante mencionar que esta región es muy prolifera en el cultivo de aguacates, ya que se obtiene fruto de muy buena calidad.  Además de esta actividad, la señora Brígida es artesana, borda servilletas y elabora artesanía de ocoshal (artesanía elaborada con fibra de pino que es recolectada en el bosque y es transformada en bellas piezas) 

La Señora Brígida esta casada con Don Vinicio el cual tiene como principal actividad económica  trabajar de cargador en la central de abastos de la Ciudad de México, esto le implica salir frecuentemente y dejar a su familia la mayor parte del tiempo. El nunca tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar y por esta razón el señor Vinicio de 32 años de edad y la señora Brígida de 30,  quieren que sus cuatro hijos estudien para que tengan mas oportunidades y en este momento lo que mas desean es tener capital para invertir en el huerto de aguacates y están seguros que ha mediano plazo esta inversión les brindará un beneficio económico. 
La Señora Brígida también tiene la esperanza de que este huerto de aguacates sea lo suficientemente rentable para que su esposo no  tenga que salir cada semana en busca de trabajo a la ciudad de México y que sus hijos puedan crecer teniendo cerca a su figura paterna
texts.en:
Brígida V. V. La señora Brígida V. has started a Haas avocado orchard in the small indigenous village called Donaciano Ojeda in the state of Michoacán. She has requested this loan for her orchard so that she can buy more avocado trees and organic fertilizer to nourish the soil and not damage the environment. Sra. Brígida will also pay for technical support to advise her family how to eliminate diseases and pests in the safest way and still provide optimal conditions for her avocado trees to grow. It is important to mention that this region is well known for its avocados, so the fruit is of the best quality. In addition to being a farmer, Sra. Brígida is a craftswoman who makes embroidered napkins and ocoshal (beautiful pieces made of woven pine fibers collected from the forest). Sra. Brígida is 30 years old and married to Don Vinicio (age 32), who works as a porter at a supply depot in Mexico City. He is away from his family most of the time because of his work. Don Vinicio never had the chance to study, so he and Sra. Brígida want their four children to explore and have more opportunities. At this time, they need the capital to invest in their avocado orchard and are confident that this will pay off financially. Sra. Brígida hopes that her avocado orchard is profitable enough so that her husband does not have to travel to Mexico City each week for work and that her children can grow up with their father around them.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for an avocado orchard

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience is 56 years old and married with six children. She sells yams and other food items. She has been in business for a long time. She is requesting a loan amount of 150000 NGN to purchase more yams to sell. She thanks all her Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more yams to sell

loans.name: Adzo

texts.fr: Cette femme est mariée à un enseignant d’une école primaire et privée de la capitale. Le couple a 02 enfants à sa charge. Les ressources financières du mari n’arrivant plus à couvrir tous les besoins financiers du foyer, cette dame a pris la décision en 2003 de vendre des produits de quincaillerie dans une boutique louée à Hédzranawoé. Cette activité lui permet désormais d’apporter sa contribution financière au foyer. Sa longue expérience du domaine fait qu’elle est à présent connue de beaucoup de clients. Elle réalise ces temps-ci de très bonnes affaires. Elle a un besoin pressant de renouveler certains articles ; c’est pourquoi elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 15 kg  cloues, 50 contre-plaqués, 25 pinceaux, plusieurs boîtes de peintures en poudre et 20 peintures huiles.
texts.en:
This woman is married to a teacher in a private primary school in the capital. The couple is raising two children. The husband's financial resources are not sufficient to support the family, so, in 2003, the lady decided to sell hardware in a rented shop in Hédzranawoé.

This business allows her to contribute to household expenses. Her long experience in this field means that she now has lots of customers. At this time, her business is going well. She urgently needs to replenish certain items, and that is why she is asking WAGES for a loan to buy 15 kg of nails, 50 pieces of plywood, 25 brushes, several tins of powdered paint, and 20 of oil paint.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of hardware items for re-sale

loans.name: Mersedita

texts.en: Mersedita M. is from the village of Barangay 4, Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 48 years old, is married, and has five school-aged children. Mersedita owns and operates a business providing beauty services like manicure and pedicure to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,800 PHP a month. In 2009, Mersedita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family’s income. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Elona

texts.en:
Elona B., 41 years old, is a rice farmer and a pig grower. She has four children that she puts all her attention to. She has been doing the very best way she can to be able to buy her family food, clothes and other basic needs for their home. 

She is requesting a loan of Php 10,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. to be able to fund her farm and buy the necessary tools to grow her harvest. The loan as well will help improve her piggery. The loan will also help her pay the laborers who helped till their farm during land preparation.

loans.use: To buy farming necessities and pig feed

loans.name: Naidan

texts.en:
Naidan G. manages a wood crafts business with the help of her husband, Davaanyam. They produce a variety of traditional Mongolian wood crafts including plates and horse-head fiddles. G. and her husband work well together – he designs and crafts the products and she decorates and paints them. The couple started their wood crafts business in 2006 after selling consumer goods for the previous 11 years. They have quickly grown a stable operation and attribute their success to the high quality of their products. Their earnings have enabled them to build a new home for their family.

G. is 29 years old and lives with her husband and two children in a house in Uvs province in western Mongolia. Her young son and daughter are both in kindergarten. G. and her husband are open-minded and hardworking people and are well respected in their community. They are very proud of their business and feel that it is important to produce these traditional crafts so that future generations stay in touch with Mongolia's history. They are requesting a 1,800,000 tugrug loan to purchase wood and supplies for their wood crafts business.

loans.use: To purchase wood and supplies for their wood crafts business

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en:
Lanie manages a carinderia (local eatery) in the village of Calao East, Santiago City. She is married to Reynaldo and they are blessed with three children who are all college graduates. She is thankful because all of her children finished their studies.

Lanie would like to ask for a loan from Kiva lenders amounting to 5,000 PHP, which will allow her to develop the carinderia she manages. Lanie dreams to expand her carinderia to encourage more customers to go to her place. She would be glad if her request is approved. This would serve as a big help to her, most especially in her business development.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Yuon

texts.en:
Yuon T., 49, is married and lives with three of his children in the Takeo province. He works as a farmer together with his wife and they typically make $1.50 every day. They are also supported by their children, who work in the garment factories and in construction. 

The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year and inflation has also forced food prices to skyrocket. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians. In light of these times of economic difficulties, Yuon T. is asking CREDIT, a Kiva partner, for a loan of $500 to purchase a motorbike for his children to commute to work. (Yuon T. is pictured with his wife at home.)

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Rose Wangui

texts.en:
Rose, 37, is a single mother. She has a son who is 18 years old and a daughter who is 16 years old. She was introduced to Kadet through an existing Kadet client. She has been operating a green grocery business for the past six years. She has no loan history with another MFI. 

With this loan, Rose plans to buy more stock to expand her business and satisfy her customers demand. Rose also sells cabbage wholesale and retail in Muranga town, located in Central Kenya. Rose also intends to start a cereal business (selling maize, beans, etc.) with the extra profits generated from the business. Her dream is to purchase a piece of land. She describes herself as a hardworking lady and respectful to people.

loans.use: To increase inventory in order to expand her business

loans.name: Nanci Paola

texts.es:
La señora Nanci tiene 27 años, esta casada y tiene 3 hijos, edades de 10 años, 2 años y 5 meses,  su esposo se dedica a la elaboración de muebles y su hija mayor esta entrando al 4to. año de primaria.   
Su comedor esta ubicado en un área urabana y tiene 2 años de tenerlo,  también se dedica a vender ropa ambulantemente,  ella va invertir el crédito en comprar chumpas y trajes de niños para su venta de ropa y también para comprar platos para su comedor.  
Tiene 3 años de trabajar en banco comunal de FAPE y este será su primer crédito con Kiva,  su sueño es tener un local para vender su ropa y ya no vender ambulantemente.  También le gustaría darle más apoyo a su esposo en el crecimiento de su venta de muebles.
texts.en:
Nanci is 27 years old, married, and has 3 children ages 10, 2 and 5 months. Her husband has a business making furniture and her oldest daughter is entering her 4th year of primary school. She has had a restaurant for 2 years that is located in an urban area. In addition she sells clothing in the streets. She will use this loan to purchase jackets and suits for children for her clothing business and to buy plates for her restaurant. She has worked with the communal bank FAPE for 3 years, and this will be her first loan with Kiva. Her dream is to have a place to sell her clothes so that she does not have to sell them in the streets. In addition, she would like to give more support to her husband and help him to grow his business selling furniture.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: capital for her restaurant and her clothing business

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita D. is a 55-year old married woman who lives in Prk Consing Brgy Daga in Cadiz City in Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating  a general (sari sari) store and running a pig fattening business.

Anita’s husband, Florencio D., is a pensioner.  They have 6 children who are between 17 and 33 years old.  Three of her children have their own familes. The three remaining children help their parents with the business as part of their daily chores, and one of them is currently going to school. 

Anita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve their family's quality of life. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase the amount of money they bring in every month, earning an average monthly income of Php 12,000 from her business activities.

Anita is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of Php 19,500 was used to fund operations of her general store.  It had a positive impact in both maintaining and growing the business, as well as improving the family’s living conditions. Now Anita is borrowing for her 14th loan, the amount of Php 22000, which she intends to use to buy supplies for both her sari sari store and the pig fattening business. Anita is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional inventory for her general store

loans.name: Mirvah

texts.en: Mirvah is a 37-year-old woman who lives in Beirut, Lebanon's capital, with her husband and their one child. For the last two years, she has made a living selling jewelry, including necklaces, earrings, bracelets, and handmade items, and her customers are largely friends and neighbors. She has applied for her first loan from Al Majmoua to buy more jewelry to sell. When she started her business, she was happy with her income, but now she would like to expand it to better support her family. In the future, she hopes to continue expanding her small company.

loans.use: To buy more jewelery to sell.

loans.name: Bintou

texts.fr: Bintou T. est 35 ans est mere de deux enfants, age 10 et 13. Elle habite a Ziguinchor, une ville dans le sud de Senegal qui attire beaucoup de tourist grace a son paysage agreable. Il y a 7 ans qu’elle est devenue une coiffeure et aujourd’hui elle partage une boutique avec 2 autre coiffeures. Avec le prêt de Kiva, elle souhaite renforcer son magasin, qui manque de produits essentiels. Avec les benefices elle peut soutenir ses enfants, un qui est a l’école, et l’autre qui prend des cours de danse.
texts.en:
Bintou T. is 35 years old and mother of two children, age 10 and 13. She lives in Ziguinchor, a town in the southern part of Senegal, which attracts a lot of tourists because of the beautiful countryside. Seven years ago she became a hairdresser and today shares a beauty salon with two other hairdressers. With the loan from Kiva, she wants to improve her salon, which is still lacking essential items. With the profits she will be able to support her children, one of whom is in school, and the other is taking dance lessons.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy hairdressing products

loans.name: Arminda

texts.en:
50-year-old Arminda doesn’t mind the heat when working at her farm. She said if she didn’t work, her family would not have something to eat. She helps her husband maintain their rice farm and both of them want to have an abundant harvest.

Arminda recently joined CEVI because, from what she heard, its programs have helped a lot of farmers in her community and it also offers a low interest rate. She is requesting Php 6,000 and, with this amount, she will be able to acquire farm inputs like fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies like fertilizer

loans.name: Mrs Sim Yim Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan is made up of ten people, all of whom live in Preaek Ksev village in Kandal province. Mrs S. Y. is the village bank president who has been selected by all the group members. Each member will use their loan for a different purpose.
Mrs S. Y. and her husband, Mr. Kang Srie, are door-to-door noodle sellers. They have a problem in their business because their house does not have enough water to use while they are making noodles. Therefore, in order to solve this problem, Mrs S. Y. has decided to seek a loan to buy a water machine to support her business. Mrs S. Y. is a mother of two children – one is a laborer and the other attends the local public school.

loans.use: To buy a water machine to support her business

loans.name: Nana

texts.en: Nana S. sells provisions in Jukwa. Nana has received a junior-high education. She is married and has a child. Nana's loan is going to serve as additional income to buy extra provisions to fill her shop and be able to provide her customers with what they need. She supports her husband in taking care of the home. She hopes to save the new profits from her business to reinvest into back into her business.

loans.use: To buy extra provisions to fill her shop

loans.name: Tièssiri Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Tièssiri comprend dix membres,  toutes mariées majoritairement dans des grandes familles traditionnelles. Elles ont moyenne 37 ans, 4 enfants et  habitent  toutes  à Farabougou, un village de la Commune Rurale de Téssérèla  (4ème Région administrative du Mali). 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, mariage, de voisinage et de leurs activités commerciales.
Ce groupe Tièssiri qui est à son premier prêt solidaire avec Soro Yiriwaso et fait l’achat et la vente des céréales tels Mariam C. qui a choisi comme créneau l’arachide.
C’est dans le souci de  diversifier et de satisfaire leurs clientèles que les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec l’institution.
Mariam compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 3 sacs d’arachide en gousse. Elle s’approvisionne à N’gassola et à Tissala. 
Selon les différentes variétés d’arachide, elle décortique le «tiga djèni » qu’elle trie avant sa vente au détail, une partie de l’arachide en gousse « tiga ba » est grillée et ou bouillie puis séchée selon les demandes des clients.  
Elle revend son  arachide à domicile, en ambulant à travers le village par ses enfants et quelques rares fois à la foire hebdomadaire de Ségou, au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’homme, de femme et d’enfant.  
Mariam espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de19.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour, rembourser son prêt, contribuer à  certaines dépenses familiales, participer aux évènements sociaux (mariages, baptêmes et funérailles), augmenter son fonds de commerce et à l’achat de quelques ustensiles de cuisine pour préparer le trousseau de mariage des jeunes filles.
texts.en:
The Tièssiri group comprises ten members, for the most part married into traditional extended families. They are on average 37 years old with four children, and all live in Farabougou, a village in the Téssérèla Rural Community (4th administrative region of Mali). They became acquainted through family ties, marriage, as neighbours and through their commercial activities. The Tièssiri group is requesting its first group loan with Soro Yiriwaso, and focuses on trading cereals, like Mariam C., who chose the peanut market niche. The group members decided to collaborate with the institution with the aim to diversify and satisfy their customers. Mariam will use her portion of the loan to buy three bags of unshelled peanuts, which she purchases in N’gassola and Tissala. The process depends on the variety of peanut: she shells and sorts the “tiga djèni” before selling them retail, whereas part of the unshelled “tiga ba” is grilled or boiled, then dried according to the customer’s requests. She resells her peanuts from her home, throughout the village with help from her children, and on rare occasions at the weekly market fair in Segou, for cash or credit, to men, women and children customers. Mariam hopes to achieve monthly earnings of 19,000 FCFA which will be used to reimburse her loan, contribute to some family expenses, participate in social festivities (weddings, baptisms, and funerals), increase her working capital, and purchase a few kitchen utensils in view of preparing the young girls’ wedding dowries.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy peanuts

loans.name: Mercedes Gricelda

texts.es:
Las señora Mercedes es madre soltera, tiene dos  hijos, Mercedes se dedica al negocio de la tecnología, tiene un local de venta de computadoras y se podría decir que su negocio se pude catalogar como una productora, ella trabaja junto a su hermano el dinero que solicita es para invertir en computadoras, y así incrementar su negocio, sabe que la inversión es muy importante, y por eso confía en que la Fundación le cederá el crédito que está solicitando.

Las computadoras las compra  en la ciudad de Guayaquil,   al mes invierte en 5 computadoras las trae por pedidos, la inversión se basa también en la demanda. 

El sueño de Mercedes es seguir  adelante con sus hijos y su familia, sabe que ellos solo cuentan con ella ha hecho de padre y madre y lo seguirá haciendo por el  amor que tiene  a sus hijos.
Sabe que la Fundación Espoir es uno de sus alicientes, tiene mucho que agradecer y lo hace trabajando y quedando bien en los créditos que ha obtenido, ahora confía en que la Fundación confié en ella.
texts.en:
Señora Mercedes is a single mother with two children. She works in technology and has a business selling computers. She works alongside her brother. The loan she is asking for is to buy computers so that the business can be expanded. Mercedes knows that investment is very important and trusts that the Foundation will give her the money. She buys five computers each month in Guayaquil, all ordered in advance by customers. The number she buys is based on demand. Mercedes’ dream is to continue helping her children and family get ahead. She knows that they only have her to rely on. She’s been their father and mother and she will continue like this because of the love she has for her children. Kiva partner, Fundación Espoir, is an incentive for her. She wants to thank them for their work and helping out with credit. Now she hopes that the Foundation will show trust in her once again.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy computers

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.es:
Rosalia, tiene 34 años, tiene un hijo y es natural de Quillabamba. Actualmente, Su actividad principal es trabajar en un restaurante como ayudante de cocina y su esposo es chofer. Ya es un año que se dedica el negocio y le va muy bien.

Rasalia es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario salir adelante, ella requiere el préstamo para comprar fruta del Valle de Ocobamba de la Convención de Quillabamba. El anhelo de la socia es comprar un terreno en la ciudad de Chilca donde quiere producir maíz y muchas cosas más.     

Rasalia pertenece al banco comunal “La Unión de Ollantaytambo” de la Asociación Arariwa. El banco comunal tiene 5 ciclos de funcionamiento, la socia manifiesta, que se encuentra contenta y satisfecha con los servicios de crédito, ahorro, capacitación y  también se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Rosalia is 34 years old, originally from Quillabamba, and has 1 son. She has been working as a kitchen assistant in a restaurant for 1 year, and the work is going well. Her husband is a chauffeur. Rosalia is a hardworking, entrepreneurial woman who is always looking for opportunities to grow everyday. She needs a loan to buy fruit from Ocobamba Valley in Quillabamba. She hopes to buy land in Chilca city where she can grow maize and many other crops. Rosalia belongs to the community bank "La Unión de Ollantaytambo” in the Arariwa Association. The bank has been in operation for 5 loan cycles. As a member, Rosalia is happy and satisfied with the loan, savings, and training services. She is also grateful for the opportunity this provides her, and thus is committed to good repayment as scheduled.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fruit.

loans.name: Sovannara

texts.en:
Mr. Sovannara R., age 47 (shown in the picture), and his wife, Mrs. Sophy Long, age 38, live in a small village outside of Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1986 and have four children: three sons and one daughter. One of them is married and lives outside the family home, two attend school and another one stays at home. Besides his children, he also has his mother living with him.      

Sovannara has been a taxi driver for ten years. He drives garment factory workers from his village to the factory and back. Mrs. Sophy Long stays at home.

Sovannara hopes to put an addition on his house. It will be better for family members to live. So, he is asking for his first loan in the amount of $500 to use for the project.

loans.use: To put an addition on his house.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie C. is from the village of  Libona, Bukidnon. She is 36 years old. Rosie is married and has 3 school-aged children. Rosie owns & operates a business where she makes and sells speciality food products. Rosie is just starting this business.

In 2010, Rosie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Rosie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase of corn, firewood, lime, water and matches.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
The kiva borrower is a 28-year-old married man living with his wife in Lebanon. He has been working as a teacher since 2005 in a private school in his town. In addition, he works as a private teacher where he receives students in his home where he has prepared a special room for this purpose. He cooperates with his wife to satisfy their needs and they are thankful for their business income. Since he is planning to further developing his home business he is requesting to borrow $600 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase a computer in order to facilitate his teaching preparation and to conduct more research to help his students.

Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e., blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, not indicating his/her name and location, etc.) Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers.

About Ameen:

Ameen s.a.l. has been a major player in the Lebanese Microfinance sector since 1999. Originally, a micro-credit program created by CHF International, Ameen evolved to become Ameen s.a.l. in 2003, a Lebanese services company. In 2007, Ameen s.a.l. registered with the Central Bank of Lebanon to become the first Lebanese financial institution specialized in Microfinance.

At Ameen s.a.l. we pledge to provide financial services to the largest number of micro and small entrepreneurs and to the working poor, to help them develop their businesses and improve their incomes.

Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loans from Kiva to offer lower interest loans with faster disbursement for their micro-loan borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high-quality financial services to over 41,000 borrowers and disbursed over 81,000 loans totaling $115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please visit http://partners.kiva.org/partners/115

loans.use: To purchase a computer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Merryssa

texts.en: Merryssa S. is a 46-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating two business ventures: a sari-sari (variety) store and a charcoal business. She lives in Purok Malipayon, San Agustin, Barangay Paraiso, Sagay City, Negros Occidental. Merryssa has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2005 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store and charcoal businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average income of PHP 6,000. Merryssa is now borrowing PHP 18,000 so that she can purchase additional stock to sell. This will be her 8th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 16,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Merryssa aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue in its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by visiting the NWTF lending team on Kiva to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Rona

texts.en:
Rona M. is 32 years old, married and has three school-aged children that she dreams will finish college someday. She is from the town of Santo Niño, a part of South Cotabato province on the Mindanao islands. Rona is a farmer who plants and harvests rice to sell.

Rona joined CEVI to gain access to its financial services. She successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI and is now requesting a new loan of 17000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use all additional revenue generated to pay school tuition fees for her children and improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Morm's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Morm K. was born in 1945 and she is the leader for this village bank loan.  She was selected by the 5 other members, who live in Boeng village in Takeo province.  The members use their portions of the loan in varied ways. 

Mrs. Morm K. and her husband, Mr. Phum Neat, are farmers who own a 1-hectare plot of land where they cultivate rice to sell to support their family. Though it is time to farm the field, Mrs. Morm K. does not have the money to support it.  To improve production, Mrs. Morm K. is seeking a loan  in order to farm this year. She is a mother of two children, one of whom is a student, while the other is a farmer.

loans.use: To farm a plot where rice is cultivated

loans.name: Yaovi

texts.fr: yaovi est un homme de 41 ans, il est marié et père de 3 enfants. il a ouvert un bar qu'il a appelé" FESTIVAL", les fêtes de fin d'année approchent et il voudrait mettre tous les atouts de son côté, il sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l'achat de 3 casiers de boissons. avec le reste du crédit il compte réparer son congélateur qui est panne. il s'approvisionne auprès de la brasserie de Lomé.
texts.en: Yaovi is a 41-year old man, married and the father of three. He has opened a bar  and named “FESTIVAL.” He would like to be fully ready for the approaching New Year festivities. He is seeking a loan from WAGES to purchase three cases of beverages. He plans to use the rest of his loan to repair his broken refrigerator. He purchases his goods from a restaurant in Lomé.

loans.use: Purchasing cases of beverages

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon M. is 46 years-old and married with four children aged between 10 and 15 years-old. His business is located at Sejeri market in Kakamega. Kakamega is the region in Kenya known for production of sugar cane and widely known as the sugar belt region. He has a shop in which he sells general items to the local people. Besides this business, Simon mills timber and farms. He has been in this business for the last three years now. He says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he has is financial constraints. 

Simon works very hard from early morning to late evening to keep his business doing well. He is using his loan of Kes 20,000 to stock general items to grow his business while meeting his customer needs. He hopes to grow his business and have a big timber yard in the future. He also hopes to give his children quality education to the university level. He describes himself as polite, honest and focussed.

loans.use: To purchase rice, sugar, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Gulbaira's Group

texts.en:
Gulbaira J., 42, is the leader of this group. She lives in the town of Toktogul, famous for having the biggest water reservoir in Kyrgyzstan. She is married and has three children. Gulbaira owns a small shop where she sells groceries, helped by her 17-year-old daughter. In the past six years, she has managed to open a shop and build a temporary building by her house. She would like to use this loan to increase the circulation of goods and add office supplies to her shop. If she succeeds, she plans to open a bigger shop. 

Microcrediting helps poor regions of the world increase entrepreneurship and have steady employment.  Microcrediting is a source of future growth, ending poverty and gaining credibility in the mainstream of the finance industry. It builds income and wealth and eliminates poverty. Microcreditors build trust and help during difficult times. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase goods for sale

loans.name: Ronda

texts.en:
Ronda, from the village of Tinacla-an, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, is 49 years old and single. She owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising pigs for sale. Ronda has been engaged in her business for over twenty-five years, earning approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Ronda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 30,000 PHP from PMPC that was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future, Ronda is now requesting a new loan of 40,000 PHP to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be her eighth loan from PMPC, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her agricultural business

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert is a twenty-eight-year-old married man blessed with two children, living in his mud wattle house in Fort Portal, Uganda, but having an aspiration of owning his own residence. He has owned a retail shop and tea plantation for six years now and these businesses have helped him to pay school fees for his children, however he longs to plant tea extensively. Robert intends to use the loan facility to buy tea seedlings for planting.

loans.use: Buying seedlings for planting

loans.name: Almohada Group

texts.es:
El grupo Almohada está conformado por tres mujeres trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras una de ellas es Nora B. quien es propietaria de una panadería desde hace un año. Ella sueña con prosperar seguir adelante con este pequeño negocio familiar por ello invertirá en harina, levadura, azúcar…etc.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son Dagne Idalgo Güenbes de 34 años se dedica al comercio de granos básicos desde hace un año y Lesbia Raquel D. vende cosméticos desde hace cuatro años.
texts.en:
The Almohada (Pillow) group is composed of three hard working, dedicated, enterprising women.  One of them is Nora B. who has owned a bakery for a year.  She dreams with progressing and getting ahead with this small family business.  Thus, she will invest in flour, yeast, sugar, etc.

The other group members are: Dagna Idalgo Güenbes, 34, who has sold basic grains for the last year and Lesbia Raquel Dávila who has sold cosmetics for the last four years.

loans.use: For raw materials, especially flour.

loans.name: Saverino

texts.en: Saverino is a 35-year-old woman, married to a driver with six children. She lives in a rented house in Kamwenge, Uganda, longing to educate her children. She has been operating a hotel for three years now and the income generated has helped her pay school fees for her children. Saverino needs credit to buy food for the hotel.

loans.use: To buy food to sell

loans.name: Nana Ama

texts.en:
Nana Ama A.  is married and has four children. Her husband sells drinks. 

She operates a food stall at Elmina. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. 

Nana's loan will be used to buy extra food items to expand her cooking business. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: To buy extra food items to expand her cooking business

loans.name: C 2169 Umucyo Group

texts.en:
Christine, 41 years old, is a widow without children. She is the representative of a group called Umucyo.  This group has two men and three women.

Christine owns a small shop which sells green bananas.  She has been in the business for three years and employs one person as a helper, so that her business runs smoothly. Her business starts at 6am and runs until 6pm every day.

Christine and her group have requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to invest in their businesses.  They hope to expand their businesses and earn more profits, so they are able to save money for their families.

loans.use: To invest in her business.

loans.name: Marvin David

texts.es: Marvin David tiene  26 años, es casado y muy responsable con sus deberes de padre, por ello vive en su casa propia en compañía de su hijo. Desde muy joven trabajó en diversos oficios, y desde hace 3 años se dedica al oficio de destace de cerdo. Es así que todos los días trabaja desde muy temprano todos los días pues tiene que buscar cerdos de buena calidad. Por ello se siente muy contento con su labor, a pesar de ciertos problemas como el transporte. Este es el primer crédito que será destinado para la compra de cerdos y otras cosas.
texts.en:
Marvin David is 26 years old, married and a very responsible father.  He lives in his own home with his son.  From a very early age he has worked in different jobs but for the last three has been buying pigs for butchery sales.  Every morning he starts work early because he has to go out and look for quality pigs.

He is very happy with his job despite the transportation problems he sometimes runs into.  This is his first loan and he plans to use it to buy pigs and other things.

loans.use: For working capital

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna A. is from the village of Banonong. She is 35 years old and married with 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Myrna operates a fish pond, raising fish, crab, and prawns. Myrna has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2006, Myrna joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Myrna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from PMPC. Myrna is now requesting a 8,000 PHP loan which will be used to purchase fries and fingerlings for her business. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Myrna from PMPC.

loans.use: To purchase fries and fingerlings for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.en:
Maria Elena P. is from the village of Nampicuan. She is 30 years old. Maria Elena is married and has one school-aged child. 

To make a living, Maria Elena sells mobile electronic and prepaid card loads in the local community. Maria Elena has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Maria Elena joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Maria Elena is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional mobile loads to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Maria Elena from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional mobile loads to sell

loans.name: Altantsetseg

texts.en:
Altantsetseg is a 42-year-old widow who lives with her daughter, aged 5, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her daughter attends kindergarten. Altantsetseg supports her family by operating a clothing retail stall at Narantuul, the largest outdoor market in Mongolia. She is a professional expert on merchandise. She worked as expert on merchandise from 1993 to 1996. 

When she first began her business, she had 1,000,000 Mongolian Tugriks (MNT) in working capital. Now she has 3,000,000 MNT in working capital. She sells jeans and trousers from Ereen, a border city of China. She is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to increase her jeans and trousers variety.

Her goal is to expand her business and then to be able to improve her daughter’s education.

loans.use: to increase her product variety.

loans.name: Boeurn

texts.en:
Boeurn S. is a 37-year-old farmer and a mother. She was blessed with four kids, all of whom are attending the public school and live under her care. Her husband, Mr. Chhuon Sok, is 40 and works in the farming business. 

Boeurn S. inherited from her grandmother the farmland where she and her husband grow different kinds of crops. As Boeurn S. lacks capital to plant her crops, she made the decision to borrow from Kiva to rent the plowing machine and buy fertilizers and seed for planting. She will use the rest of the funds to dig a well for a water system.

loans.use: to rent the plowing machine and buy fertilizers and seed for planting.

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es: Manuel Antonio de 62 años, es un hombre trabajador que inicio su negocio con pocos productos el escogió es actividad porque estaba desempleado y necesitaba generar ingresos a su hogar. En la actualidad trabaja todos los días desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde su negocio consiste en la venta de frutas y verduras.  Este crédito es para la compra de melones, sandias, bananos, naranjas, pipianes, aguacate entre otros.
texts.en: Manuel Antonio is a hardworking man of 62 who began his business with just a handful of products. He chose this line of work because he was unemployed and he needed to generate some income to cover his living costs. He works every day from 7am til 6pm selling fruit and vegetables. Manuel Antonio will use this loan to purchase melons, watermelons, bananas, oranges, squash and avocados.

loans.use: to purchase melons, watermelons, bananas, oranges, squash and avocados.

loans.name: Flor Alejandrina

texts.es:
Flor, es soltera, vive junto a su madre, se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad, este negocio tiene 10 años de existir, lo atiende de 6:00am a 7:00pm, hasta la fecha no ha tenido dificultades en sus ventas.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de arroz, frijol, aceite, boquitas, huevos, pan, y otros más que son necesarios, con este préstamo quiere fortalecer el negocio de los productos más demandados por los clientes.
Su objetivo es tener un negocio rentable, generar las ganancias suficientes para cubrir los  gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Flor is single and lives with her mother.  Her business is selling basic household products and she has been in this business for ten years.  She works from 6.00am to 7.00pm.  Up to now, she hasn't had any difficulties with her sales.

Flor is requesting a loan to buy rice, beans, oil, snacks, eggs, bread and other products that she needs.  With this loan, she would like to strengthen her business by having available the products that her customers request the most.

Flor's goal is to have a profitable business and to make enough profits to cover her household expenses.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, oil, snacks, eggs and bread

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is 59 years old, widowed and lives in Las Aguadas, Bonifacio Extension, Ozamis City, Misamis occidental, Philippines. Vivian is one of the artist who makes a dress, a dressmaker. She constructs, repairs, and revises any custom dress to earn a living. She has given her service for almost 10 years, with a monthly income of PHP 2,000.00.  Vivian is in need of capital to purchase sewing materials. She requested a loan at GDMPC of PHP 12,000.00 to buy clothing and accessories for her sewing service.

Vivian has been member of GDMPC for one and half years. In the future Vivian hopes and prays that she will be having a tailor shop.

loans.use: to buy clothing and accessories for her sewing service.

loans.name: Augustin

texts.en:
Augustin is 28 years old.  He is married and has two children between 6 months and 4 years old.  Augustin sells goats.  He started this business 12 years ago.  He works from 6 am until 6 pm every day except on the weekends.  He currently employs two people to help him.

Augustin has requested his first loan from Kiva lenders through Vision Finance Company in order to buy more goats to sell. With the profit generated, he will reinvest in his business and pay school fees for his children. 

In the photo, Augustin is in front of the others and has a cap in his hand.

loans.use: buy goats

loans.name: Basma

texts.en:
Basma, from Madaba, Jordan, is a 42 year-old married woman and a mother of four chldren.   Basma started her business of sewing clothes from home years ago.   Then she expanded her project to include the used clothes trade.

Basma is requesting a loan of 600 JD to purchase a sewing machine and more used clothes.   An aspiration of Basma is to expand her business and increase her family living standards.

loans.use: to purchase additional used clothes and a sewing machine

loans.name: Jose Renale

texts.en:
Jose Renale is single, 38 years old, and lives in Green Valley, Tinago, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. He has had an Internet cafe for five years. Each month, he earns approximately 5,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP). 

Jose Renale has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase equipment upgrades for his business. 

Jose Renale has been a member of PMPC for over a year. In the future, Jose Renale hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase equipment upgrades for his business

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita, 60 years old, is married. Her family’s main income comes from agriculture. Estelita has her own land for planting rice. She has a livestock business where she raises pigs to sell in the future.

Estelita would like to increase the number of livestock and to develop her business further. With the requested loan, she plans to purchase more pigs and feed. Increasing the number of livestock will help Estelita to get more income and to improve her family’s living conditions. Estelita lives together with her husband and three children.

loans.use: to buy feed and pigs to raise.

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Madame Fatou vit  au Sénégal. Elle est âgée de 58 ans. Elle gère  un atelier de couture  dans un marché de la localité ou elle évolue. Elle a choisi son activité par amour et aussi par nécessité dans l’objectif de se procurer des revenus qui lui permettent de subvenir a ses besoins quotidiens. Satisfaire la clientèle constitue pour elle un grand moment de bonheur. Elle est membre d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis 2003. Elle sollicite un crédit de 300 000 frs prévu pour l’achat d’une machine a coudre  qui va l’aider a renforcer son équipement et a augmenter sa rentabilité financière. Son objectif est d’accroitre ses bénéfices, réaliser ses projets futurs  et aider sa famille.
texts.en:
Madame Fatou lives in Sénégal. She is 58 and she is running a sewing workshop in a local market where she lives. She chose her business out of enthusiasm and also out of necessity in order to earn income to support herself from day to day. Satisfying her clientele is a great pleasure for her. She has been a member of one of the branches of U-IMCEC since 2003. 

She is requesting a loan of 300,000 francs to buy a sewing machine which will add to her equipment and help her increase her earning potential. Her goal is to grow her profit, do future projects, and help her family.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Lukas

texts.en:
Lukas is 29 years, married to Ann, and they are not yet blessed with children. He has been operating his transport business for the last five years, making a monthly profit of KES 30,000. This is his third loan and he plans to have his motorcycle repaired.

With the anticipated profit made he hopes to purchase another motorcycle. In the near future he hopes to own a mini bus.

loans.use: to have the motorcycle repaired.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.en:
Fernando is a responsible father whose aim is to educate all five of his children so that they will earn their degrees and become professionals. He is 47 years old and two of his children are still in college. He has been one of the Jeepney drivers in his village for almost 10 years. He earns an income of P10,000 a month. At present, they are suffering a shortage of funds due to the high cost of commodities and school fees. He is strongly determined to improve their standard of living and become more successful in the future.  

As a result, he is asking for additional capital of P9,000 to buy gasoline, tires, oil and tools needed for his Jeepney in order to provide better service. He mentioned that this loan will allow him to continue to use his Jeepney for passenger transportation. He believes that with patience and hard work, he will cover his family's needs and make his dreams come true.

loans.use: to buy gasoline, tires, oil and tools needed for his Jeepney

location.town: Brgy. Villa Coloma, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Heraclio

texts.es: Heraclio tiene 43 años, es un hombre muy trabajador y se esmera por dar lo mejor a sus 02 queridos hijos quienes son el motivo para continuar trabajando. Juntos habitan en su propia casa. La labor que realiza es labrar la tierra, pues cuenta con 3 hectáreas de terreno en donde siemnbra cacao, café, achiote y maní. Sus padres le enseñaron a remover la tierra desde muy niño y a la edad de 25 años compró su propia parcela; desde entonces viene trabajando en esta actividad. Sin embargo durante la temporada de cosecha y deshierbo de maleza necesita el apoyo de jornaleros para así acelerar sus trabajo. Se siente muy comprometido con su trabajo, porque gracias a su esfuerzo cotidiano hoy disfruta al ver que sus plantas den buenos frutos. Cuenta asimismo que durante el invierno no es de su agrado porque son épocas donde abunda mayor cantidad de precipitaciones de lluvia, estropeando los brotes de los frutos. Este será su 14avo crédito con MFP, espera ser muy puntual en sus cuotas, ya que no quiere causar problemas a la entidad financiera y agradece su anterior ayuda. Con los 3,000 soles que solicita, comprará sacos de abono y semillas de árboles como: caoba, tornillo, cedro y Pino chuncho.
texts.en:
Heraclio is 43, and a very hard-working man. He tries hard to give the best to his two dear children, who are the reason why he continues working. They live together in their own house.  He farms on three hectares of land, where he grows cacao, coffee, achiote (annatto seeds) and peanuts.

His parents taught him to till the soil from the time he was a child, and at the age of 25, he bought his own parcel of land. Since then, he has been working in this business. However, during harvest season and weeding he needs the help of day laborers in order to get the work done more quickly. 

He feels very committed to his work, because thanks to his daily efforts, he has the enjoyment of seeing his plants give good crops. He also says that the winter season isn't to his liking, because those are the times when the greatest amount of rain falls, spoiling the shoots of his crops.

This will be his 14th loan with MFP. He expects to be very punctual with his payments, since he doesn't want to cause problems for the institution, and is grateful for their previous assistance. With the 3,000 soles he is applying for, he will buy bags of fertilizer and seeds for trees such as mahogany, tornillo, cedar, and chuncho pine.

loans.use: To buy bags of fertilizer, and seeds for trees such as mahogany, cedar, tornillo, and pine.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a very hardworking lady. She has been running a food stall selling fruits for the past six years. She is a good client who learned about KADET Ltd. through marketing activity in Narok town. 

She has applied for her first loan, with which she plans to expand her business. She hopes to become a wholesale distributor in the future. She hopes to make profit from the loan and reinvest in other businesses. 

Her dreams are to see her children prosper and be stable in life.

loans.use: to expand her fruit stall.

loans.name: Hanem

texts.en:
Hanem is a 32-year-old young woman.  She is married and has one son.  Her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. 

Hanem wants to purchase new and necessary home appliances such as a stove, refrigerator, etc. but the amount of money she has isn't enough, so she needs to take a loan for $2,000 from FATEN. When Hanem gets the loan, she will be able to purchase what she needs for necessary home appliances so she can provide her family with better living conditions. 

Hanem is a conservative woman, so her husband Mohammad is photographed instead.

loans.use: buy home appliances

loans.name: San

texts.en:
San, 37, is married with 4 school aged children.

To earn a living, she has planted cassava and farmed her land for 12 years.  She also works at other plantation to gain additional income. 

This is her fourth loan with VisionFund.  San hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income to feed her family, set aside some savings for the future and her children and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to plant cassava and grow rice paddy.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Nzomo

texts.en: Nzomo is a hardworking business man aged 39. He is married and blessed with one child who is in school. He has been running a retail shop business for the last five years to support his family. He also operates a motorbike transport business to supplement his income. He has employed one person to assist him in the business. In the next 5 years, he wants to expand his business. He is requesting a loan of 30,000 Kenya shillings to buy sugar, salt and rice for resale.

loans.use: To buy sugar, salt and rice.

loans.name: Yanina

texts.es: Yanina de 36 años de edad, es madre soltera, quien tiene un hijo. Juntos habitan en su casa propia ubicado en el distrito de Sivia. Yanina es una gran mujer, que desde pequeña fue abandonada por sus padres. Actualmente se dedica al negocio de venta de bebidas en su propio local. Considera que es un negocio un poco complicado, muchas veces tiene que trasnochar cuando hay familias que vienen a celebrar su cumpleaños o algún aniversario pues ella tiene que estar al tanto atendiéndolos de la mejor manera. Ella  está contenta con el negocio que tiene ya que es la única fuente por donde capta buenos ingresos y de esta manera darle a su pequeño una buena educación, alimentación y vestido. El único inconveniente que tiene es que su local aún no esta bien amueblado por falta de capital es por esta razón que solicta un crédito a MFP. Por tanto será su segundo crédito, por lo que se compromete en cumplir puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 2,000 nuevos soles, amueblará su local.
texts.en: Yanina, 36, is a single mother of a son.  They live together in her own house located in Sivia District.  Yanina is a great woman who was abandoned by her parents as a little girl.  She currently sells beverages in her own locale.  She believes that this business is a bit complicated; she often has to stay up very late when families come to celebrate a birthday or an anniversary because she has to be there taking care of them the best way possible.  She’s happy with the business she has because it’s the only source she of good income to provide her little boy with a good education, food and clothing.  The only inconvenience she has is that her locale still is not well furnished because of lack of capital and this is why she’s asking MFP for a loan.  This will be her second loan and she commits to make her payments punctually.  She will use the 2000 new soles to furnish her locale.

loans.use: to buy furniture for her pub.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel has been in the business of rental houses for the last five years and earns a monthly profit of KES.10,000. He is 34 years old married to Truphena and they have four school going children.

He has applied for his first loan of KES.30,000 from KADET LTD. He plans to use the loan amount to buy materials for constructing more rental houses.

He plans to save the anticipated profits and buy another plot. Daniel hopes to grow his business and become the most known landlord in the future.

loans.use: to buy more materials for constructing more rental houses.

loans.name: Rasela

texts.en:
Rasela is a married woman with four children. She is 57 years old.

Rasela owns and operates a business venture selling baked goods in the local community. She has three years of experience in this business.    

Rasela needs a loan of WST 2000 to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be $167 per week) to improve and expand her business.

In 2007, Rasela joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Rasela's third loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: Margot

texts.es:
Margot nació en la provincia de Urubamba pero vive en el poblado de Rumichaca Baja. Este pueblo se localiza en el distrito de Urubamba, provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco, Perú. 

Margot tiene 30 años edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo, ella tiene diferentes tipos de actividades como son por ejemplo elaboración y distribución de artesanía, crianza de animales menores como cuyes, ella tiene un pequeño taller de elaboración de tejidos en su domicilio y donde tiene sus herramientas de trabajo,  ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar un telar que cuesta aproximadamente S/. 500.00 nuevos soles. Su sueño de la socia Margot es comprar una casa en la ciudad del Cusco. 

Margot es integrante del grupo “Los Girasoles de Rumichaca Baja” lo conforman 19 socios que viven en el poblado de Rumichaca Baja y donde realizan sus actividades económicas.
texts.en:
Margot was born in Urubamba Province but lives in the village of Rumichaca Baja. This town is located in the District and Province of Urubamba, Department of Cusco, in Peru.

She is 30 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has one child. Margot engages in different types of business activities, such as making and distributing handicrafts and raising small animals such as guinea pigs. She has a small weaving workshop in her home where she keeps the equipment for her work. Margot is taking this opportunity to request a loan to buy a loom that costs approximately 500 PEN. Her dream is to buy a house in the city of Cusco.

Margot is a member of the group “Los Girasoles de Rumichaca Baja” which consists of 19 members who live in the town of Rumichaca Baja where they engage in their business activities.

loans.use: to buy a loom.

loans.name: Thon

texts.en:
Thon, 50, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She and her husband run a business buying rice and bran to sell. Two of her children are employed; one is a staff member in World Vision Organization and another one is a staff member in Vision Fund Cambodia. 

Thon is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase piglets to raise and sell when they gain weight. By doing so, she can generate more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to run a rice mill and support her children to study until they get a Bachelor's degree.

loans.use: to purchase piglets to raise and sell when they gain weight.

loans.name: Monica Stefania

texts.es:
Mónica Stefanía tiene 20 años es casada, vive con el esposo y con los hijos en ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC NUEVO HORIZONTE, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Cachely grande, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol gandul.
