Mónica Estefanía se dedica a la Agricultura a la siembra de maíz, tiene pollos cubanos para criar. Las compras y las ventas de los productos agrícolas lo hace en ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para comprar insumos, semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, líquido para plagas, insumos y  comida para los pollos como el balanceado. Con el apoyo del crédito aumentará  el estado económico para toda la familia.

Enfrenta desafíos como las plagas  cómo la langosta, horosco y en los pollos la baba. El sueño es comprarse un terreno para seguir trabajando.

En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar el indor.
texts.en:
Mónica Stefanía, 20, is married; she lives with her husband and children in Ventanas, Los Ríos Province.

She’s a member of the “Nuevo Horizonte” (New Horizon) communal bank located in Recinto Cahely Grande that belongs to Ventanas Canton.  This communal bank is dedicated to short cycle corn, rice and pigeon pea farming.


Mónica Stefanía farms corn and also raises Cuban chickens.  Her purchases and sales of farm products take place in Ventanas.

She’s asking for the loan to buy supplies, seeds, manure, fertilizer and liquids for the infestations and nutritionally balanced chicken feed.  Support from the loan will help her improve her family’s economic status.

She faces challenges like crop infestations and poultry diseases.  Her dream is to buy land to continue working.  In her free time she enjoys playing Indor soccer.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies and animal feed.

loans.name: Artesanas Santa Catarina Group

texts.en:
In a mountainous and rocky area on the beautiful Lago Atitlán, the small town of Santa Caterina Palopó is found, a place where the indigenous Mayan language Kaqchikel is spoken and residents proudly wear colorful traditional clothing, women with beautiful ribbons in their hair and vibrant blue blouses, called hüipiles. In this lovely town, the “Artesanas Santa Caterina”, or “Santa Caterina Artisans” trust bank was formed by 8 motivated women artisans. 

Petrona, who is 45 years old and mother to 7 children, is beginning her third loan cycle with Kiva. Currently, Petrona works a large business with variety and plenitude in her products, offering customers a gallery of beautifully crafted work- squares of traditional cloth adorned with scenes of the local countryside and people of the area, quality leather handbags, traditional hats, intricately beaded items such as earrings, necklaces, bags, and rings, and clothing and fabric woven traditionally by Petrona and her employees. With high demand in for her product in and outside of the country of Guatemala, this exceptional business woman supports her community, employing 7 women artisans to weave for her. With the loan she is requesting, Petrona will buy a variety of used hüipiles to convert into wallets and bags, as well as other products she needs. 

Thanks to her profits, Petrona is providing education to her children, 3 of whom have already graduated from secondary school, 2 are still studying, and 2 are working with her in the artisanry business. 

Thanks to Kiva investors, the 8 women of “Artesanas Santa Caterina” trust bank can maintain and strengthen their businesses for the benefit of their families. These women express, “We would like to share with our friends around the world and Friendship Bridge our enormous thanks for the important work you are doing, because there is no other organization so genuinely concerned with attending to the needs of women like us”.

loans.use: buy a variety of used hüipiles to convert into wallets and bags, as well as other products she needs.

loans.name: Tsitsi

texts.en: Tsitsi is an 18 year –old entrepreneur and volunteer Camfed learner Guide, living with her parents in  Mudzi district. She is currently operating a poultry business where she keeps free range chickens and guinea fowls. Tsitsi is  requesting a Kiva loan to purchase vaccines and  feeds. With the profits she is looking forward to further her education and continue supporting the student study groups she assists with study packs.

loans.use: To purchase vaccines and  feeds

loans.name: Okidi

texts.en:
Okidi B. is an active member of Life in Africa working as a bracelet maker in the Invisible Children Bracelet project. He lives with his wife and three children in the IDP camp known as the Acholi quarter.

He, like thousands of other Acholis, was forced to flee their homes due to the war in the north. Initially at the camp, he earned what little he could at the stone quarry but he found this inadequate since he could not provide enough food, medicine or schooling for his children. Working at LiA has greatly improved his life and now he is able to provide these basics for his family. But he is a business man at heart. He owned a shop in the north and was forced to leave it but his mind still thinks in terms of business.

He has been able to negotiate a busness deal with a local secondary school to provide them with flour each term (three times per year). He will travel to the rural area to buy the flour and then return with it to the school. He will be able to make a profit of 200,000 each term. He will continue with his work at LiA since this business will only require his attention 3 times per year.

He is seeking a loan in the amount of 700,000 to make the initial puchase of flour. He will be able to repay this loan in 12 months.

Below is his budget:

15 bags of maize flour @ 30000/ = 450000/=

Transport 200000/=

Misllenoius 50000/=

Total 700000/=

The nature of his busines gives him time to proceed with his job because he has go and buy once then supplies to school direct. This means he can do it himself just those 3 times and no need for rent. According to his current income, he will be able to pay the loan in 12 installments, and will almost double the loan amount during that period. Okidi has designated the community impact portion of the interest he pays to support the Life in Africa Talent Discovery team.

loans.use: Purchase & transport of maize flour from the village to Kampala.

loans.name: Habiba

texts.en: Habiba is married with three children. She lives on the outskirts of Dar es Salaam in a place called Lumo. After finishing her primary education she was married to a commuter bus driver. Her parents could not afford to pay for further education. After being married Habiba could not stand being a housewife. She started a clothing shop with the aim of generating income for the family, as her husband’s income was not sufficient to cover all her family requirements. It is now the fifth year since she started this business. She has experienced minimal improvements during that period due to competition she faces from nearby shops also selling clothes. Habiba has discovered unique competencies, which can allow her to outperform her competitors. She wishes to have enough stock of frequently purchased clothes and be able to order new fashionable clothes which competitors can not order. These strategies need additional funding. Habiba is in need of USD 750 to implement her plans.

loans.use: to increase her stock of clothes

loans.name: Yuliya

texts.en:
Yuliya is married with an 18-year-old son. She has been a market vendor for many years and has gained rich experience in the business of selling women’s outerwear.

Yuliya has demonstrated consistency and integrity in working with “Nadiya Ukraine”. She has had no loan defaults since she took her first loan in 2003. Currently, Yuliya has about $2,000 of working capital. She re-stocks her inventory twice a month, buying from wholesalers, which helps to considerably reduce her transportation costs. Her monthly gross revenue amounts to $2,400, and her net profit is about $700.

Yuliya is requesting a loan for $800 to increase her working capital and re-supply her inventory before the spring season. She is planning to purchase an assortment of women’s clothing at wholesale prices for further retail sale. Yuliya believes that this loan will help boost her economic activity and allow her to generate more profits. It will not only help her grow her business, but will also provide better a quality of life for her and her family.

Юлія – одружена, в неї є 18-річний син. Вона торгує на ринку вже на протязі багатьох років. За цей період вона здобула багатий досвід в торгівлі жіночим верхнім одягом. В роботі з „Надією України” Юлія проявила себе як дуже послідовна та порядна людина. В неї не було жодного прострочення з того часу, як вона отримала свою першу позику в організації ще в 2003 році. Зараз в Юлії є приблизно 2000 доларів робочого капіталу. Вона робить закупки двічі на місяць на оптових базах, що допомагає їй значно знизити транспортні витрати. Її щомісячний валовий дохід складає приблизно 2400 доларів, чистий прибуток становить 700 доларів. Юлія просить про позику в 800 доларів для того, щоб збільшити власний робочий капітал та поповнити запас товарів напередодні весняного сезону. Вона планує закупити асортимент жіночого одягу за оптовими цінами для подальшої роздрібної торгівлі. Юлія вважає, що позика сприятиме економічному зростанню її бізнесу та допоможе отримати додатковий прибуток. Фінансова допомога не тільки сприятиме росту торгівлі Юлії, але й забезпечить якісно краще життя для її родини.

loans.use: To increase on stock

loans.name: Soraya

texts.es:
Business Description: Mrs. Soraya began her business 8 months ago with the money her husband was able to help her with. She sells perfumery products in different areas of her neighborhood. Her and her mother also sell clothes. Today’s demands are larger than her supplies and she cannot meet them because she cannot make the necessary investment.

Use of Loan: She wants to buy merchandise to be able to sell her products at home instead of wandering; she has a 11-month-old boy which makes it difficult to do so.

Personal Information: She is 22 years old; she is married and has an eleven-month-old child. Her house is made of cane and her goal with this loan is to increase her merchandise. In the future, she would like to set up a store in the central area of the city.

Translated to English by Patricia Yáñez, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio: La señora Soraya empezó su negocio hace 8 meses con un dinero que el esposo le pudo ayudar, la señora vende productos de perfumería en diferentes sectores de su barrio y juntamente con su mama también le ayuda a la venta de ropa, en la actualidad tiene mas pedidos pero no lo es posible suplir la necesidad de sus clientes ya que no tiene el capital necesario .

Uso del Préstamo: Ella quiere comprar mercadería para poder tener en su propia casa la venta de todos los productos que hoy vende en la calle ya que tiene un niño de 11 meses y se le dificulta sus recorridos regulares .

Información Personal: Ella tiene 22 años y es casada, tiene un niño de 11 meses, su vivienda es de caña, la meta que ella tiene es que con este crédito poder crecer su mercadería ya que en un futuro quiere instalar un bazar en una zona céntrica de la ciudad.

loans.use: Adjust her home to use as sales point for her merchandise

loans.name: Lillian

texts.en: Mrs. Lillian N. is 32 years old, and married with 3 children.  She sells ladies wear and plastic plates.  She has been a LAPO client for 2 years.  She also has two years experience in this business.  She is requesting a loan of $325 to enable her to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.use: To buy ladies wear, coolers and additional machines

loans.name: Taumainuumau

texts.en: Taumainuumau is an old lady who supports her family by running her vegetable garden. She is 60 years old and has 6 kids. She attends the market to sell her produce once a week, and she can make $200-300 per visit. She uses the money to support her family and to pay school fees for her grandchildren.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her garden

loans.name: Tem

texts.en: Mrs. Tem S. N., age 25, grows vegetables on her plot of land. She sells the produce in a market, making about US$3 a day in profit. Her husband works as a horse-cart driver, transporting goods and passengers, earning around US$2 a day. They have one child who is too young to attend school. Mrs. S. N. would like to receive a loan of US$1,000 in order to purchase more seeds and expand the production of crops to meet customer demand.

loans.use: Purchase of seeds for crop production expansion

loans.name: Aisha's Group

texts.en:
Aisha L. rears about 400 layers (hens) and wants to take a loan to build another poultry house and put barbed wire around her home. She looks after 5 children and her old parents.

Background on BRAC and BRAC Uganda

BRAC (Building Resources Across Communities) is a development organization that began operations in Bangladesh as a small-scale relief and rehabilitation project in 1972 to help the country overcome the devastation and trauma of the liberation war and focused on resettling refugees returning from India. Today, BRAC has emerged as an independent, virtually self-financed paradigm in sustainable human development. It is one of the largest Southern development organizations employing over 100,000 people, 61% of which are women, and working with the twin objectives of poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor. Diagnosing poverty in human terms and recognizing its multifaceted nature, BRAC approaches poverty alleviation with a holistic approach.

The successes of BRAC in the international development arena have stimulated a series of discussions, both with African delegations, who have visited BRAC programs, and with donors who work in Asia and Africa. Both the African countries and the donors have encouraged BRAC to join the development campaign in Africa to achieve the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) and more recently to join the campaign of “ending poverty”, which is an area where Africa represents the greatest global challenge.

In Uganda, BRAC registered as a Non Government Organization (NGO) in January 2006 to undertake programs in Education, Health, Water & Sanitation, Agriculture & Livestock and Microfinance. The Microfinance and Education are the pioneer programs launched in Uganda and, as of July 2007, had served 21,273 borrowers and enrolled 1,155 adolescents in its education program.

loans.use: To construct a poultry house

loans.name: Armando

texts.en:
Armando, a 37 year old single father, originally from the town of Saldivar who moved ten years ago to the city of Carapeguá. He has always worked to improve his condition in life and began working as an electronics traveling salesman. He is the only one in the town who has progressed quickly and now also sells clothing for all ages.

When he has made enough money from his businesses he wants to settle down, start a family, and have more children. For now however, he is focused on his son and his current business. With this loan he will invest in more clothes to sell.

loans.use: To buy inventory for his clothing business.

loans.name: Sara Melita

texts.es:
Sara Melita lives in the Juanji district in the province of Mariscal Cáceres. She sells food and drinks in her home. Most of her customers are soldiers and army officers.

She's had this business for 10 years and it has permitted her to help her husband with the household expenses. She was invited by a friend to Banco Central's "Honesty and Work" after Sara realized she needed capital to increase sales. WIth the first loan she was able to start her business with just a table and chair, and then eventually it grew little by little.

With the loan of 1800 soles, she will buy items for her business such as a bag of sugar, a bag of rice, hundreds of fruits and a motor for her refrigerator.

Sara is the 50 year old mother of three children. Two of them still live with her and the other is independent. She lives with her husband who supports her and the family. Thanks to the good sales they've been having, she's been able to fix the house and take care of her children's education. She intends to renovate her business.

Translated by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer .

La sra. Sara Melita vive en la provincia de Mariscal Cáceres distrito de Juanjui, se dedica a la venta de comida y refrigerios, su negocio esta ubicado en un espacio de su casa, sus principales clientes son militares y oficiales del ejercito quienes son los que consumen mas en su negocio.

Tiene dedicándose al negocio 10 años, el mismo que le ha permitido apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. Necesitaba contar con capital para incrementar sus ventas es así que una amiga la invita al BC “Honestidad y Trabajo” con el primer préstamo empezó a trabajar pudo ampliar poco a poco el negocio que inicio con una mesita y una silla fuera de su casa.

Con el préstamo de S/.1800.00 el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará artículos para su negocio como 01 saco de azúcar, 01 saco de arroz, frutas en cientos, un motor para su refrigeradora y otros.

La señora Sara Melita, tiene 50 años, 03 hijos de los cuales 02 están aún a su cargo y 01 ya es independiente, vive con su esposo que es el apoyo para ella y su familia, gracias a las buenas ventas que esta teniendo a podido arreglar su casa y velar por la educación de sus hijos, tiene proyectado acondicionar mejor su local de ventas.

loans.use: To buy items for her business like a bag of sugar, a bag of rice, hundreds of fruits and a motor for her refrigerator.

loans.name: Sreyloeng

texts.en:
Mrs. Sreyloeng S. and her husband, Tiv Bi, married in 2002. They have one daughter who is in primary school. The family lives about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Sreyloeng has been a garment factory worker for eight years. She works in garment factory near her village. Her husband is fully employed. He works in a mill in the village.

Mrs. Sreyloeng is requesting a loan for the second time in the amount of $1,000 to repair her house.

loans.use: To repair her house

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Mambo (Hello!) from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 40-year-old Anna G.. She is married and has two children, ages 3 and 9.

In 2006, Anna established her pharmacy. Anna requires a loan to add to her inventory of medicines. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a leading role as a pioneer of microcredit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. Because customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, the women lack tangible collateral assets, and financial institutions do not consider them to be credit-worthy. This leads to poor financial support and, as a result, limited access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. When a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys the equipment from the client, extends a loan to her, and then leases back the same equipment – a process called a "sale and leaseback" arrangement.

loans.use: To add to her inventory of medicines

loans.name: Ana Magdaly

texts.es:
Mrs. Magdaly O. is a marvelous example for many: she has shown that with great effort, one can get ahead to better provide for her home. Barely two years ago, she launched a small general store out of her home in the Condega neighborhood in the city of Esteli. Since then, she has expanded her business and improved her own economic conditions. She now sells a number of different products, including food, personal and household items.

Ceprodel has played a very important role in the development of her business. It has provided Magdaly with loans to purchase products to sell in her store. Magdaly is currently seeking such a loan in order to buy these products and sell them in her general store.

Translated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva volunteer

La señora Magdaly O. es un gran ejemplo para muchas personas debido a que apenas dos años inicio con un pequeño negocio de pulpería en su casa de habitación en el municipio de Condega de la ciudad de Estelí y hoy en día ha logrado mejorar su condición económica habiendo hecho que el negocio se expandiera por lo que ahora comercializa todo tipo de productos tales como comestibles, personales y productos de casa. De esta manera ha logrado demostrar que con muchos esfuerzos se puede llegar a mejorar la situación económica para el mantenimiento del hogar.

Ceprodel ha sido un factor muy importante para el desarrollo de su negocio por lo que le ha beneficiado con créditos que los ha invertido para la compra de los productos para el negocio. Actualmente solicita un crédito para adquirir sus productos y así comercializarlos en su negocio de pulpería en el municipio de Condega.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Subira

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 36 year-old Subira M.. She is married and has three children aged 5, 8 and 10. In 2005, Subira established her tailoring business. Working seven days a week and 5 to 8 hours a day, she earns about US $40 every month from this business. She is assisted by her two employees.

Subira requires a loan in order to purchase an additional sewing machine, as well as cloth and thread. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately US $50. In the future, Subira plans to open another business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase an additional sewing machine, as well as extra material and thread to sew a new range of clothing.

loans.name: Matilde

texts.es:
Ms. Matilde C. is 34 years of age and sells sweets for a living. She also owns a stand in the local market in which she sells chicken. This mother works for her 5 children, whom she would like to see earn a college education. Matilde gives thanks to God daily for having such wonderful children. The loan she is currently requesting will be used to increase her merchandise and obtain bigger profits to support her family.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Matilde de 34 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de golosinas y también tiene un puesto en el mercado de su localidad donde vende carne de pollo. La razón del trabajo de esta madre son sus 5 hijos y brindarles estudios universitarios, Matilde diariamente da gracias a Dios por tener unos hijos maravillosos. El préstamo que solicita es para incrementar el capital de su negocio, aumentar su mercadería y obtener mayores ganancias para el sustento de su familia.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Javier

texts.es:
Javier started his business following some financial needs when he found himself out of work. With the hlep of his mother he renovated his house to accomodate for food preparation and sales. Seeing a need to have an income they both decided to start a business on their own to cover the family expenses.

He requires a loan in the amount of $500 US that will be repaid in a term of 6 months. He will use these funds to purchase ingredients and to have more clients in his region. With your support he will be a success.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Javier incio su negocio por necesidades economicas ya que no tenia trabajo y con ayuda de su madre acondiciono en su casa la venta de comidas apoyando a su mama en la elaboracion de comidas, ya que ante la necesidad de tener un ingreso decidieron emprender un negocio por su cuenta para solventar en los gastos familiares,

El necesita un prestamo por US $500 que pagara en 6 meses para poder comprar materia prima y tener mas clientes en su colonia. Con tu apoyo el saldra delante.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients.

loans.name: El

texts.en:
Mrs. El N., 22, is a farmer in Serey Sokhom Village in the Kampong Cham Province and is the mother two children who are both too young to work or to study in school. Her husband, Mr. Khem Ros, helps his wife's business.

She owns a one hectare field which is too large for the couple to cultivate vegetables by themselves. In order to solve this problem, Mrs. El N. decided to ask for a loan to hire laborers to work in the field. Her husband is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To hire laborers to work in the field cultivating vegetables.

loans.name: Justina

texts.es: Justina tiene 43 años, vive con 3 D. sus 6 hijos y su esposo.  DesD. hace más D. 20 años, se dedica a las tareas agrícolas, nació en una familia netamente agricultora, L. cual fue una formación importante para su vida presente, cultiva L. papa, olluco, mashua, habas y tarwui; adicionalmente, cría animales; como toros y vacas, los hace engordar para luego venderlos, D. esa manera, con estas diversas tareas, sostiene a sus hijos, este trabajo, lo realiza con su esposo y 3 D. sus hijos, Justina y su familia trabajan diariamente, están acostumbrados a estas tareas y no significa para ellos, un gran esfuerzo.  Su motivo constante, es su familia, ya que desea lo mejor para ellos. Con el dinero que solicita, incrementará L. cantidad D. sus animales, comprando 2 toretes y 15 cuyes, además D. 12 sacos D. abono para sus tierras D. cultivo.
texts.en:
Justina is 43, lives with her husband and with three of her six children. For more than twenty years she has worked in agriculture activities, she was born in a farming family, where she learned important things for her present life, she grows potatoes, beans and other root vegetables; in addition she raises livestock such as cattle, which she raises and then sells, this way, with diversified activities she supports her children. Her husband and three children work with her everyday, they are used to this labour work and it doesn’t represent a huge sacrifice for them. Her main motivator is her family, because she wishes the best for them. With the loan requested, she will increase the amount of livestock she has by buying 2 bulls and 15 cuyes (guinea pig) and 12 sacks of fertilizer for the land.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase livestock and fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Madeley

texts.en:
Madeley is a member of the Despertar ("Awaken") Communal Bank. She is 33 years old and is married with four children. She runs a ceviche bar located on Bellido Street. Her restaurant specializes in ceviche, a traditional Peruvian dish made with raw fish and lemon. She has two employees, and her restaurant is open until 11pm.

Madeley needs a loan of 800 soles to buy a counter and chairs. She dreams of having her own investment capital for her business and of providing her children with a good education.

Translated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva volunteer

Madeley es socia del Banco Comunal Despertar. Madeley es casada, tiene 33 años y 4 hijos, Madeley tiene una cebichería bar en un local alquilado ubicado en el Jr. Bellido, la especialidad de su restaurante es el cebiche (plato típico peruano elaborado con pescado y limón), para lo cual cuenta con 2 personales, y por las tardes funciona el bar hasta las 11 de la noche. Madeley necesita un préstamo de 800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de mostrador y sillas. Madeley sueña con tener un capital propio y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.

loans.use: Buy a counter and chairs for ceviche restaurant

loans.name: Oreb Group

texts.en:
Felly sells seeds and also does farming. He started his business in 1999. With hard work and good management, Felly prospered in his business until 2007 when a torrential rain flooded the Tshwenge stream nearby.The flood overwhelmed his field, destroying all the crops.

Most of his business goods were also destroyed in the flood. He continued just selling seeds until January 2008, when he realized that the income from selling seeds was not sufficient to support his family. After Felly joined one of Hope’s groups named Oreb last February, he reinforced his seed business and began cultivating his field again.

With his next loan, Felly plans to open a fertilizer and pesticide store for many farmers in his area. Felly is married and has four children. In addition to his children, he also takes care of his niece.

loans.use: To open a fertilizer and pesticide store for the many farmers in his area

loans.name: Vuthy

texts.en: Mr. Vuthy K., 29, and his wife, Mrs. Sopheap Yong, 26, who live along National Road Number One about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 2005 and have one young son. They have been growing rice and green beans for ten years, a skill they learned from their parents, and in the future Vuthy wants to become a motor repairer. He is now requesting a loan of $700 to use for growing more rice and green beans.

loans.use: To grow more rice and green beans.

loans.name: Bolale

texts.en:
Bolale is 45 years old. She is a widow who cares for 6 children.

Bolale sells jewelry and cosmetics in her shop. She has been in this business for many years.

She is a client of LAPO. Bolale hopes for a loan of N80,000 to purchase more jewelry and cosmetics to sell. She says thank you to all kiva lenders and to LAPO microfinance for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more jewelry and cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Koromine Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre femmes du groupe Koromine sont toutes mariées et ont en moyenne  32 ans et  4 enfants. Tan disque les 2/4 des membres vivent dans des foyers traditionnels avec des coépouses, les autres 2/4 vivent dans les  familles traditionnelles monogames et toutes les quatre résident dans le village de Bankorona situé à 2 km de NIENA dans la sous préfecture du même nom,  dans la 3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles menent diverses  activités  qui sont entre autres l’achat - vente d’haricots, de savons et de la viande (grillée, en soupe etc).
Afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle,  elles ont décidé d’intégrer  le programme crédit de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elles sont à leur  premier prêt (prêt de groupe). 
Elles comptent acheter avec ce prêt,  plusieurs  sacs de 100 kilogrammes d’haricots, 5 cartons de savons et 3 chèvres pour avoir de la viande pour des fins de restauration. Les marchandises sont vendues au marché de NIENA et à la maison à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de 5.000 FCFA par mois dont une partie sera utilisée pour les besoins de la famille et l’autre partie  investie dans leurs activités.
texts.en:
The four women in the Koromine group are all married and average 32 years of age and 4 children. Two of them live in traditional households with co-spouses, whereas the other two live in monogamous traditional families. They all live in the village of Bankorona, located 2 kilometers from Niema, in the subprefecture of the same name, in the third administrative region of Mali. They run diverse businesses, such as, among others : buying and reselling beans, soaps, and meat (grilled, as soup, etc).

To meet customer demand, they decided to join the loan program of the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, a Kiva's partner, from which they are seeking their first group loan. They intend to use it to buy several 100-kg sacks of beans, 5 boxes of soaps, and 3 goats to have obtain meat for restoration. The goods are sold at the Niena market, and at home, to a clientele comprising men and women. They foresee turning an average monthly profit of XOF 5'000 (ca US$ 10) each, to be in part used to provide for their families, and in part invested in their businesses.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell various items (beans, soap, meet, ...)

loans.name: Fati

texts.en:
Fati M. is a 26-year-old local restaurant operator currently living with her parent. She is single and has one child who is in school. Fati has been in food provision for over ten years now. She understands customer ethics and focuses on quality and excellent service.

She prepares and sells local foods like fufu, banku, and other local dishes. Fufu is prepared from pounded cassava and plantain, taken with all kinds of soup. Banku is prepared from milled maize grains and it is taken with hot pepper or soup. With her tasty meals, Fati has attracted lots of local customers. It has therefore become necessary to employ assistants to help her with food delivery.

Fati tells us that prices of raw materials have gone up significantly and she needs the support of a loan to enable her meet her production expenditure. With the loan, she wants to purchase more raw materials like bags of maize, baskets of cassava, plantain, meat, fish, vegetables, and firewood to prepare her meals. She is grateful for this assistance. She also hopes to receive GH¢ 600 to expand her business by restocking her inventory.

Fati belongs to a village bank called Jordan.

loans.use: To buy raw materials like maize, cassava, plantain, meat, fish, vegetables, and firewood.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy sells provision and drinks to people living in her community. She is 31 years old and single. Joy lives in Delta State, Nigeria and has been in this business for years.

Joy needs a loan amount of N120,000 to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell. She has been a LAPO client for eight years. She says thanks to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: Purchase more provision and drinks to sell.

loans.name: Percita

texts.en:
Mrs. Percita S. is 39 years old and married. She lives at San Isidro, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She has 5 children. After she heard news about Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative, she got interested in it; that’s why she joined the co-op in October 2008.

She has staredt a retail clothing business. She is appying for a PHP 10,000 loan to buy additional ready-made clothing. She’s happy that she can implement her project because the cooperative will finance her. She hopes her business will be more profitable, and that she will see all her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy additional retail wear  for sale

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Marina es socia del Banco Comunal Villa Huatatas.
Marina es casada, tiene 40 años y 3 hijos, Marina vende leña en su casa, actividad que realiza con ayuda de sus hijos, además Marina vende comida de manera ambulatoria en un paradero de trasporte publico.
Marina necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de leña.
Los sueños de Marina son que sus hijos sean profesionales y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Marina is a partner in the Villa Huatatas community bank. She is 40 years old and married, with three children. Marina sells firewood from her home, with the help of her children. She also sells food in a public transportation hub. Marina needs a loan of 900 soles, which she'll invest in wood. She dreams of her children becoming professionals and of improving her business.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Marina needs a loan of 900 soles, which she'll invest in firewood.

loans.name: Joserecto

texts.en:
"I was just renting a farm before. Because of hard work and blessings from God, I finally own the land that I till," says Mr. Joserecto P., a 49-year-old father of four children. "I started tilling a 1-1/4 hectare farm. And from my harvest I was able to pay the school fees as well as the books for my children," he said. 

He would like to ask for a loan from CEVI. He will use the loan to purchase hybrid seeds, herbicides, fertilizers and insecticides. The loan will truly help him improve his harvest. 

Through CEVI, Mr. P. was able to sustain his farm. He continues to avail loans from CEVI and receive training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase hybrid seeds, herbicides, mouluscide, fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a widow with four children to look after, all of whom are still in school. Facing difficulties to meet the needs of her children, she decided to join GHAPE and took her first loan of 20,000 CFA ($40) in 2006. She has proven her credibility by receiving and successfully repaying loans totaling $240. With her new loan, she intends to buy ten bags of animal feed for the pigs she raises. She presently has three pigs which she bought with her second loan but is now finding difficulties feeding them. Pigs are a valuable commodity in her community and if these pigs grow up to maturity, she will sell them for a very good price, ranging from 80,000-100,000+ CFA. About GHAPE The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profit and loss, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.

loans.use: To buy pig feed

loans.name: Mireta

texts.en:
Mireta F., 41, is married with four children. She has many years of experience in her plantation business. She sells to the public and villagers two days per week and expects her weekly net cash flow to be 410 Tala (~170 USD). She has one previous loan with SPBD.

SPBD loans are Mireta’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She is so happy the way her family is improving now, just because of the help she got from the SPBD program.

loans.use: To buy sacks of fertilizers, farming equipment and chemicals for her plantation

loans.name: Mahmudova

texts.ru: Махфират Махмудова  1963 года рождения, замужем имеет  2 детей. Имеет среднее образование. Торгует на рынке детской , мужской и женской одеждой. Торгует на рынке более 15 лет. С нашей организацией сотрудничает более 5 лет. Предыдущий кредит получила для торговли летней одежды.  По ее словам в основном покупатели женщины. Они покупают женскую одежду, а также для своих малышей. Ей необходимо  закупить товар на осений и школьный сезон.
texts.en:
M. Mahmudova was born in 1963, she is married and has two children. She has secondary education. She sells children's, men's and women's clothing on the market. She has been selling for more than fifteen years. She has been working with our organization for more than five years. Her previous loan she received for selling of summer clothing. Mahrifat says that her main customers are women. They buy women's clothing and also for their babies. She needs to buy the merchandise for the fall and school season.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fall and school merchandise

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn B. is from the village of Militar, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 32 years old. Marlyn is single and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Marlyn owns and operates a business venture in the food sector running a bakery. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from baking and selling bread to the local community. Marlyn has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Marlyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marlyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase baking equipment. Marlyn is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional cooking ingredients. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Marlyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business and for her daily needs. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional cooking ingredients for her bakery

loans.name: Félix

texts.es: Félix G. S. reside en Sata Tecla municipio del departamento de  La Libertad. Félix tiene 51 años de edad, vive con su madre y su hermano, Félix posee un negocio en su casa es una tienda de consumo diario. Félix está solicitando un crédito para mejoras de su vivienda, como la colocación de puertas, instalación  de balcones para las ventanas exteriores, con este crédito Félix podrá brindarle seguridad a su familia y  cambios significativos en su hogar, que por razones económicas siempre los estaba dejando de realizar.
texts.en:
Félix G. S. lives in the town of Santa Tecla in the district of La Libertad. He is 51 years old and lives with his mother and brother. Félix operates a business out of his home selling daily consumer products.

He is requesting a home improvement loan in order to install doors and balconies to the exterior windows. These modifications will provide security for his family. He has been delaying these improvements because of a lack of financial resources.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Installation of doors & balconies

loans.name: Badegna Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Badegna constitué de  5 femmes mariées ayant en  moyenne  32 ans, 2 enfants,  vivent la plupart dans des  familles monogames à Médine un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur sixième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dont le but  est de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Elles mènent diverses  activités  qui sont entre autres la vente de  fruits et légumes.  
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, 20 chargements de charrette en fruits et 15 chargements de charrette en légumes.  
Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de Sikasso ville et dans  les  villages environnants. Les marchandises sont vendues aux marchés, de façon ambulante dans les quartiers, dans la famille ou sur commande à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes et la plupart au comptant.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 23.000 FCFA dont une partie sera investie dans les activités et l’autre partie en épargne.
texts.en:
The Badegna group is made up of 5 married women, with an average age of 32 and on average, 2 children. They mostly live in monogamous families in Médine, one of the neighborhoods of the town of Sikasso, 3rd administrative region of Mali. They are on their 6th loan, working together with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution, with the intention of satisfying their customers’ needs.

They have various businesses, among others selling fruit and vegetables. With this new loan, they intend to buy 20 wagonloads of fruit and 15 wagonloads of vegetables. They do their buying in the big market of Sikasso town and in surrounding villages. The goods are sold in the markets, out of their homes, walking around the neighborhoods or to order, to a clientele composed of men and women, and mostly for cash.

They each expect to make an average monthly profit of 23,000 F CFA, of which a part will be invested back into their businesses and the rest for savings.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of fruit and  vegetables for resale

loans.name: Gorgonia

texts.en:
This is Gorgonia S., who is 57 years old.  She lives in Silang, Cavite, and has six children, one of whom is in college.  The rest of her children live at home.  She is married to a preacher.  

Gorgonia owns a general store situated in front of their house.  It has been in operation for eight years now.  She laments that competition within is stiff considering that three other stores are located in her immediate area.  But she is thankful that customers are still loyal to her because her store sells more items than others.  Thanks to the loans provided by the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative, her store grew steadily.  

She is now on her 4th loan cycle.  She will use the funds to buy more items to sell at her store like charcoal (for fuel), and rice.

Gorgonia hopes to see her children finish their college education.



About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice.  This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context.  It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.  

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell like charcoal and rice

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty L. is from the village of Panay Daku Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 52 years old and married with four grown children. To make a living, Betty owns and operates a business planting and harvesting coconuts to sell. Betty has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately $225 a month for these activities.

In 2004, Betty joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Betty has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from GDMPC. Betty is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This will be her seventh loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her sales to expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita has been married to her husband Jonie for almost 20 years now. She has two kids with him. The eldest is 19 years old. She is a rice farmer and does her very best to keep her crops healthy and growing. She thanks God for bringing CEVI into her town and sees it as an answered prayer. 

She is now requesting a loan of PHP 12,000, which she will use to buy fertilizer and other inputs her farm needs.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and other farm inputs

loans.name: Aun

texts.en: Mrs. Aun N. lives in Damnak Rovieng village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who has a 0.5 hectare field to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Duong Chhum, is a construction worker. Since his workplace is far from house, Mrs. Aun N. decided to ask for a loan to buy a motorbike for her husband to travel to work in order to reduce expenses. Mrs. Aun N. has three children who are all attending the local school. Her husband is shown in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband to travel to work

loans.name: Ana Deysi

texts.es: Ana Deysi S. D. A. D. 28 años D. edad, resiD. en Sensuntepeque en el departamento D. Cabañas, vive junto a su esposo, su madre y tres hijos menores D. seis años D. edad. Ella posee una tienda en la cual comercializa productos perecederos y así mismo posee un ciber café. Ana solícita un préstamo ya que desea poder surtir su tienda con muchos más productos, ya que esta está ubicada en las cercanías del hospital general D. Sensuntepeque y así mismo desea comprar equipo nuevo para el ciber café debido a que también hay una escuela ubicada cerca del lugar.
texts.en:
Ana Deysi S. D. A. is 28 years old and lives in Sensuntepeque in the department of Cabañas. She lives with her husband, her mother, and her three children, all of whom are under the age of six. She has a shop where she sells perishable products and also runs a cyber café. Ana applied for the loan because she wants to offer more products at her store because it is located near the general hospital of Sensuntepeque a high traffic area. She also wants to buy new computers for the cyber café because there is also a nearby school.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of perishable projects

loans.name: Alayo

texts.en:
Alayo F. is currently in the business of selling groundnut paste and beans, and is requesting a loan to purchase more bags of groundnuts to make more paste to sell.

Alayo is 21 years old and married; her husband is a baker. She has 2 children and her children do not go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a wholesale shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of groundnuts to make more paste to sell.

loans.name: Nyame Akwan Group

texts.en:
Stephen is a petty trader and trades in agro-chemicals. He purchases agro-chemicals such as fertilizers and weedicides from wholesalers in the cities, and he sells these in retail to farmers in his town. From this business, he supports his family and finances all of his children's educations.

He is the leader of a village trust bank group called “Nyame Akwan” (God’s Way). The group's members are all traders and food vendors who support their families through their businesses. They want to use the loan to purchase stock in bulk to avoid costly price hikes and also to cut down on frequent travels. They are expecting to make higher profits this season, which will allow them to support their families and pay their kids' school fees. Your support through this loan would enable them to grow their businesses.

Stephen is 45 years old. He is married and the father of four children who are currently pursuing education in senior, junior, and primary schools. He lives with his family in their own house in a farming community.

loans.use: To purchase stock in bulk

loans.name: Eseese

texts.en:
Eseese V. is 32 and married with 5 children (ages 2 - 14 years).  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting bananas for sale.  Eseese has 7 years of experience in this business.  Eseese needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 221 tala or US $92 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Eseese joined SPBD.    This is her 1st loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Eseese's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Eseese V. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                2 out of 3
Level of Education:                              2 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         2 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              2 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en: Annabelle G. owns and operates a sari-sari (variety retail shop) selling food and daily use products in her community. She is 38 years old, married and has two school-age children. They are from El Salvador City. Annabelle has been in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 50,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2009, Annabelle joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI which was used to to purchase products to sell. Annabelle is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her third loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Igor

texts.en: Igor Turanskiy is married with two children. He owns a small business selling various small home products - electrical, kitchen, cleaning, etc. He decided not to rent a booth at the market. Rather he goes out to neighboring small towns using his van and offers his inventory to people who live there. He has been in this business for 4 years and has gained many repeat clients. The inventory Igor offers is in high demand. His business is quite successful. Igor would like to receive a loan of 17,000 UAH to purchase more inventory and develop his business further.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Melvin

texts.en: Melvin is a 28-year-old rice farmer from the province of Agusan del Sur. He is married and has a 3-year-old child. He spends his time at the farm to make sure it is healthy for growing rice crops. He was also able to start food processing, which he hopes to expand. His wife manages the food processing, and it gives them an extra source of income. Melvin is seeking a loan of 6000 PHP. He will use it to supply his farm with seeds, fertilizer, and other needed supplies.

loans.use: To supply his farm with seeds, fertilizer, and other needed supplies

loans.name: Mr. Chorn Chel Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank is made up of fourteen people who are villagers in Kampong Svay Leu village in Kandal province. Mr. C. C. is the village bank president who has been selected by all the members. They will each use their loan for different purposes. He is a tobacco seller door-to-door and his wife, Mrs. Lai Heng Lort, is a brown 'sapote' (fruit) seller and besides this, she is a pig breeder as well. 

However hard they try to work with their businesses, they can earn only a little income because they do not have enough money to support their piglets. Thus, in order to improve their family's living conditions, Mr. C. C. decided to seek a loan to buy pig feed for breeding pigs. He is a father of four children who are attending local public school.

loans.use: To buy pig feed for breeding pigs

loans.name: Martina

texts.es:
Martina tiene 45 años de edad, enviudó recientemente y actualmente vive junto a sus tres hijos, de los cuales dos son menores de edad, en su vivienda ubicada en el distrito de Santa Rosa, un distrito cuya economía depende básicamente de la pesca. La zona se encuentra ubicada a 25 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

A raíz de la enfermedad que tuvo su esposo, tuvo que empezar a trabajar hace tres años en el comercio de pescado fresco en el terminal pesquero de la región; ella compra el pescado a las cámaras que llegan al lugar y luego lo vende a los comerciantes que llegan a adquirir el producto para comercializarlo en los principales mercados de la región, esta actividad solo se puede realizar durante las primeras horas de la mañana. Este negocio le ha brindado bastante apoyo durante este tiempo y gracias a el ahora puede responder por su familia.

Martina desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más pescado, ya que durante estos dias en que se avecina la semana santa, el consumo de pescado es masivo. Por este motivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 800 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Martina es una mujer bastante trabajadora y que actualmente lucha por sacar adelante a su familia, ella no se deja amilanar por la situación que se encuentra pasando actualmente. Sus vecinos y conocidos la admiran mucho por su determinación, en la fotografía nos muestra las cubetas en la que comercializa su producto.
texts.en:
Martina is 45 years old, she became a widow recently, and she lives with her three children (two of them are minors). Her house is located in the district of Santa Rosa, a district with an economy mainly supported by fishing. This area is located 25 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. Due to her husband’s illness, she started working three years ago in the fresh fish business at the regional fishing terminal; she buys the fish from the boats that arrive at the terminal and then she sells it to the merchants that go to the terminal to buy the fish and then resell it at the main regional markets. This activity can only be done in the early hours of the morning. This business has provided her with a lot of support in these times and thanks to the business she can provide for her family. Martina wishes to expand her business to buy more fish, since Easter is near and fish consumption is massive during this time. For this reason, she is requesting her first loan from Edpyme Alternative for 800 Nuevos Soles that will help her reach her objective. Martina is a hard-working woman and she is fighting to get ahead in life with her family; she does not allow herself to be scared of her current situation. Her neighbors and acquaintances admire her for her determination. In the picture, she show us the containers she uses to sell her product.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fresh fish to expand her business

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert N. is 47 years old and is married to Mary Akinyi, a business lady. 

Robert is a food vendor in the Kongowea market of Mombasa and has been in this business for past three years. He mainly sells sausages and samosas to customers within and outside of the market and is able to get a profit of between Kshs 15,000 to Kshs 20,000 every month.

Robert was introduced to KADET by a client in the group he is in and hopes to borrow subsequent loans from KADET in future. This marks Robert's first borrowing from KADET and with this money, he plans to purchase a refrigerator and raw sausages. 

Robert hopes to become a distributor of raw sausages and sell them to retailers.

loans.use: To purchase a refrigerator and raw sausages

loans.name: Ida Minday

texts.es: Ida tiene 32 años de edad es soltera vive en la casa de su madre , casa de dos pisos de material noble  ubicado en el Distrito de la Tinguiña, ella se dedica a  la venta de adornos de casa como recorredora, y  trabaja como azafata de la empresa Soyus.Ida es una persona  joven que cuenta con metas y objetivos uno de ellos es poder tener su propio negocio, con el dinero que solicita invertira en la compra de mas adornos para la venta por el dia de la madre.
texts.en:
Ida, age 32, is single and lives in her mother’s house. It is a two story house made from solid material, and it is located in the Tinguiña district. She sells home decorations by going door to door. She works as a stewardess for the Soyus Company. Ida is a young person who has goals and objectives. One of those is to be able to have her own business. She will use the requested money to buy more decoration to sell for Mother’s Day.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more decoracions

loans.name: Efren Ignacio

texts.es:
Efren de 48 años, vive en una zona urbana en el Guasmo de Guayaquil, tiene tres hijos de 16, 14 y 12 años, Efren hace cuatro años era costurero pero los ingresos que tenia no eran suficiente para los gastos familiares, por la desesperación invirtió sus ahorros en en papelería y en unas vitrinas para vender a sus vecinos, poco a poco empezó a vender papelería. 

Ahora el tiene un local con papelería, su esposa Vicenta y sus hijos en ocasiones le ayuda, vende cuadernos a $ 1.00, plumas a $ 0.30, pañales a $ 30.00 el paquete. La papelería que tiene se la quiere dejar a sus hijos cuando crezcan, para que tengan asegurada su dinero. Con el préstamo quiere comprar cuadernos, pañales para su negocio.
texts.en:
Efren is 48 years old and lives in the urban area of Guasmo in Guayaquil. He has three children (ages 16, 14, and 12). Four years ago, Efren worked as a tailor but his income was not enough to cover his family’s expenses. Out of desperation, he invested his savings in stationery and a few display cases and gradually began selling to his neighbors.

Efren now has a store where he sells stationery. His wife Vicenta and their children help occasionally. He sells notebooks for $1.00, pens for $0.30, and diapers for $30.00 per package. Efren wants to leave the store to his children when they become adults so that they can have a secure income. With this loan, he will buy notebooks and diapers for his business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase notebooks and diapers

loans.name: Nurullo

texts.ru: Ниёзмадов Нурулло проживает в районе Хамадони. Возраст, 43 года. Женат, имеет 5 детей. Жена, работает в районной больнице медсестрой. Сам Нурулло имеет высшее образование. Был военнослужащим. Сейчас он занимается торговлей. У него продуктовый магазин. Этим видом бизнеса занимается 2 года. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота. Нурулло хочет расширить свой бизнес.
texts.en:
Nurullo N. lives in the Hamadoni region. He is 43 years old, married and has 5 children. His wife works as a nurse in the regional hospital. Nurullo himself has a higher education and has served in the army. Now he works in retail - he owns a grocery store. He has been engaged in this type of business for two years. He is applying for credit to increase sales volume. Nurullo would like to expand his business.

Translated from Russian by Irina Chakraborty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: increase business turnover

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is married to a taxi driver. They have five children, all of whom go to school. She also takes care of additional family members.  She rents and resides in a two-room house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent, food and school fees.

Formerly Sarah was dealing in charcoal, but changed her business to mobile phone accessories a few months ago.  She wants to use this loan to buy more mobile phone accessories like Sim packs, Airtime, chargers, and pay phones. She rents her business premises for 45,000 UGX per month. She works seven days a week and her customers are the people who live near her shop. Sarah‘s business challenges include thieves and defaulters. 

Sarah is hoping to build her own house and to own a fully stocked mobile phone shop.  She joined MCDT because they offer group co-guarantor-ships.

loans.use: To buy more mobile phone accessories to sell

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es: Jorge, tiene 65 años, es un hombre que siempre ha luchado por sobresalir en la vida, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Francisca de 55 años y su última hija María de 11 años, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. En el poblado de Cumutay, Provincia del distrito de Tarma, se encuentran las chacras de Jorge, sus tierras son amplias y con los cuidados que les brinda la ha convertido en uno de los cultivos mejores trabajados del poblado, es por eso que cuando lleva a vender papa y alverja al mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma, obtiene muy buenos precios debido a la buena calidad de sus productos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras y hacerlas fértiles, lleva 50 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de la plaga que afectan su desarrollo. Con el tiempo, desea comprar más tierras en otros poblados para así aumentar su producción y variar sus cultivos. Este es el séptimo crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar puntualmente, si quiere acceder a otro crédito en el futuro. En su grupo comunal es un socio muy responsable y siempre esta pendiente de los acuerdos a los que llegan en el grupo. Con los tres mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono para mejorar la productividad de sus chacras.
texts.en:
Jorge is 65 years old, and a man who has always fought hard to overcome life’s obstacles. He lives in his own home with his wife Francisca, who is 55, and his youngest daughter María, who is 11 years old. They are the reason for all of his daily efforts to succeed. Jorge’s farmlands can be found in the town of Cumutay, located in the district of Tarma. He has ample acreage and, given the care with which he tends to his soil, he has converted his farm into one of the best producing enterprises in town. Because of the excellent quality of his produce, he obtains very good prices when he sells his potatoes and peas at the wholesale market in Tarma. The aspects he enjoys most about his work are planting his crops and endeavoring to make the soil fertile. He has been a farmer for 50 years, and finds the most challenging aspect of his profession to be protecting his crops against plagues that affect his plants’ growth. Over time, he hopes to buy farmland in other towns in order to increase his output and diversify the types of crops he grows. This is his seventh loan with MFP, and he knows he must make his payments on time if he wants access to credit in the future. He is a very responsible member of his cooperative, and is always cognizant of the obligations his group enters into. He will use the three thousand Peruvian soles requested to buy more fertilizers, to increase the productivity of his lands.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Nimia

texts.es:
Nimia tiene 57 años de edad, quien posee una despensa y tambien  se dedica a la venta de comestible, posee un puesto fijo en la cuidad de Sapucai.
Empezó con el negocio hace 28 años, cuenta con clientela formada es una de las despensas mas surtidas de la zona, pues no se encuentra dentro del casco urbano el negocio esta ubicado a 8 km de la cuidad  de Sapucai. Además tiene ventas de comestible, por la construción de la ruta asfáltica que une las cuidades de Paraguarí con Villarrica tiene mayor demandas de sus productos.
Es una señora  muy sacrificada, pues su horario laboral empieza a muy temprana horas de la mañana con la ayuda de su hermana, siendo que ella no tiene hijos.
Necesita el crédito para la compra de mercaderias, articulos de limpieza, mercería, librería, enlatados, empaquetados, para venta minorista, pues tiene mucha demanda por lo mencionado mas arriba.
texts.en:
Nimia, 57, has a grocery store and also sells food; she has a fixed sales booth in the city of Sapucai. She started the business 28 years ago and has a regular customer base. Her store is one of the better stocked ones in the area because it’s not located within the city limits but rather is 8 kilometers from the city of Sapucai. In addition, she sells food. Because of paved road construction work between Paraguari and Villarrica, she has increased demand for her products. She is a very devoted person because her work schedule starts very early in the morning. Her sister helps her because she doesn’t have any children. She needs funds to buy merchandise, cleaning supplies, miscellany, stationery items, canned goods, packaged goods to retail because she has a lot of demand due to what was mentioned above.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “DINAMICO”; El socio vive en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia  y  departamento de Cusco.
	
El socio es la Sr. Wilson; El socio tiene 32 años de edad y él socio es conviviente, el tiene 1 hijo y el socio trabaja en diferentes agencias de viajes, El socio es guía de turismo. El socio trabaja desde hace 6 años como guía, el va por las rutas de aventura como camino inka, river rafting, mountain bike, El estuvo los primeros meses muy preocupados como otros guías, por el problema de las inundaciones que azotó a la ciudad del Cusco estuvieron sin trabajo y esto ocasionó que el socio alquile un local en el centro de la ciudad y ponga masajes terapéuticos, y con este nuevo negocio propio se está ayudando muy bien ahora que todo se está normalizando en la ciudad.  El socio solicita el préstamo para pagar los alquileres de su local.

El socio valora y agradece el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer y tener una mejor calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member, Wilson, belongs to the "DINAMICO" communal bank. He lives in the Huanchac district, in the province and department of Cusco. He is 32 years old, lives in a common-law marriage and has 1 child. He works for different travel agencies as tour guide. He has been working as a guide for 6 years on such adventure routes as the Inca trail, river rafting and mountain biking. Like other guides, he was very worried at the beginning of the year about the flooding that struck the city of Cusco. Being without work led him to rent a storefront in the city center and start a massage therapy business. The business is going very well now that the city is returning to normal. He is requesting a loan to pay for the rental of his store´s premises. He values and appreciates the loan, since it will enable him to grow and to have a better standard of living. He is also committed to meeting his payment obligations on time.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for rental of store premises.

loans.name: Ma. Susan

texts.en:
Ma. Susan S. is from the village of San Juan. She is 48 years old. Susan is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Susan owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community.  Susan has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 6200 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Susan joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ma. Susan has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Susan is requesting a new loan of 25000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 9th loan taken out by  Susan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Alimaa

texts.en:
Alimaa J. is 59 years old and lives with her family in a ger- a traditional Mongolian nomadic dwelling- in Huvsgul province, Mongolia. She is married to Dorjjav, who helps in her business, and she has a 18 year old son. Her son, Damdindorj, currently studies at a Mongolian National University. Alimaa operates a vegetable growing business in town. She started to plant a variety of vegetables on her own 0.5 hectare field in 2000. Her farming business experienced tragedy when she lost all her harvest in a flood. Today she has gained significant experience as a farmer. She also makes and sells a variety of handicraft items for foreigners, to supplement her earnings selling vegetables. 

She is a hard-working and very energetic person. She has used her earnings to pay her children's tuition fees as well as to improve her family's quality of life. Alimaa is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT. The loan she is requesting will be used to reap a harvest and to purchase more supplies and materials for her handicraft business.

loans.use: To harvest vegetables and purchase handicraft supplies

loans.name: Justus Musyoka

texts.en:
Justus is married to Agnes and they still do have children.

Justus was introduced to KADET LTD  by existing customers, and is servicing his second loan in KADET LTD. He has no history with any other MFI, he plans to use the loan to buy electrical wires and also modern equipment for operation.

He operates his business in a busy market, where he reaches his customers with ease. With the extra profits, he desires to expand his business and to buy household items.

Justus hopes and dreams are to be an electrical consultant. Justus describes himself as hardworking.

loans.use: The loan will be used to buy electrical wires.

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.en:
Maria is 26 years old and has no children. She lives in the Sialupe Baca neighborhood of Lambayeque, a zone that exhibits a high level of commercialization of agricultural products and animal raising.

Maria runs a small storefront out of her home where she sells goods to meet basic needs, such as soap, toilet paper, crackers, rice, beans, flour, and beverages. She has managed the store for over three years now and has a good presence in the community, given her high level of service and quality products.

This will be Maria’s first loan with our institution. She has good references and a good credit history. She plans to use the loan to purchase additional merchandise at bulk prices in order to realize greater profits and to expand her product offerings.

loans.use: to purchase additional merchandise at bulk prices

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa M. is from the village of Amoyong, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 30 years old. Rosa is married and has two infant-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods and junk foods in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $250 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rosa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell and as working capital. 

Rosa is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which again will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be her 2nd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Antony

texts.en:
Antony N., aged 32, operates a grocery and a general shop at Umoja market. He is married to Jackline Minoo and together they have two sons aged ten and two years who are in Class 4 and Baby Class. 

Antony was introduced to KADET by existing KADET clients. Antony has operated his general shop for three years, which gives him a monthly profit of around Kshs 19000. The grocery gives him Kshs 2000 per month.

Umoja is a well-populated area, and Antony’s business does well. With the loan he intends to open another shop and employ someone to run it. If the loan helps to boost business, Antony plans to open a salon for his wife.

In future Antony wants to be a prominent businessman with many shops and to give his children a quality education. He describes himself as honest and hardworking.

loans.use: To open another shop in Umoja

loans.name: Oyunbat

texts.en:
Oyunbat N. is 44 years old and lives with her husband and two daughters in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent, in Uvurhangai province in central Mongolia. Both of her daughters are university students, while her husband operates a transportation service to support their family. 

Oyunbat operates a small grocery store in her town. She sells a variety food and consumer products at her grocery store. She started her grocery business in 2000,  and has since been successful enough to expand her food retail business into a grocery shop. After many years of owning this business, she has built a stable and successful operation. Her shop is located in a popular spot in her area, which attracts many customers. Her business' earnings have created financial stability for her family.
