Oyunbat is a very hardworking businesswoman and is known for her good character. She says, "All I want is to enlarge my business and establish my own comfortable supermarket in the future"  She is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase grocery products to sell at her shop.

loans.use: To purchase grocery products for resale

loans.name: Irene

texts.en: Irene is a thirty-eight-year-old woman, married with six children, living in her own house in Fort Portal, Uganda, longing to have a permanent house for a residence as they are currently in a semi-permanent one. She deals in a number of businesses such as retail shop, poultry and taxi businesses which have enabled her to educate her children and live a modest life, however her ambition is to own a another taxi. Irene needs the loan to buy a taxi.

loans.use: Purchasing a taxi for business

loans.name: Eiby Melissa

texts.es:
la señora Eiby Melissa H. tiene 27 años de edad, esta casada y tiene dos hijos, Eiby se dedica al comercio desde hace dos años tiene una pulperia en su casa de habitacion, sus clientes son los vecinos y otras personas que trabajan cerca de la zona.
Su esposo es comerciante, vende pescados.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia para surtir su negocio un poco mas, ya que en esta epoca la exigencias de sus clientes son mayores y necesita estar preparada para cumplirles con todo lo que necesitan.
las ganancias las necesita para salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Eiby Melissa H. is 27 years old.  She is married and has two children.  Eiby has been selling for two years.  She has a small grocery store in her home.  Her customers are neighbors and other people who work near the area.  Her husband is a salesman.  He sells fish.

Eiby will use her loan to buy merchandise to stock her business a little more since her customers' demands are higher during this period and she needs to be prepared to fill their demands with everything they need.  She needs the profits from her business to get her family ahead.

loans.use: To buy butter, rice, beans, corn flour, wheat flour, coffee, cookies, juices, soft drinks, pasta, sauces, soups, cereal, oats, batteries, candles, matches, toilet paper, soap, sanitary towels, toothpaste, chilis and sardines

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is a twenty-seven year-old hardworking married man with two children living in a rented house in Kamwenge Uganda. His ambition is to build his own house. He has been trading in produce for three years and the business is very profitable amidst the challenge of price fluctuation. Stephen needs the loan to buy maize and beans for sale.

loans.use: Buying maize and beans for sell.

loans.name: Jose Celino

texts.es:
don Jose Celino M. vive En el Barrio el Centro el Triunfo Choluteca y se dedica al procesamiento y venta de semillas de marañon, este producto tiene demanda ya que es muy sabroso.
Jose es padre de 6 hijos los cuales ya son adultos.
junto con su esposa trabajan duro para cubrir sus gastos personales y los gastos del hogar.
Jose todos los dias se levanta a las 5 de la mañana  para  salir a vender sus semillas en caserios cercanos.
su tiempo libre se lo dedica a su esposa.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de semillas de marañon para luego procesarlas y venderlas, este tipo de producto al final del proceso quedan como cacahuates crujientes y saladitos.
texts.en:
Mr. Jose Celino M. lives in the center of Triunfo, Choluteca. He processes and sells cashews. There is demand for this product, since it is delicious. Jose is the father of 6 children, who are already adults. Together with his wife, they work hard to meet their personal and household expenses.  Jose gets up at 5 every day to go out and sell his nuts in nearby villages. 

He dedicates his free time to his wife. 

He will use the loan to buy cashews, in order to later process and sell them. At the end of the process, the final product is like crunchy and salty peanuts.

loans.use: To buy cashews

loans.name: Alejandro Enrique

texts.es: El Sr .Alejandro labora como fontanero de sistema de agua tiene cinco hijo, es el primer crédito que CEPRODEL le otorga el sr. siente que es un gran apoyo lo que está haciendo esta institución con este  desembolso para lograra comprar materiales de construcción para realizar un anexo en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Anselmo works as a plumber.  He has five children.  This is the first loan CEPRODEL has granted.

He feels that what the institution is doing is a great help.

He will use this disbursement to buy building materials and supplies to add a room to his house.

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies for home improvements.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
Rosa María es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Kantutitas de Camicachi II” ubicado en el distrito de Ilave, provincia El Collao y departamento de Puno, tiene 27 años de edad, está casada y tiene 02 hijos.  Sólo estudió hasta 5º de educación secundaria. 
Hace un año y medio viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que utilizó en su negocio de venta de animales  como vacunos, ovinos, etc.
Con este préstamo de S/. 2000.00 nuevos soles, comprará cuatro cabezas de vaca lechera y 1 chancho.  También cuenta que trabaja en la chacra junto con su esposo.
Su sueño es mejorar el ganado, tener una casa grande y un carro.	
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal son las reuniones y la capacitación que recibe por parte de su promotora.
texts.en:
Rosa María is a member of the "Las Kantutitas de Camicachi II” community bank which is located in Ilave district, in El Collao province, in Puno department.  She is 27 years old, married, and has 2 children.  She only studied up to the fifth year of her secondary education.

Rosa María has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for one and a half years.  Her first loan was for 500 Peruvian soles and she used that money in her business selling animals such as cattle, sheep, etc.

Rosa María will use this loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles to buy four head of dairy cows and one pig.  She also tells us that she works on the farm together with her husband.  Her dream is to improve her livestock and to own a large house and a car.

What Rosa María likes about her community bank are the meetings and the training that she receives.

loans.use: To buy four head of dairy cows and one pig

loans.name: Monique

texts.en: Monique is 32 years old and married with two children between 3 and 8 years old. Monique owns a business selling beans, and her shop is open from 8am to 6pm. She has four years of experience in this business and works every day except the weekends. She has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company to increase her business by purchasing more beans to sell.

loans.use: To buy more beans to sell

loans.name: Tula

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” MOSOQ RUNA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco,  perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra.Tula; la socia tiene 52 años de edad, casada y tiene 1 hijo; la socia trabaja en el sector turismo en una empresa privada ella es licenciada en turismo, la socia es una persona bien alegre y responsable, mediante su trabajo ella saca a su familia adelante y ahora más que nunca ya que su hijo termino la universidad y necesita para que haga su tesis.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la los estudios de su hijo mayor (tesis).

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
She belongs to the communal bank named "Mosoq Runa". It is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the province of Cusco in the department of Cusco. 

Her name is Tula. She is 52 years old, married, and she has 1 child. She works in the tourism sector for a private company which is licensed in tourism. She is a very happy and responsible person and through her employment she is able to support her family, now more than ever especially because her son has finished university and he needs her support to do his thesis. 

She requests a loan to cover her sons' studies (thesis). 

She is happy with the loan and she is committed to making the payments.

loans.use: to pay for her son's tuition expenses

loans.name: Kotognogontala. Group

texts.fr:
KOTOGNOGONTALA est un groupe constitué de 4 femmes mariées qui ont en moyenne  36  ans, 4 enfants et qui vivent la plupart dans des  familles polygames à HAMDALLAYE, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Les prêts antérieurs ont été correctement remboursés.
AWA C. est la vendeuse d’habits de ce groupe de femmes KOTOGNOGONTALA. 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt une cinquantaine de mètre de bazin. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Sikasso ville. Elle les revend de façon ambulante dans les différents quartiers de la ville de Sikasso, sur commande et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 27.000FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et  pour épargne.
Elle ambitionne d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Kotognogontala is a group of four married women, who are in average 36 years old, have four children and mostly live in polygamous families in Hamdallaye, one of the neighborhoods of the city of Sikasso, third administrative region of Mali.
They are requesting their fifth loan from the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, in order to improve their business. The previous loans were fully repaid. Awa C. is a member of the group and she sells clothes.
With her loan she wants to buy fifty meters of damask. She purchases her supplies at the big market of Sikasso and she sells them door to door in the different neighborhoods of the city of Sikasso, to a clientele composed of men and women and she accepts only cash payments.
She expects to earn an average monthly profit of 27.000 FCFA, part of which will be used to pay back the loan and invested in savings.
She aims to improve her business to better satisfy her customers

loans.use: to purchase damask

loans.name: Narantsetseg

texts.en:
Narantsetseg is 39 years old and lives with her husband and three children in a house in Dornod province of Mongolia. Her older daughter is a student and the younger two are pupils. Her husband is a sculptor who is planning to start his own business in the near future.

 Narantsetseg manages a grocery trading business in her town. She started her business in 2009 in a rented stall at a grocery trading center. Within three years of business operation, she managed to expand and stabilize her business and opened her own grocery store. She is planning to deposit her business earnings in savings to buy a car in the future. 

 Narantsetseg is a diligent woman who attributes her business success to her good communication skills. She says, "I would like my children to be educated and have a nice life." She is requesting an 800,000 MNT of loan to purchase more grocery goods.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery goods.

loans.name: Suon

texts.en: The woman in the photo is Suon S. A., aged 49, who lives in Prey Chor of Kompong Cham. She earns a living raising pigs as well as growing rice. Since 1990, she has run this business and it has provided her with income to maintain her standard of living. She is married with seven children: two of her children work in different occupations. Her husband helps her in the business. Suon S. A. will be using the loan to buy more pig-feed for her pig raising. She will use the rest of loan to grow rice and pay for plowing.

loans.use: to buy more pig-feed and to grow rice and pay plowing costs.

loans.name: Jose Carlos

texts.es:
José, vive junto a su esposa y dos hijos de 4 y 1 año de edad, él es un agricultor dedicado a sembrar maíz y frijol, tiene 15 años de trabajar y aprendió por su padre, su horario es de 6:00am a 3:00pm.
El solicita un préstamo para la compra de abono y tratamiento para plagas, este préstamo le ayudara  para cubrir los gastos del inicio de la siembra.
Su objetivo es sacar adelante a sus hijos, que crezcan sanos y puedan estudiar.
texts.en:
José lives with his wife and two children, ages 4 and 1.  He is a farmer who grows corn and beans.  He has been working for 15 years, and learned his trade from his father.  His schedule is from 6am to 3pm.  

José is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizer and pesticide.  This loan will help him to cover his expenses at the beginning of the planting season.   

His goal is to help his children get ahead, so they grow up healthy and can attend school.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pesticide.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Guadalupe Herminia

texts.es:
Guadalupe, vive con su esposo y un hijo D. 26 años  D. edad, ella se dedica al comercio D. calzado y ropa, dicho negocio lo tiene instalado en el mercado municipal, su horario D. atención es D. 6:00am a 6:00pm, lo inicio hace 20 años.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra D. blusas, faldas, camisas formales, pantalones, también zapatos formales y tacos D. futbol. Esta inversión le ayudara a crecer, ofrecerá más mercadería a los clientes y esto le servirá para crecer como comerciante.
Sus aspiraciones es tener el negocio fortalecido en ropa y calzado, mantener a los clientes satisfechos y D. esta manera mejorar la condición económica D. su familia.
texts.en:
Guadalupe lives with her husband and a 26-year-old son.  She sells footwear and clothes in a business located in the municipal market.  She is open from 6am until 6pm and started it 20 years ago.

She is asking for a loan to buy blouses, skirts, formal shirts, pants and formal shoes and football cleats.  This investment will help her grow; she will offer more merchandise to the customers and this will help her grow as a merchant.

Her goals are to have a strong clothing and footwear business, to keep her customers happy thus improving her family’s economic condition.

loans.use: to buy blouses, formal shirts and shoes and football cleats.

loans.name: Arcenia

texts.en:
Arcenia is 56 years old and married. She has six children.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Arcenia has been farming sugarcane for 16 years and also earns additional income from running a general store and a pig fattening business.

Arcenia is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to buy a vehicle for her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Dickson

texts.en:
Dickson is married and has three children aged 3 to 6. While operating his motorbike transport business for the last eight months, he has been driving many people to and from the busy Kibuye Market. Dickson also sells groceries in his community together with his wife. Dickson intends to use the loan to purchase trays of eggs that he intends to sell. He believes this will allow him to expand his business. 

Dickson hopes to expand his business so that he can employ more people. He describes himself as honest and respectful.

loans.use: to purchase trays of eggs that he intends to sell.

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecelia is married and has four children. Her husband is a farmer. For the past three years, Cecelia has been working as a seamstress. In addition, she sells cassava and plantain in the town of Elmina, a fishing community on the Cape Coast. Cecelia’s income helps pay utility bills and other household expenses. 

Cecelia is requesting a loan to buy more materials to sew and meet the demands of her customers. She hopes to use the profits from her business to build a shop.

loans.use: to buy materials to meet customer demand

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has four children. 

Estrella has a shop that sells canned goods, beverages, & snacks. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan for 10,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy more of the items she sells.

Estrella has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Estrella hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks

loans.name: Vencent

texts.en:
Vencent is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single with one child. 

Vencent is providing motorela or habal-habal services. He has had this business for five years. He requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy tools & pay for gasoline for his motorela services.

Vencent is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Vencent hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools & pay for gasoline

loans.name: Jean Claude Anastase

texts.fr:
Jean Claude Anastase  est née au Rwanda et a 37 ans. Ile est marie et il a 4 enfants de 2 à 12 ans, dont 3 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est 8 ans de primaire. 
Jean Claude Anastase  est commerçant de téléphone mobile et ses accessoires. C’est son cinquième  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit pour acheter 13 nouveaux téléphones Nokia, 10 nouveau téléphones Motorola, 25 carte Sim, 40 batteries des téléphones et pour augmenter son business.  
Son stratégie pour la croissance de son business est vendre des matériels de qualité pour attire la marché et avoir beaucoup des matériels pour son business. Dans les prochaines années, Jean Claude Anastase  voudrait se développer son projet et devenir un grand homme d’affaire. Avec les profits, il prévoit de payer les frais scolaires de ses enfants et bâtir sa propre maison commerciale.
texts.en:
Jean Claude Anastase  was born in Rwanda and is 37. He is married and has four children between 2 and 12, of whom three are in school. He got through eight years of primary school. 
 
Jean Claude Anastase  sells cell phones and accessories. This is his fifth loan with ACB. He is going to use his loan to buy 13 new Nokia phones, 10 new Motorola phones, 25 Sim rechargeable phone cards, and 40 telephone batteries and grow his business. 

His strategy for growing his business is to sell top-quality materials to attract clients and have a lot of inventory available. In the coming years, Jean Claude Anastase  would like to develop his business and become a big businessman. With his profit, he plans to pay school fees for his children and build his own store.

loans.use: to buy 13 new Nokia phones, 10 new Motorola phones, 25 Sim rechargeable phone cards, and 40 telephone batteries and grow his business.

loans.name: Crista Isabel

texts.es: Crista Isabel D. cuarenta y seis años D. edad vive con sus tres hijos menores D. edad que asisten a la escuela que se encuentra cerca D. donD. residen. Ella posee una panadería muy conocida en la localidad pues Crista prepara el pan más exquisito D. la zona, prepara diversidad D. pan como pastelitos, cachos, quesadillas, peperechas entre otros, y todo lo venD. a un buen precio además el servicio es excelente, Crista siempre está con una sonrisa en el rostro pues la alegría es su secreto en el trabajo, últimamente ha aumentado su demanda y quiere elaborar mas pan para siempre estar al frente D. la competencia y no decepcionar a los clientes es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar materia prima harina, azúcar, jaleas, colorantes, levadura, algunas bandejas entre otros. Crista Isabel tiene la esperanza que D. esta forma logrará llevar a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
46-year-old Crista Isabel lives with her three dependent children who attend a school near their home.  Crista owns a bakery which is very well known in her town as she makes the most delicious bread in her area.  She makes a range of different breads and pastries such as 'pastelitos' and 'cachos' (filled pastries), quesadillas and 'peperechas' (a traditional sweet bread).  She sells all of her products at a good price and provides excellent customer service.  Crista always has a smile on her lips.  Her cheerfulness is her traD. secret.

Lately, Crista has seen her demand increase and she would like to make more breads and pastries so that she can always be ahead of the competition and avoid disappointing her customers.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL which will allow her to buy raw materials such as flour, sugar, jelly, dyes, yeast and some trays.  Crista hopes that this will enable her to proviD. her household with financial security.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, jelly, dyes and yeast

loans.name: Annalyn

texts.en:
Annalyn is a very patient mother who does things the right way for the success of her family. At the age of 32, Annalyn already has four children. Annalyn makes dresses while she is at her sari-sari store where she sells eggs, canned goods, and fabric conditioner. 
With a vision and mission to respond to her duties and responsibilities to her family, Annalyn does as much as she can to achieve it. She wants to give opportunities to her children by sending them to finish their studies to provide for their future.
Annalyn wants to borrow P10,000 to buy noodles, cooking oil, and dried fish to satisfy the needs of her customers in the village. This loan will assist her in growing her business which would be beneficial to her success.

loans.use: to buy noodles, cooking oil, and dried fish to satisfy the needs of her customers in the village.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz is a hardworking mother of three. She is 51 years old. To provide sustenance for the needs of the family, she is selling fruits and vegetables to the people in her village. She is earning a daily income of PHP 300. She has been using her income as revolving capital to continuously operate the business and for daily meals and allowances of her children. 

She needs additional vegetables to sell. That is why she is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy cabbages, tomatoes, eggplants and squash to sell in the village.

In the future, she hopes to continuously earn an income to achieve financial stability.

loans.use: to buy cabbages, tomatoes, eggplant and squash to sell

loans.name: Felska

texts.en:
Felska is a 30-year-old divorced woman with two children. She rents a house in Kasese, Uganda. For the past five years, Felska has run a profitable produce business. Her major business hardship is the high cost of transportation to travel to different markets. 

Felska is requesting a loan to buy tomatoes to sell. In the future, she hopes to buy a refrigerator to preserve her tomatoes and she also wants to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy tomotoes

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 48 years old and is a window with one child who is 27 years old. She also takes care of three relatives. 

Florence owns a business selling potatoes. The hours of her business are from 6 am until 6 pm every day and she currently employs 2 people to help her. 

Florence has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to increase her business by buying more potatoes to sell. With any profit, she will be able to build a secure future for her business as well as for her family, and she will be able to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: buy potatoes to resell

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 65 years old.  She is married to James and together they have three children, aged 21, 25 and 19 years old.  She sells firewood and has been in this business for the past three years.  She gets a monthly income of KES 19,000.

This is Ruth's third term loan from KADET LTD.  She paid her previous loans successfully.  She will use the loan amount to purchase wood and firewood to supply to a school.  Her dream is become financially stable.

loans.use: buy firewood to resell

loans.name: Buenadilla

texts.en:
Buenadilla is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 
Buenadilla has a shop that provides tinsmith services. She has had this business for nine years. She requested a loan for 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy materials needed for her tinsmithing business.
Buenadilla became a member of HSPFI this year. In the future, Buenadilla hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for tinsmithing

loans.name: Ada Esmeralda

texts.es:
La señora Ada Esmeralda se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo diario, tiene una pulperia desde hace un año, sus negocio lo abre todos los dias de la semana, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en un buen punto,  es enfrente a la Calle principal de la colonia en donde vive y se encuentra cerca de la escuela, por lo que su negocio es muy visitado, Ada sale dos veces por semana al mercado para realizar las compras de algunos productos, otros se los llegan a dejar al negocio. 
el credito lo utilizara para invertirlo en la compra de productos como ser: frijoles, harina de maiz, arroz, huevos, refrescos, azúcar, manteca, aceite, candelas, leche entre otros.
doña Ada esta casada y su esposo trabaja en proyectos como maestro de obra y juntos trabajan duro para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Ada Esmeralda works selling daily necessities.  She has had a grocery store for a year.  She opens her business every day of the week.  It is located in a good spot, in front of the main street and near the school of the town where she lives, so the business is well visited.  Ana goes to the market twice a week to buy some products; others are delivered to her business.

She will use the loan to invest in buying products such as beans, corn flour, rice, eggs, soft drinks, sugar, lard, oil, candles, and milk, among others.

Ada is married and her husband works on projects as a foreman.  They work hard together to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy groceries, soft drinks, bread, dairy products, eggs, and powdered milk.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 45 years old and married with 3 children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

She has borrowed and paid back 23 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 12 years and also earns an income from motorcycle transport, pig fattening, electronic reloading and from buying and selling charcoal.

Josephine aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell.
